11 // CAREFUL: This file covers the emission phase of `ExportVerilog` which mainly
12 // walks the IR and produces output. Do NOT modify the IR during this walk, as
13 // emission occurs in a highly parallel fashion. If you need to modify the IR,
14 // do so during the preparation phase which lives in `PrepareForEmission.cpp`.

73 namespace {
74 /// This enum keeps track of the precedence level of various binary operators,
75 /// where a lower number binds tighter.
76 enum VerilogPrecedence {
77  // Normal precedence levels.
78  Symbol, // Atomic symbol like "foo" and {a,b}
79  Selection, // () , [] , :: , ., $signed()
80  Unary, // Unary operators like ~foo
81  Multiply, // * , / , %
82  Addition, // + , -
83  Shift, // << , >>, <<<, >>>
84  Comparison, // > , >= , < , <=
85  Equality, // == , !=
86  And, // &
87  Xor, // ^ , ^~
88  Or, // |
89  AndShortCircuit, // &&
90  Conditional, // ? :
91 
92  LowestPrecedence, // Sentinel which is always the lowest precedence.
93 };
94 
95 /// This enum keeps track of whether the emitted subexpression is signed or
96 /// unsigned as seen from the Verilog language perspective.
97 enum SubExprSignResult { IsSigned, IsUnsigned };
98 
99 /// This is information precomputed about each subexpression in the tree we
100 /// are emitting as a unit.
101 struct SubExprInfo {
102  /// The precedence of this expression.
103  VerilogPrecedence precedence;
104 
105  /// The signedness of the expression.
106  SubExprSignResult signedness;
107 
108  SubExprInfo(VerilogPrecedence precedence, SubExprSignResult signedness)
109  : precedence(precedence), signedness(signedness) {}
110 };

118 static TypedAttr getInt32Attr(MLIRContext *ctx, uint32_t value) {
119  return Builder(ctx).getI32IntegerAttr(value);

122 static TypedAttr getIntAttr(MLIRContext *ctx, Type t, const APInt &value) {
123  return Builder(ctx).getIntegerAttr(t, value);

126 /// Return true for nullary operations that are better emitted multiple
127 /// times as inline expression (when they have multiple uses) rather than having
128 /// a temporary wire.
129 ///
130 /// This can only handle nullary expressions, because we don't want to replicate
131 /// subtrees arbitrarily.
132 static bool isDuplicatableNullaryExpression(Operation *op) {
133  // We don't want wires that are just constants aesthetically.
134  if (isConstantExpression(op))
135  return true;
136 
137  // If this is a small verbatim expression with no side effects, duplicate it
138  // inline.
139  if (isa<VerbatimExprOp>(op)) {
140  if (op->getNumOperands() == 0 &&
141  op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("format_string").getValue().size() <= 32)
142  return true;
143  }
144 
145  // Always duplicate XMRs into their use site.
146  if (isa<XMRRefOp>(op))
147  return true;
148 
149  // If this is a macro reference without side effects, allow duplication.
150  if (isa<MacroRefExprOp>(op))
151  return true;
152 
153  return false;
154 }
155 
156 // Return true if the expression can be inlined even when the op has multiple
157 // uses. Be careful to add operations here since it might cause exponential
158 // emission without proper restrictions.
159 static bool isDuplicatableExpression(Operation *op) {
160  if (op->getNumOperands() == 0)
161  return isDuplicatableNullaryExpression(op);
162 
163  // It is cheap to inline extract op.
164  if (isa<comb::ExtractOp, hw::StructExtractOp, hw::UnionExtractOp>(op))
165  return true;
166 
167  // We only inline array_get with a constant, port or wire index.
168  if (auto array = dyn_cast<hw::ArrayGetOp>(op)) {
169  auto *indexOp = array.getIndex().getDefiningOp();
170  if (!indexOp || isa<ConstantOp>(indexOp))
171  return true;
172  if (auto read = dyn_cast<ReadInOutOp>(indexOp)) {
173  auto *readSrc = read.getInput().getDefiningOp();
174  // A port or wire is ok to duplicate reads.
175  return !readSrc || isa<sv::WireOp, LogicOp>(readSrc);
176  }
177 
178  return false;
179  }
180 
181  return false;
182 }

184 /// Return the verilog name of the operations that can define a symbol.
185 /// Legalized names are added to "hw.verilogName" so look up it when the
186 /// attribute already exists.
187 StringRef ExportVerilog::getSymOpName(Operation *symOp) {
188  // Typeswitch of operation types which can define a symbol.
189  // If legalizeNames has renamed it, then the attribute must be set.
190  if (auto attr = symOp->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("hw.verilogName"))
191  return attr.getValue();
192  return TypeSwitch<Operation *, StringRef>(symOp)
193  .Case<HWModuleOp, HWModuleExternOp, HWModuleGeneratedOp>(
194  [](Operation *op) { return getVerilogModuleName(op); })
195  .Case<InterfaceOp>([&](InterfaceOp op) {
196  return getVerilogModuleNameAttr(op).getValue();
197  })
198  .Case<InterfaceSignalOp>(
199  [&](InterfaceSignalOp op) { return op.getSymName(); })
200  .Case<InterfaceModportOp>(
201  [&](InterfaceModportOp op) { return op.getSymName(); })
202  .Default([&](Operation *op) {
203  if (auto attr = op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("name"))
204  return attr.getValue();
205  if (auto attr = op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("instanceName"))
206  return attr.getValue();
207  if (auto attr = op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("sv.namehint"))
208  return attr.getValue();
209  if (auto attr =
210  op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>(SymbolTable::getSymbolAttrName()))
211  return attr.getValue();
212  return StringRef("");
213  });
214 }

231  return hml.getPort(hml.getHWModuleType().getPortIdForInputId(portArgNum))

235 /// This predicate returns true if the specified operation is considered a
236 /// potentially inlinable Verilog expression. These nodes always have a single
237 /// result, but may have side effects (e.g. `sv.verbatim.expr.se`).
238 /// MemoryEffects should be checked if a client cares.
239 bool ExportVerilog::isVerilogExpression(Operation *op) {
240  // These are SV dialect expressions.
241  if (isa<ReadInOutOp, AggregateConstantOp, ArrayIndexInOutOp,
242  IndexedPartSelectInOutOp, StructFieldInOutOp, IndexedPartSelectOp,
243  ParamValueOp, XMROp, XMRRefOp, SampledOp, EnumConstantOp,
244  SystemFunctionOp>(op))
245  return true;
246 
247  // All HW combinational logic ops and SV expression ops are Verilog
248  // expressions.
249  return isCombinational(op) || isExpression(op);
250 }

252 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
253 /// Push this type's dimension into a vector.
254 static void getTypeDims(SmallVectorImpl<Attribute> &dims, Type type,
255  Location loc) {
256  if (auto integer = hw::type_dyn_cast<IntegerType>(type)) {
257  if (integer.getWidth() != 1)
258  dims.push_back(getInt32Attr(type.getContext(), integer.getWidth()));
259  return;
260  }
261  if (auto array = hw::type_dyn_cast<ArrayType>(type)) {
262  dims.push_back(getInt32Attr(type.getContext(), array.getNumElements()));
263  getTypeDims(dims, array.getElementType(), loc);
264 
265  return;
266  }
267  if (auto intType = hw::type_dyn_cast<IntType>(type)) {
268  dims.push_back(intType.getWidth());
269  return;
270  }
271 
272  if (auto inout = hw::type_dyn_cast<InOutType>(type))
273  return getTypeDims(dims, inout.getElementType(), loc);
274  if (auto uarray = hw::type_dyn_cast<hw::UnpackedArrayType>(type))
275  return getTypeDims(dims, uarray.getElementType(), loc);
276  if (hw::type_isa<InterfaceType, StructType, EnumType>(type))
277  return;
278 
279  mlir::emitError(loc, "value has an unsupported verilog type ") << type;
280 }
281 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)
282 
283 /// True iff 'a' and 'b' have the same wire dims.
284 static bool haveMatchingDims(Type a, Type b, Location loc) {
285  SmallVector<Attribute, 4> aDims;
286  getTypeDims(aDims, a, loc);
287 
288  SmallVector<Attribute, 4> bDims;
289  getTypeDims(bDims, b, loc);
290 
291  return aDims == bDims;
292 }
293 
294 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
295 bool ExportVerilog::isZeroBitType(Type type) {
296  type = getCanonicalType(type);
297  if (auto intType = type.dyn_cast<IntegerType>())
298  return intType.getWidth() == 0;
299  if (auto inout = type.dyn_cast<hw::InOutType>())
300  return isZeroBitType(inout.getElementType());
301  if (auto uarray = type.dyn_cast<hw::UnpackedArrayType>())
302  return uarray.getNumElements() == 0 ||
303  isZeroBitType(uarray.getElementType());
304  if (auto array = type.dyn_cast<hw::ArrayType>())
305  return array.getNumElements() == 0 || isZeroBitType(array.getElementType());
306  if (auto structType = type.dyn_cast<hw::StructType>())
307  return llvm::all_of(structType.getElements(),
308  [](auto elem) { return isZeroBitType(elem.type); });
309  if (auto enumType = type.dyn_cast<hw::EnumType>())
310  return enumType.getFields().empty();
311  if (auto unionType = type.dyn_cast<hw::UnionType>())
312  return hw::getBitWidth(unionType) == 0;
313 
314  // We have an open type system, so assume it is ok.
315  return false;
316 }
317 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)
318 
319 /// Given a set of known nested types (those supported by this pass), strip off
320 /// leading unpacked types. This strips off portions of the type that are
321 /// printed to the right of the name in verilog.
322 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
323 static Type stripUnpackedTypes(Type type) {
324  return TypeSwitch<Type, Type>(type)
325  .Case<InOutType>([](InOutType inoutType) {
326  return stripUnpackedTypes(inoutType.getElementType());
327  })
328  .Case<UnpackedArrayType>([](UnpackedArrayType arrayType) {
329  return stripUnpackedTypes(arrayType.getElementType());
330  })
331  .Default([](Type type) { return type; });
332 }
333 
334 /// Return true if type has a struct type as a subtype.
335 static bool hasStructType(Type type) {
336  return TypeSwitch<Type, bool>(type)
337  .Case<InOutType, UnpackedArrayType, ArrayType>([](auto parentType) {
338  return hasStructType(parentType.getElementType());
339  })
340  .Case<StructType>([](auto) { return true; })
341  .Default([](auto) { return false; });
342 }
343 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)
344 
345 /// Return the word (e.g. "reg") in Verilog to declare the specified thing.
346 static StringRef getVerilogDeclWord(Operation *op,
347  const LoweringOptions &options) {
348  if (isa<RegOp>(op)) {
349  // Check if the type stored in this register is a struct or array of
350  // structs. In this case, according to spec section 6.8, the "reg" prefix
351  // should be left off.
352  auto elementType =
353  op->getResult(0).getType().cast<InOutType>().getElementType();
354  if (elementType.isa<StructType>())
355  return "";
356  if (elementType.isa<UnionType>())
357  return "";
358  if (elementType.isa<EnumType>())
359  return "";
360  if (auto innerType = elementType.dyn_cast<ArrayType>()) {
361  while (innerType.getElementType().isa<ArrayType>())
362  innerType = innerType.getElementType().cast<ArrayType>();
363  if (innerType.getElementType().isa<StructType>() ||
364  innerType.getElementType().isa<TypeAliasType>())
365  return "";
366  }
367  if (elementType.isa<TypeAliasType>())
368  return "";
369 
370  return "reg";
371  }
372  if (isa<sv::WireOp>(op))
373  return "wire";
374  if (isa<ConstantOp, AggregateConstantOp, LocalParamOp, ParamValueOp>(op))
375  return "localparam";
376 
377  // Interfaces instances use the name of the declared interface.
378  if (auto interface = dyn_cast<InterfaceInstanceOp>(op))
379  return interface.getInterfaceType().getInterface().getValue();
380 
381  // If 'op' is in a module, output 'wire'. If 'op' is in a procedural block,
382  // fall through to default.
383  bool isProcedural = op->getParentOp()->hasTrait<ProceduralRegion>();
384 
385  if (isa<LogicOp>(op)) {
386  // If the logic op is defined in a procedural region, add 'automatic'
387  // keyword. If the op has a struct type, 'logic' keyword is already emitted
388  // within a struct type definition (e.g. struct packed {logic foo;}). So we
389  // should not emit extra 'logic'.
390  bool hasStruct = hasStructType(op->getResult(0).getType());
391  if (isProcedural)
392  return hasStruct ? "automatic" : "automatic logic";
393  return hasStruct ? "" : "logic";
394  }
395 
396  if (!isProcedural)
397  return "wire";
398 
399  // "automatic" values aren't allowed in disallowLocalVariables mode.
400  assert(!options.disallowLocalVariables && "automatic variables not allowed");
401 
402  // If the type contains a struct type, we have to use only "automatic" because
403  // "automatic struct" is syntactically correct.
404  return hasStructType(op->getResult(0).getType()) ? "automatic"
405  : "automatic logic";
406 }

408 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
409 // Location comparison
410 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
411 
412 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
413 
414 static int compareLocs(Location lhs, Location rhs);
415 
416 // NameLoc comparator - compare names, then child locations.
417 static int compareLocsImpl(mlir::NameLoc lhs, mlir::NameLoc rhs) {
418  if (auto name = lhs.getName().compare(rhs.getName()))
419  return name;
420  return compareLocs(lhs.getChildLoc(), rhs.getChildLoc());
421 }
422 
423 // FileLineColLoc comparator.
424 static int compareLocsImpl(mlir::FileLineColLoc lhs, mlir::FileLineColLoc rhs) {
425  if (auto fn = lhs.getFilename().compare(rhs.getFilename()))
426  return fn;
427  if (lhs.getLine() != rhs.getLine())
428  return lhs.getLine() < rhs.getLine() ? -1 : 1;
429  return lhs.getColumn() < rhs.getColumn() ? -1 : 1;
430 }
431 
432 // CallSiteLoc comparator. Compare first on the callee, then on the caller.
433 static int compareLocsImpl(mlir::CallSiteLoc lhs, mlir::CallSiteLoc rhs) {
434  Location lhsCallee = lhs.getCallee();
435  Location rhsCallee = rhs.getCallee();
436  if (auto res = compareLocs(lhsCallee, rhsCallee))
437  return res;
438 
439  Location lhsCaller = lhs.getCaller();
440  Location rhsCaller = rhs.getCaller();
441  return compareLocs(lhsCaller, rhsCaller);
442 }
443 
444 template <typename TTargetLoc>
445 FailureOr<int> dispatchCompareLocations(Location lhs, Location rhs) {
446  auto lhsT = dyn_cast<TTargetLoc>(lhs);
447  auto rhsT = dyn_cast<TTargetLoc>(rhs);
448  if (lhsT && rhsT) {
449  // Both are of the target location type, compare them directly.
450  return compareLocsImpl(lhsT, rhsT);
451  }
452  if (lhsT) {
453  // lhs is TTargetLoc => it comes before rhs.
454  return -1;
455  }
456  if (rhsT) {
457  // rhs is TTargetLoc => it comes before lhs.
458  return 1;
459  }
460 
461  return failure();
462 }
463 
464 // Top-level comparator for two arbitrarily typed locations.
465 // First order comparison by location type:
466 // 1. FileLineColLoc
467 // 2. NameLoc
468 // 3. CallSiteLoc
469 // 4. Anything else...
470 // Intra-location type comparison is delegated to the corresponding
471 // compareLocsImpl() function.
472 static int compareLocs(Location lhs, Location rhs) {
473  // FileLineColLoc
474  if (auto res = dispatchCompareLocations<mlir::FileLineColLoc>(lhs, rhs);
475  succeeded(res))
476  return *res;
477 
478  // NameLoc
479  if (auto res = dispatchCompareLocations<mlir::NameLoc>(lhs, rhs);
480  succeeded(res))
481  return *res;
482 
483  // CallSiteLoc
484  if (auto res = dispatchCompareLocations<mlir::CallSiteLoc>(lhs, rhs);
485  succeeded(res))
486  return *res;
487 
488  // Anything else...
489  return 0;
490 }

492 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)

497 
498 /// Pull apart any fused locations into the location set, such that they are
499 /// uniqued. Any other location type will be added as-is.
500 static void collectAndUniqueLocations(Location loc,
501  SmallPtrSetImpl<Attribute> &locationSet) {
502  llvm::TypeSwitch<Location, void>(loc)
503  .Case<FusedLoc>([&](auto fusedLoc) {
504  for (auto subLoc : fusedLoc.getLocations())
505  collectAndUniqueLocations(subLoc, locationSet);
506  })
507  .Default([&](auto loc) { locationSet.insert(loc); });
508 }
509 
510 // Sorts a vector of locations in-place.
511 template <typename TVector>
512 static void sortLocationVector(TVector &vec) {
513  llvm::array_pod_sort(
514  vec.begin(), vec.end(), [](const auto *lhs, const auto *rhs) -> int {
515  return compareLocs(cast<Location>(*lhs), cast<Location>(*rhs));
516  });
517 }
518 
519 class LocationEmitter {
520 public:
521  // Generates location info for a single location in the specified style.
522  LocationEmitter(LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle style, Location loc) {
523  SmallPtrSet<Attribute, 8> locationSet;
524  locationSet.insert(loc);
525  llvm::raw_string_ostream os(output);
526  emitLocationSetInfo(os, style, locationSet);
527  }
528 
529  // Generates location info for a set of operations in the specified style.
530  LocationEmitter(LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle style,
531  const SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &ops) {
532  // Multiple operations may come from the same location or may not have
533  // useful
534  // location info. Unique it now.
535  SmallPtrSet<Attribute, 8> locationSet;
536  for (auto *op : ops)
537  collectAndUniqueLocations(op->getLoc(), locationSet);
538  llvm::raw_string_ostream os(output);
539  emitLocationSetInfo(os, style, locationSet);
540  }
541 
542  StringRef strref() { return output; }
543 
544 private:
545  void emitLocationSetInfo(llvm::raw_string_ostream &os,
546  LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle style,
547  const SmallPtrSetImpl<Attribute> &locationSet) {
548  if (style == LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle::None)
549  return;
550  std::string resstr;
551  llvm::raw_string_ostream sstr(resstr);
552  LocationEmitter::Impl(sstr, style, locationSet);
553  if (resstr.empty() || style == LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle::Plain) {
554  os << resstr;
555  return;
556  }
557  assert(style == LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle::WrapInAtSquareBracket &&
558  "other styles must be already handled");
559  os << "@[" << resstr << "]";
560  }
561 
562  std::string output;
563 
564  struct Impl {
565 
566  // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
567  Impl(llvm::raw_string_ostream &os, LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle style,
568  const SmallPtrSetImpl<Attribute> &locationSet)
569  : os(os), style(style) {
570  emitLocationSetInfoImpl(locationSet);
571  }
572 
573  // Emit CallSiteLocs.
574  void emitLocationInfo(mlir::CallSiteLoc loc) {
575  os << "{";
576  emitLocationInfo(loc.getCallee());
577  os << " <- ";
578  emitLocationInfo(loc.getCaller());
579  os << "}";
580  }
581 
582  // Emit NameLocs.
583  void emitLocationInfo(mlir::NameLoc loc) {
584  bool withName = !loc.getName().empty();
585  if (withName)
586  os << "'" << loc.getName().strref() << "'(";
587  emitLocationInfo(loc.getChildLoc());
588 
589  if (withName)
590  os << ")";
591  }
592 
593  // Emit FileLineColLocs.
594  void emitLocationInfo(FileLineColLoc loc) {
595  os << loc.getFilename().getValue();
596  if (auto line = loc.getLine()) {
597  os << ':' << line;
598  if (auto col = loc.getColumn())
599  os << ':' << col;
600  }
601  }
602 
603  // Generates a string representation of a set of FileLineColLocs.
604  // The entries are sorted by filename, line, col. Try to merge together
605  // entries to reduce verbosity on the column info.
606  void
607  printFileLineColSetInfo(llvm::SmallVector<FileLineColLoc, 8> locVector) {
608  // The entries are sorted by filename, line, col. Try to merge together
609  // entries to reduce verbosity on the column info.
610  StringRef lastFileName;
611  for (size_t i = 0, e = locVector.size(); i != e;) {
612  if (i != 0)
613  os << ", ";
614 
615  // Print the filename if it changed.
616  auto first = locVector[i];
617  if (first.getFilename() != lastFileName) {
618  lastFileName = first.getFilename();
619  os << lastFileName;
620  }
621 
622  // Scan for entries with the same file/line.
623  size_t end = i + 1;
624  while (end != e &&
625  first.getFilename() == locVector[end].getFilename() &&
626  first.getLine() == locVector[end].getLine())
627  ++end;
628 
629  // If we have one entry, print it normally.
630  if (end == i + 1) {
631  if (auto line = first.getLine()) {
632  os << ':' << line;
633  if (auto col = first.getColumn())
634  os << ':' << col;
635  }
636  ++i;
637  continue;
638  }
639 
640  // Otherwise print a brace enclosed list.
641  os << ':' << first.getLine() << ":{";
642  while (i != end) {
643  os << locVector[i++].getColumn();
644 
645  if (i != end)
646  os << ',';
647  }
648  os << '}';
649  }
650  }
651 
652  /// Return the location information in the specified style. This is the main
653  /// dispatch function for calling the location-specific routines.
654  void emitLocationInfo(Location loc) {
655  llvm::TypeSwitch<Location, void>(loc)
656  .Case<mlir::CallSiteLoc, mlir::NameLoc, mlir::FileLineColLoc>(
657  [&](auto loc) { emitLocationInfo(loc); })
658  .Case<mlir::FusedLoc>([&](auto loc) {
659  SmallPtrSet<Attribute, 8> locationSet;
660  collectAndUniqueLocations(loc, locationSet);
661  emitLocationSetInfoImpl(locationSet);
662  })
663  .Default([&](auto loc) {
664  // Don't print anything for unhandled locations.
665  });
666  }
667 
668  /// Emit the location information of `locationSet` to `sstr`. The emitted
669  /// string
670  /// may potentially be an empty string given the contents of the
671  /// `locationSet`.
672  void
673  emitLocationSetInfoImpl(const SmallPtrSetImpl<Attribute> &locationSet) {
674  // Fast pass some common cases.
675  switch (locationSet.size()) {
676  case 1:
677  emitLocationInfo(cast<LocationAttr>(*locationSet.begin()));
678  [[fallthrough]];
679  case 0:
680  return;
681  default:
682  break;
683  }
684 
685  // Sort the entries into distinct location printing kinds.
686  SmallVector<FileLineColLoc, 8> flcLocs;
687  SmallVector<Attribute, 8> otherLocs;
688  flcLocs.reserve(locationSet.size());
689  otherLocs.reserve(locationSet.size());
690  for (Attribute loc : locationSet) {
691  if (auto flcLoc = loc.dyn_cast<FileLineColLoc>())
692  flcLocs.push_back(flcLoc);
693  else
694  otherLocs.push_back(loc);
695  }
696 
697  // SmallPtrSet iteration is non-deterministic, so sort the location
698  // vectors to ensure deterministic output.
699  sortLocationVector(otherLocs);
700  sortLocationVector(flcLocs);
701 
702  // To detect whether something actually got emitted, we inspect the stream
703  // for size changes. This is due to the possiblity of locations which are
704  // not supposed to be emitted (e.g. `loc("")`).
705  size_t sstrSize = os.tell();
706  bool emittedAnything = false;
707  auto recheckEmittedSomething = [&]() {
708  size_t currSize = os.tell();
709  bool emittedSomethingSinceLastCheck = currSize != sstrSize;
710  emittedAnything |= emittedSomethingSinceLastCheck;
711  sstrSize = currSize;
712  return emittedSomethingSinceLastCheck;
713  };
714 
715  // First, emit the other locations through the generic location dispatch
716  // function.
717  llvm::interleave(
718  otherLocs,
719  [&](Attribute loc) { emitLocationInfo(cast<LocationAttr>(loc)); },
720  [&] {
721  if (recheckEmittedSomething()) {
722  os << ", ";
723  recheckEmittedSomething(); // reset detector to reflect the comma.
724  }
725  });
726 
727  // If we emitted anything, and we have FileLineColLocs, then emit a
728  // location-separating comma.
729  if (emittedAnything && !flcLocs.empty())
730  os << ", ";
731  // Then, emit the FileLineColLocs.
732  printFileLineColSetInfo(flcLocs);
733  }
734  llvm::raw_string_ostream &os;
735  LoweringOptions::LocationInfoStyle style;
736 
737  // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)
738  };
739 };
740 
741 /// Most expressions are invalid to bit-select from in Verilog, but some
742 /// things are ok. Return true if it is ok to inline bitselect from the
743 /// result of this expression. It is conservatively correct to return false.
744 static bool isOkToBitSelectFrom(Value v) {
745  // Module ports are always ok to bit select from.
746  if (v.isa<BlockArgument>())
747  return true;
748 
749  // Read_inout is valid to inline for bit-select. See `select` syntax on
750  // SV spec A.8.4 (P1174).
751  if (auto read = v.getDefiningOp<ReadInOutOp>())
752  return true;
753 
754  // Aggregate access can be inlined.
755  if (isa_and_nonnull<StructExtractOp, UnionExtractOp, ArrayGetOp>(
756  v.getDefiningOp()))
757  return true;
758 
759  // Interface signal can be inlined.
760  if (v.getDefiningOp<ReadInterfaceSignalOp>())
761  return true;
762 
763  // TODO: We could handle concat and other operators here.
764  return false;
765 }
766 
767 /// Return true if we are unable to ever inline the specified operation. This
768 /// happens because not all Verilog expressions are composable, notably you
769 /// can only use bit selects like x[4:6] on simple expressions, you cannot use
770 /// expressions in the sensitivity list of always blocks, etc.
771 static bool isExpressionUnableToInline(Operation *op,
772  const LoweringOptions &options) {
773  if (auto cast = dyn_cast<BitcastOp>(op))
774  if (!haveMatchingDims(cast.getInput().getType(), cast.getResult().getType(),
775  op->getLoc())) {
776  // Even if dimentions don't match, we can inline when its user doesn't
777  // rely on the type.
778  if (op->hasOneUse() &&
779  isa<comb::ConcatOp, hw::ArrayConcatOp>(*op->getUsers().begin()))
780  return false;
781  // Bitcasts rely on the type being assigned to, so we cannot inline.
782  return true;
783  }
784 
785  // StructCreateOp needs to be assigning to a named temporary so that types
786  // are inferred properly by verilog
787  if (isa<StructCreateOp, UnionCreateOp>(op))
788  return true;
789 
790  // Aggregate literal syntax only works in an assignment expression, where
791  // the Verilog expression's type is determined by the LHS.
792  if (auto aggConstantOp = dyn_cast<AggregateConstantOp>(op))
793  return true;
794 
795  // Verbatim with a long string should be emitted as an out-of-line declration.
796  if (auto verbatim = dyn_cast<VerbatimExprOp>(op))
797  if (verbatim.getFormatString().size() > 32)
798  return true;
799 
800  // Scan the users of the operation to see if any of them need this to be
801  // emitted out-of-line.
802  for (auto &use : op->getUses()) {
803  auto *user = use.getOwner();
804 
805  // Verilog bit selection is required by the standard to be:
806  // "a vector, packed array, packed structure, parameter or concatenation".
807  //
808  // It cannot be an arbitrary expression, e.g. this is invalid:
809  // assign bar = {{a}, {b}, {c}, {d}}[idx];
810  //
811  // To handle these, we push the subexpression into a temporary.
812  if (isa<ExtractOp, ArraySliceOp, ArrayGetOp, StructExtractOp,
813  UnionExtractOp, IndexedPartSelectOp>(user))
814  if (use.getOperandNumber() == 0 && // ignore index operands.
815  !isOkToBitSelectFrom(use.get()))
816  return true;
817 
818  // Handle option disallowing expressions in event control.
819  if (!options.allowExprInEventControl) {
820  // Check operations used for event control, anything other than
821  // a read of a wire must be out of line.
822 
823  // Helper to determine if the use will be part of "event control",
824  // based on what the operation using it is and as which operand.
825  auto usedInExprControl = [user, &use]() {
826  // "disable iff" condition must be a name.
827  if (auto disableOp = dyn_cast<ltl::DisableOp>(user))
828  return disableOp.getCondition() == use.get();
829  // LTL Clock up's clock operand must be a name.
830  if (auto clockOp = dyn_cast<ltl::ClockOp>(user))
831  return clockOp.getClock() == use.get();
832  // Always blocks must have a name in their sensitivity list.
833  // (all operands)
834  return isa<AlwaysOp, AlwaysFFOp>(user);
835  };
836 
837  if (!usedInExprControl())
838  continue;
839 
840  // Otherwise, this can only be inlined if is (already) a read of a wire.
841  auto read = dyn_cast<ReadInOutOp>(op);
842  if (!read)
843  return true;
844  if (!isa_and_nonnull<sv::WireOp, RegOp>(read.getInput().getDefiningOp()))
845  return true;
846  }
847  }
848  return false;
849 }
850 
851 enum class BlockStatementCount { Zero, One, TwoOrMore };
852 
853 /// Compute how many statements are within this block, for begin/end markers.
854 static BlockStatementCount countStatements(Block &block) {
855  unsigned numStatements = 0;
856  block.walk([&](Operation *op) {
857  if (isVerilogExpression(op) || isa<ltl::LTLDialect>(op->getDialect()))
858  return WalkResult::advance();
859  numStatements +=
860  TypeSwitch<Operation *, unsigned>(op)
861  .Case<VerbatimOp>([&](auto) {
862  // We don't know how many statements we emitted, so assume
863  // conservatively that a lot got put out. This will make sure we
864  // get a begin/end block around this.
865  return 3;
866  })
867  .Case<IfOp>([&](auto) {
868  // We count if as multiple statements to make sure it is always
869  // surrounded by a begin/end so we don't get if/else confusion in
870  // cases like this:
871  // if (cond)
872  // if (otherCond) // This should force a begin!
873  // stmt
874  // else // Goes with the outer if!
875  // thing;
876  return 2;
877  })
878  .Case<IfDefOp, IfDefProceduralOp>([&](auto) { return 3; })
879  .Case<OutputOp>([&](OutputOp oop) {
880  // Skip single-use instance outputs, they don't get statements.
881  // Keep this synchronized with visitStmt(InstanceOp,OutputOp).
882  return llvm::count_if(oop->getOperands(), [&](auto operand) {
883  Operation *op = operand.getDefiningOp();
884  return !operand.hasOneUse() || !op || !isa<HWInstanceLike>(op);
885  });
886  })
887  .Default([](auto) { return 1; });
888  if (numStatements > 1)
889  return WalkResult::interrupt();
890  return WalkResult::advance();
891  });
892  if (numStatements == 0)
893  return BlockStatementCount::Zero;
894  if (numStatements == 1)
895  return BlockStatementCount::One;
896  return BlockStatementCount::TwoOrMore;
897 }
898 
899 /// Return true if this expression should be emitted inline into any statement
900 /// that uses it.
901 bool ExportVerilog::isExpressionEmittedInline(Operation *op,
902  const LoweringOptions &options) {
903  // Never create a temporary for a dead expression.
904  if (op->getResult(0).use_empty())
905  return true;
906 
907  // Never create a temporary which is only going to be assigned to an output
908  // port, wire, or reg.
909  if (op->hasOneUse() &&
910  isa<hw::OutputOp, sv::AssignOp, sv::BPAssignOp, sv::PAssignOp>(
911  *op->getUsers().begin()))
912  return true;
913 
914  // If mux inlining is dissallowed, we cannot inline muxes.
915  if (options.disallowMuxInlining && isa<MuxOp>(op))
916  return false;
917 
918  // If this operation has multiple uses, we can't generally inline it unless
919  // the op is duplicatable.
920  if (!op->getResult(0).hasOneUse() && !isDuplicatableExpression(op))
921  return false;
922 
923  // If it isn't structurally possible to inline this expression, emit it out
924  // of line.
925  return !isExpressionUnableToInline(op, options);
926 }
927 
928 /// Find a nested IfOp in an else block that can be printed as `else if`
929 /// instead of nesting it into a new `begin` - `end` block. The block must
930 /// contain a single IfOp and optionally expressions which can be hoisted out.
931 static IfOp findNestedElseIf(Block *elseBlock) {
932  IfOp ifOp;
933  for (auto &op : *elseBlock) {
934  if (auto opIf = dyn_cast<IfOp>(op)) {
935  if (ifOp)
936  return {};
937  ifOp = opIf;
938  continue;
939  }
940  if (!isVerilogExpression(&op))
941  return {};
942  }
943  // SV attributes cannot be attached to `else if` so reject when ifOp has SV
944  // attributes.
945  if (ifOp && hasSVAttributes(ifOp))
946  return {};
947  return ifOp;
948 }
949 
950 /// Emit SystemVerilog attributes.
951 template <typename PPS>
952 static void emitSVAttributesImpl(PPS &ps, ArrayAttr attrs, bool mayBreak) {
953  enum Container { NoContainer, InComment, InAttr };
954  Container currentContainer = NoContainer;
955 
956  auto closeContainer = [&] {
957  if (currentContainer == NoContainer)
958  return;
959  if (currentContainer == InComment)
960  ps << " */";
961  else if (currentContainer == InAttr)
962  ps << " *)";
963  ps << PP::end << PP::end;
964 
965  currentContainer = NoContainer;
966  };
967 
968  bool isFirstContainer = true;
969  auto openContainer = [&](Container newContainer) {
970  assert(newContainer != NoContainer);
971  if (currentContainer == newContainer)
972  return false;
973  closeContainer();
974  // If not first container, insert break point but no space.
975  if (!isFirstContainer)
976  ps << (mayBreak ? PP::space : PP::nbsp);
977  isFirstContainer = false;
978  // fit container on one line if possible, break if needed.
979  ps << PP::ibox0;
980  if (newContainer == InComment)
981  ps << "/* ";
982  else if (newContainer == InAttr)
983  ps << "(* ";
984  currentContainer = newContainer;
985  // Pack attributes within to fit, align to current column when breaking.
986  ps << PP::ibox0;
987  return true;
988  };
989 
990  // Break containers to starting column (0), put all on same line OR
991  // put each on their own line (cbox).
992  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
993  for (auto attr : attrs.getAsRange<SVAttributeAttr>()) {
994  if (!openContainer(attr.getEmitAsComment().getValue() ? InComment
995  : InAttr))
996  ps << "," << (mayBreak ? PP::space : PP::nbsp);
997  ps << PPExtString(attr.getName().getValue());
998  if (attr.getExpression())
999  ps << " = " << PPExtString(attr.getExpression().getValue());
1000  }
1001  closeContainer();
1002  });
1003 }
1004 
1005 /// Retrieve value's verilog name from IR. The name must already have been
1006 /// added in pre-pass and passed through "hw.verilogName" attr.
1007 StringRef getVerilogValueName(Value val) {
1008  if (auto *op = val.getDefiningOp())
1009  return getSymOpName(op);
1010 
1011  if (auto port = val.dyn_cast<BlockArgument>()) {
1012  // If the value is defined by for op, use its associated verilog name.
1013  if (auto forOp = dyn_cast<ForOp>(port.getParentBlock()->getParentOp()))
1014  return forOp->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("hw.verilogName");
1015  return getInputPortVerilogName(port.getParentBlock()->getParentOp(),
1016  port.getArgNumber());
1017  }
1018  assert(false && "unhandled value");
1019  return {};
1020 }

1028 /// This class maintains the mutable state that cross-cuts and is shared by the
1029 /// various emitters.
1030 class VerilogEmitterState {
1031 public:
1032  explicit VerilogEmitterState(ModuleOp designOp,
1033  const SharedEmitterState &shared,
1034  const LoweringOptions &options,
1035  const HWSymbolCache &symbolCache,
1036  const GlobalNameTable &globalNames,
1037  const FileMapping &fileMapping,
1038  llvm::formatted_raw_ostream &os,
1039  StringAttr fileName, OpLocMap &verilogLocMap)
1040  : designOp(designOp), shared(shared), options(options),
1041  symbolCache(symbolCache), globalNames(globalNames),
1042  fileMapping(fileMapping), os(os), verilogLocMap(verilogLocMap),
1043  pp(os, options.emittedLineLength), fileName(fileName) {
1044  pp.setListener(&saver);
1045  }
1046  /// This is the root mlir::ModuleOp that holds the whole design being emitted.
1047  ModuleOp designOp;
1048 
1049  const SharedEmitterState &shared;
1050 
1051  /// The emitter options which control verilog emission.
1052  const LoweringOptions &options;
1053 
1054  /// This is a cache of various information about the IR, in frozen state.
1055  const HWSymbolCache &symbolCache;
1056 
1057  /// This tracks global names where the Verilog name needs to be different than
1058  /// the IR name.
1059  const GlobalNameTable &globalNames;
1060 
1061  /// Tracks the referenceable files through their symbol.
1062  const FileMapping &fileMapping;
1063 
1064  /// The stream to emit to. Use a formatted_raw_ostream, to easily get the
1065  /// current location(line,column) on the stream. This is required to record
1066  /// the verilog output location information corresponding to any op.
1067  llvm::formatted_raw_ostream &os;
1068 
1069  bool encounteredError = false;
1070  unsigned currentIndent = 0;
1071 
1072  /// Pretty printing:
1073 
1074  /// Whether a newline is expected, emitted late to provide opportunity to
1075  /// open/close boxes we don't know we need at level of individual statement.
1076  /// Every statement should set this instead of directly emitting (last)
1077  /// newline. Most statements end with emitLocationInfoAndNewLine which handles
1078  /// this.
1079  bool pendingNewline = false;
1080 
1081  /// Used to record the verilog output file location of an op.
1082  OpLocMap &verilogLocMap;
1083  /// String storage backing Tokens built from temporary strings.
1084  /// PrettyPrinter will clear this as appropriate.
1085  PrintEventAndStorageListener<OpLocMap, std::pair<Operation *, bool>> saver =
1086  PrintEventAndStorageListener<OpLocMap, std::pair<Operation *, bool>>(
1087  verilogLocMap);
1088 
1089  /// Pretty printer.
1090  PrettyPrinter pp;
1091 
1092  /// Name of the output file, used for debug information.
1093  StringAttr fileName;
1094 
1095  /// Update the location attribute of the ops with the verilog locations
1096  /// recorded in `verilogLocMap` and clear the map. `lineOffset` is added to
1097  /// all the line numbers, this is required when the modules are exported in
1098  /// parallel.
1099  void addVerilogLocToOps(unsigned int lineOffset, StringAttr fileName) {
1100  verilogLocMap.updateIRWithLoc(lineOffset, fileName,
1101  shared.designOp->getContext());
1102  verilogLocMap.clear();
1103  }
1104 
1105 private:
1106  VerilogEmitterState(const VerilogEmitterState &) = delete;
1107  void operator=(const VerilogEmitterState &) = delete;
1108 };
1109 } // namespace

1117 /// The data that is unique to each callback. The operation and a flag to
1118 /// indicate if the callback is for begin or end of the operation print
1119 /// location.
1120 using CallbackDataTy = std::pair<Operation *, bool>;
1121 class EmitterBase {
1122 public:
1123  // All of the mutable state we are maintaining.
1124  VerilogEmitterState &state;
1125 
1126  /// Stream helper (pp, saver).
1127  TokenStreamWithCallback<OpLocMap, CallbackDataTy> ps;
1128 
1129  explicit EmitterBase(VerilogEmitterState &state)
1130  : state(state),
1131  ps(state.pp, state.saver, state.options.emitVerilogLocations) {}
1132 
1133  InFlightDiagnostic emitError(Operation *op, const Twine &message) {
1134  state.encounteredError = true;
1135  return op->emitError(message);
1136  }
1137 
1138  InFlightDiagnostic emitOpError(Operation *op, const Twine &message) {
1139  state.encounteredError = true;
1140  return op->emitOpError(message);
1141  }
1142 
1143  void emitLocationImpl(llvm::StringRef location) {
1144  // Break so previous content is not impacted by following,
1145  // but use a 'neverbreak' so it always fits.
1146  ps << PP::neverbreak;
1147  if (!location.empty())
1148  ps << "\t// " << location; // (don't use tabs in normal pretty-printing)
1149  }
1150 
1151  void emitLocationInfo(Location loc) {
1152  emitLocationImpl(
1153  LocationEmitter(state.options.locationInfoStyle, loc).strref());
1154  }
1155 
1156  /// If we have location information for any of the specified operations,
1157  /// aggregate it together and print a pretty comment specifying where the
1158  /// operations came from. In any case, print a newline.
1159  void emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(const SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &ops) {
1160  emitLocationImpl(
1161  LocationEmitter(state.options.locationInfoStyle, ops).strref());
1162  setPendingNewline();
1163  }

1165  template <typename PPS>
1166  void emitTextWithSubstitutions(PPS &ps, StringRef string, Operation *op,
1167  llvm::function_ref<void(Value)> operandEmitter,
1168  ArrayAttr symAttrs);
1169 
1170  /// Emit the value of a StringAttr as one or more Verilog "one-line" comments
1171  /// ("//"). Break the comment to respect the emittedLineLength and trim
1172  /// whitespace after a line break. Do nothing if the StringAttr is null or
1173  /// the value is empty.
1174  void emitComment(StringAttr comment);
1175 
1176  /// If previous emission requires a newline, emit it now.
1177  /// This gives us opportunity to open/close boxes before linebreak.
1178  void emitPendingNewlineIfNeeded() {
1179  if (state.pendingNewline) {
1180  state.pendingNewline = false;
1181  ps << PP::newline;
1182  }
1183  }
1184  void setPendingNewline() {
1185  assert(!state.pendingNewline);
1186  state.pendingNewline = true;
1187  }
1188 
1189  void startStatement() { emitPendingNewlineIfNeeded(); }
1190 
1191 private:
1192  void operator=(const EmitterBase &) = delete;
1193  EmitterBase(const EmitterBase &) = delete;
1194 };
1195 } // end anonymous namespace
1196 
1197 template <typename PPS>
1198 void EmitterBase::emitTextWithSubstitutions(
1199  PPS &ps, StringRef string, Operation *op,
1200  llvm::function_ref<void(Value)> operandEmitter, ArrayAttr symAttrs) {
1201 
1202  // Perform operand substitions as we emit the line string. We turn {{42}}
1203  // into the value of operand 42.
1204  auto namify = [&](Attribute sym, HWSymbolCache::Item item) {
1205  // CAVEAT: These accesses can reach into other modules through inner name
1206  // references, which are currently being processed. Do not add those remote
1207  // operations to this module's `names`, which is reserved for things named
1208  // *within* this module. Instead, you have to rely on those remote
1209  // operations to have been named inside the global names table. If they
1210  // haven't, take a look at name legalization first.
1211  if (auto *itemOp = item.getOp()) {
1212  if (item.hasPort()) {
1213  return getPortVerilogName(itemOp, item.getPort());
1214  }
1215  StringRef symOpName = getSymOpName(itemOp);
1216  if (!symOpName.empty())
1217  return symOpName;
1218  emitError(itemOp, "cannot get name for symbol ") << sym;
1219  } else {
1220  emitError(op, "cannot get name for symbol ") << sym;
1221  }
1222  return StringRef("<INVALID>");
1223  };
1224 
1225  // Scan 'line' for a substitution, emitting any non-substitution prefix,
1226  // then the mentioned operand, chopping the relevant text off 'line' and
1227  // returning true. This returns false if no substitution is found.
1228  unsigned numSymOps = symAttrs.size();
1229  auto emitUntilSubstitution = [&](size_t next = 0) -> bool {
1230  size_t start = 0;
1231  while (true) {
1232  next = string.find("{{", next);
1233  if (next == StringRef::npos)
1234  return false;
1235 
1236  // Check to make sure we have a number followed by }}. If not, we
1237  // ignore the {{ sequence as something that could happen in Verilog.
1238  next += 2;
1239  start = next;
1240  while (next < string.size() && isdigit(string[next]))
1241  ++next;
1242  // We need at least one digit.
1243  if (start == next) {
1244  next--;
1245  continue;
1246  }
1247  size_t operandNoLength = next - start;
1248 
1249  // Format string options follow a ':'.
1250  StringRef fmtOptsStr;
1251  if (string[next] == ':') {
1252  size_t startFmtOpts = next + 1;
1253  while (next < string.size() && string[next] != '}')
1254  ++next;
1255  fmtOptsStr = string.substr(startFmtOpts, next - startFmtOpts);
1256  }
1257 
1258  // We must have a }} right after the digits.
1259  if (!string.substr(next).starts_with("}}"))
1260  continue;
1261 
1262  // We must be able to decode the integer into an unsigned.
1263  unsigned operandNo = 0;
1264  if (string.drop_front(start)
1265  .take_front(operandNoLength)
1266  .getAsInteger(10, operandNo)) {
1267  emitError(op, "operand substitution too large");
1268  continue;
1269  }
1270  next += 2;
1271 
1272  // Emit any text before the substitution.
1273  auto before = string.take_front(start - 2);
1274  if (!before.empty())
1275  ps << PPExtString(before);
1276 
1277  // operandNo can either refer to Operands or symOps. symOps are
1278  // numbered after the operands.
1279  if (operandNo < op->getNumOperands())
1280  // Emit the operand.
1281  operandEmitter(op->getOperand(operandNo));
1282  else if ((operandNo - op->getNumOperands()) < numSymOps) {
1283  unsigned symOpNum = operandNo - op->getNumOperands();
1284  auto sym = symAttrs[symOpNum];
1285  StringRef symVerilogName;
1286  if (auto fsym = sym.dyn_cast<FlatSymbolRefAttr>()) {
1287  if (auto *symOp = state.symbolCache.getDefinition(fsym)) {
1288  if (auto globalRef = dyn_cast<HierPathOp>(symOp)) {
1289  auto namepath = globalRef.getNamepathAttr().getValue();
1290  for (auto [index, sym] : llvm::enumerate(namepath)) {
1291  // Emit the seperator string.
1292  if (index > 0)
1293  ps << (fmtOptsStr.empty() ? "." : fmtOptsStr);
1294 
1295  auto innerRef = cast<InnerRefAttr>(sym);
1296  auto ref = state.symbolCache.getInnerDefinition(
1297  innerRef.getModule(), innerRef.getName());
1298  ps << namify(innerRef, ref);
1299  }
1300  } else {
1301  symVerilogName = namify(sym, symOp);
1302  }
1303  }
1304  } else if (auto isym = sym.dyn_cast<InnerRefAttr>()) {
1305  auto symOp = state.symbolCache.getInnerDefinition(isym.getModule(),
1306  isym.getName());
1307  symVerilogName = namify(sym, symOp);
1308  }
1309  if (!symVerilogName.empty())
1310  ps << PPExtString(symVerilogName);
1311  } else {
1312  emitError(op, "operand " + llvm::utostr(operandNo) + " isn't valid");
1313  continue;
1314  }
1315  // Forget about the part we emitted.
1316  string = string.drop_front(next);
1317  return true;
1318  }
1319  };
1320 
1321  // Emit all the substitutions.
1322  while (emitUntilSubstitution())
1323  ;
1324 
1325  // Emit any text after the last substitution.
1326  if (!string.empty())
1327  ps << PPExtString(string);
1328 }
1329 
1330 void EmitterBase::emitComment(StringAttr comment) {
1331  if (!comment)
1332  return;
1333 
1334  // Set a line length for the comment. Subtract off the leading comment and
1335  // space ("// ") as well as the current indent level to simplify later
1336  // arithmetic. Ensure that this line length doesn't go below zero.
1337  auto lineLength = state.options.emittedLineLength - state.currentIndent - 3;
1338  if (lineLength > state.options.emittedLineLength)
1339  lineLength = 0;
1340 
1341  // Process the comment in line chunks extracted from manually specified line
1342  // breaks. This is done to preserve user-specified line breaking if used.
1343  auto ref = comment.getValue();
1344  StringRef line;
1345  while (!ref.empty()) {
1346  std::tie(line, ref) = ref.split("\n");
1347  // Emit each comment line breaking it if it exceeds the emittedLineLength.
1348  for (;;) {
1349  startStatement();
1350  ps << "// ";
1351 
1352  // Base case 1: the entire comment fits on one line.
1353  if (line.size() <= lineLength) {
1354  ps << PPExtString(line);
1355  setPendingNewline();
1356  break;
1357  }
1358 
1359  // The comment does NOT fit on one line. Use a simple algorithm to find
1360  // a position to break the line:
1361  // 1) Search backwards for whitespace and break there if you find it.
1362  // 2) If no whitespace exists in (1), search forward for whitespace
1363  // and break there.
1364  // This algorithm violates the emittedLineLength if (2) ever occurrs,
1365  // but it's dead simple.
1366  auto breakPos = line.rfind(' ', lineLength);
1367  // No whitespace exists looking backwards.
1368  if (breakPos == StringRef::npos) {
1369  breakPos = line.find(' ', lineLength);
1370  // No whitespace exists looking forward (you hit the end of the
1371  // string).
1372  if (breakPos == StringRef::npos)
1373  breakPos = line.size();
1374  }
1375 
1376  // Emit up to the break position. Trim any whitespace after the break
1377  // position. Exit if nothing is left to emit. Otherwise, update the
1378  // comment ref and continue;
1379  ps << PPExtString(line.take_front(breakPos));
1380  setPendingNewline();
1381  breakPos = line.find_first_not_of(' ', breakPos);
1382  // Base Case 2: nothing left except whitespace.
1383  if (breakPos == StringRef::npos)
1384  break;
1385 
1386  line = line.drop_front(breakPos);
1387  }
1388  }
1389 }
1390 
1391 /// Given an expression that is spilled into a temporary wire, try to synthesize
1392 /// a better name than "_T_42" based on the structure of the expression.
1393 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
1394 StringAttr ExportVerilog::inferStructuralNameForTemporary(Value expr) {
1395  StringAttr result;
1396  bool addPrefixUnderScore = true;
1397 
1398  // Look through read_inout.
1399  if (auto read = expr.getDefiningOp<ReadInOutOp>())
1400  return inferStructuralNameForTemporary(read.getInput());
1401 
1402  // Module ports carry names!
1403  if (auto blockArg = expr.dyn_cast<BlockArgument>()) {
1404  auto moduleOp = cast<HWModuleOp>(blockArg.getOwner()->getParentOp());
1405  StringRef name = getPortVerilogName(moduleOp, blockArg.getArgNumber());
1406  result = StringAttr::get(expr.getContext(), name);
1407 
1408  } else if (auto *op = expr.getDefiningOp()) {
1409  // Uses of a wire, register or logic can be done inline.
1410  if (isa<sv::WireOp, RegOp, LogicOp>(op)) {
1411  StringRef name = getSymOpName(op);
1412  result = StringAttr::get(expr.getContext(), name);
1413 
1414  } else if (auto nameHint = op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("sv.namehint")) {
1415  // Use a dialect (sv) attribute to get a hint for the name if the op
1416  // doesn't explicitly specify it. Do this last
1417  result = nameHint;
1418 
1419  // If there is a namehint, don't add underscores to the name.
1420  addPrefixUnderScore = false;
1421  } else {
1422  TypeSwitch<Operation *>(op)
1423  // Generate a pretty name for VerbatimExpr's that look macro-like
1424  // using the same logic that generates the MLIR syntax name.
1425  .Case([&result](VerbatimExprOp verbatim) {
1426  verbatim.getAsmResultNames([&](Value, StringRef name) {
1427  result = StringAttr::get(verbatim.getContext(), name);
1428  });
1429  })
1430  .Case([&result](VerbatimExprSEOp verbatim) {
1431  verbatim.getAsmResultNames([&](Value, StringRef name) {
1432  result = StringAttr::get(verbatim.getContext(), name);
1433  });
1434  })
1435 
1436  // If this is an extract from a namable object, derive a name from it.
1437  .Case([&result](ExtractOp extract) {
1438  if (auto operandName =
1439  inferStructuralNameForTemporary(extract.getInput())) {
1440  unsigned numBits =
1441  extract.getType().cast<IntegerType>().getWidth();
1442  if (numBits == 1)
1443  result = StringAttr::get(extract.getContext(),
1444  operandName.strref() + "_" +
1445  Twine(extract.getLowBit()));
1446  else
1447  result = StringAttr::get(
1448  extract.getContext(),
1449  operandName.strref() + "_" +
1450  Twine(extract.getLowBit() + numBits - 1) + "to" +
1451  Twine(extract.getLowBit()));
1452  }
1453  });
1454  // TODO: handle other common patterns.
1455  }
1456  }
1457 
1458  // Make sure any synthesized name starts with an _.
1459  if (!result || result.strref().empty())
1460  return {};
1461 
1462  // Make sure that all temporary names start with an underscore.
1463  if (addPrefixUnderScore && result.strref().front() != '_')
1464  result = StringAttr::get(expr.getContext(), "_" + result.strref());
1465 
1466  return result;
1467 }
1468 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)

1566 /// Emit a single dimension.
1567 static void emitDim(Attribute width, raw_ostream &os, Location loc,
1568  ModuleEmitter &emitter, bool downTo) {
1569  if (!width) {
1570  os << "<<invalid type>>";
1571  return;
1572  }
1573  if (auto intAttr = width.dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>()) {
1574  if (intAttr.getValue().isZero()) {
1575  os << "/*Zero Width*/";
1576  } else {
1577  os << '[';
1578  if (!downTo)
1579  os << "0:";
1580  os << (intAttr.getValue().getZExtValue() - 1);
1581  if (downTo)
1582  os << ":0";
1583  os << ']';
1584  }
1585  return;
1586  }
1587 
1588  // Otherwise it must be a parameterized dimension. Shove the "-1" into the
1589  // attribute so it gets printed in canonical form.
1590  auto typedAttr = width.dyn_cast<TypedAttr>();
1591  if (!typedAttr) {
1592  mlir::emitError(loc, "untyped dimension attribute ") << width;
1593  return;
1594  }
1595  auto negOne =
1596  getIntAttr(loc.getContext(), typedAttr.getType(),
1597  APInt(typedAttr.getType().getIntOrFloatBitWidth(), -1L, true));
1598  width = ParamExprAttr::get(PEO::Add, typedAttr, negOne);
1599  os << '[';
1600  if (!downTo)
1601  os << "0:";
1602  emitter.printParamValue(width, os, [loc]() {
1603  return mlir::emitError(loc, "invalid parameter in type");
1604  });
1605  if (downTo)
1606  os << ":0";
1607  os << ']';
1608 }
1609 
1610 /// Emit a list of packed dimensions.
1611 static void emitDims(ArrayRef<Attribute> dims, raw_ostream &os, Location loc,
1612  ModuleEmitter &emitter) {
1613  for (Attribute width : dims) {
1614  emitDim(width, os, loc, emitter, /*downTo=*/true);
1615  }
1616 }
1617 
1618 /// Emit a type's packed dimensions.
1619 void ModuleEmitter::emitTypeDims(Type type, Location loc, raw_ostream &os) {
1620  SmallVector<Attribute, 4> dims;
1621  getTypeDims(dims, type, loc);
1622  emitDims(dims, os, loc, *this);
1623 }
1624 
1625 /// Output the basic type that consists of packed and primitive types. This is
1626 /// those to the left of the name in verilog. implicitIntType controls whether
1627 /// to print a base type for (logic) for inteters or whether the caller will
1628 /// have handled this (with logic, wire, reg, etc).
1629 /// optionalAliasType can be provided to perform any necessary alias-aware
1630 /// printing of 'type'.
1631 ///
1632 /// Returns true when anything was printed out.
1633 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
1634 static bool printPackedTypeImpl(Type type, raw_ostream &os, Location loc,
1635  SmallVectorImpl<Attribute> &dims,
1636  bool implicitIntType, bool singleBitDefaultType,
1637  ModuleEmitter &emitter,
1638  Type optionalAliasType = {}) {
1639  return TypeSwitch<Type, bool>(type)
1640  .Case<IntegerType>([&](IntegerType integerType) {
1641  if (!implicitIntType)
1642  os << "logic";
1643  if (integerType.getWidth() != 1 || !singleBitDefaultType)
1644  dims.push_back(
1645  getInt32Attr(type.getContext(), integerType.getWidth()));
1646  if (!dims.empty() && !implicitIntType)
1647  os << ' ';
1648 
1649  emitDims(dims, os, loc, emitter);
1650  return !dims.empty() || !implicitIntType;
1651  })
1652  .Case<IntType>([&](IntType intType) {
1653  if (!implicitIntType)
1654  os << "logic ";
1655  dims.push_back(intType.getWidth());
1656  emitDims(dims, os, loc, emitter);
1657  return true;
1658  })
1659  .Case<ArrayType>([&](ArrayType arrayType) {
1660  dims.push_back(arrayType.getSizeAttr());
1661  return printPackedTypeImpl(arrayType.getElementType(), os, loc, dims,
1662  implicitIntType, singleBitDefaultType,
1663  emitter);
1664  })
1665  .Case<InOutType>([&](InOutType inoutType) {
1666  return printPackedTypeImpl(inoutType.getElementType(), os, loc, dims,
1667  implicitIntType, singleBitDefaultType,
1668  emitter);
1669  })
1670  .Case<EnumType>([&](EnumType enumType) {
1671  os << "enum ";
1672  if (enumType.getBitWidth() != 32)
1673  os << "bit [" << enumType.getBitWidth() - 1 << ":0] ";
1674  os << "{";
1675  Type enumPrefixType = optionalAliasType ? optionalAliasType : enumType;
1676  llvm::interleaveComma(
1677  enumType.getFields().getAsRange<StringAttr>(), os,
1678  [&](auto enumerator) {
1679  os << emitter.fieldNameResolver.getEnumFieldName(
1680  hw::EnumFieldAttr::get(loc, enumerator, enumPrefixType));
1681  });
1682  os << "}";
1683  return true;
1684  })
1685  .Case<StructType>([&](StructType structType) {
1686  if (structType.getElements().empty() || isZeroBitType(structType)) {
1687  os << "/*Zero Width*/";
1688  return true;
1689  }
1690  os << "struct packed {";
1691  for (auto &element : structType.getElements()) {
1692  if (isZeroBitType(element.type)) {
1693  os << "/*" << emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(element.name)
1694  << ": Zero Width;*/ ";
1695  continue;
1696  }
1697  SmallVector<Attribute, 8> structDims;
1698  printPackedTypeImpl(stripUnpackedTypes(element.type), os, loc,
1699  structDims,
1700  /*implicitIntType=*/false,
1701  /*singleBitDefaultType=*/true, emitter);
1702  os << ' ' << emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(element.name);
1703  emitter.printUnpackedTypePostfix(element.type, os);
1704  os << "; ";
1705  }
1706  os << '}';
1707  emitDims(dims, os, loc, emitter);
1708  return true;
1709  })
1710  .Case<UnionType>([&](UnionType unionType) {
1711  if (unionType.getElements().empty() || isZeroBitType(unionType)) {
1712  os << "/*Zero Width*/";
1713  return true;
1714  }
1715 
1716  int64_t unionWidth = hw::getBitWidth(unionType);
1717  os << "union packed {";
1718  for (auto &element : unionType.getElements()) {
1719  if (isZeroBitType(element.type)) {
1720  os << "/*" << emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(element.name)
1721  << ": Zero Width;*/ ";
1722  continue;
1723  }
1724  int64_t elementWidth = hw::getBitWidth(element.type);
1725  bool needsPadding = elementWidth < unionWidth || element.offset > 0;
1726  if (needsPadding) {
1727  os << " struct packed {";
1728  if (element.offset) {
1729  os << "logic [" << element.offset - 1 << ":0] "
1730  << "__pre_padding_" << element.name.getValue() << "; ";
1731  }
1732  }
1733 
1734  SmallVector<Attribute, 8> structDims;
1735  printPackedTypeImpl(stripUnpackedTypes(element.type), os, loc,
1736  structDims,
1737  /*implicitIntType=*/false,
1738  /*singleBitDefaultType=*/true, emitter);
1739  os << ' ' << emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(element.name);
1740  emitter.printUnpackedTypePostfix(element.type, os);
1741  os << ";";
1742 
1743  if (needsPadding) {
1744  if (elementWidth + (int64_t)element.offset < unionWidth) {
1745  os << " logic ["
1746  << unionWidth - (elementWidth + element.offset) - 1 << ":0] "
1747  << "__post_padding_" << element.name.getValue() << ";";
1748  }
1749  os << "} " << emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(element.name)
1750  << ";";
1751  }
1752  }
1753  os << '}';
1754  emitDims(dims, os, loc, emitter);
1755  return true;
1756  })
1757 
1758  .Case<InterfaceType>([](InterfaceType ifaceType) { return false; })
1759  .Case<UnpackedArrayType>([&](UnpackedArrayType arrayType) {
1760  os << "<<unexpected unpacked array>>";
1761  mlir::emitError(loc, "Unexpected unpacked array in packed type ")
1762  << arrayType;
1763  return true;
1764  })
1765  .Case<TypeAliasType>([&](TypeAliasType typeRef) {
1766  auto typedecl = typeRef.getTypeDecl(emitter.state.symbolCache);
1767  if (!typedecl) {
1768  mlir::emitError(loc, "unresolvable type reference");
1769  return false;
1770  }
1771  if (typedecl.getType() != typeRef.getInnerType()) {
1772  mlir::emitError(loc, "declared type did not match aliased type");
1773  return false;
1774  }
1775 
1776  os << typedecl.getPreferredName();
1777  emitDims(dims, os, typedecl->getLoc(), emitter);
1778  return true;
1779  })
1780  .Default([&](Type type) {
1781  os << "<<invalid type '" << type << "'>>";
1782  mlir::emitError(loc, "value has an unsupported verilog type ") << type;
1783  return true;
1784  });
1785 }
1786 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)
1787 
1788 /// Print the specified packed portion of the type to the specified stream,
1789 ///
1790 /// * When `implicitIntType` is false, a "logic" is printed. This is used in
1791 /// struct fields and typedefs.
1792 /// * When `singleBitDefaultType` is false, single bit values are printed as
1793 /// `[0:0]`. This is used in parameter lists.
1794 ///
1795 /// This returns true if anything was printed.
1796 bool ModuleEmitter::printPackedType(Type type, raw_ostream &os, Location loc,
1797  Type optionalAliasType,
1798  bool implicitIntType,
1799  bool singleBitDefaultType) {
1800  SmallVector<Attribute, 8> packedDimensions;
1801  return printPackedTypeImpl(type, os, loc, packedDimensions, implicitIntType,
1802  singleBitDefaultType, *this, optionalAliasType);
1803 }
1804 
1805 /// Output the unpacked array dimensions. This is the part of the type that is
1806 /// to the right of the name.
1807 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
1808 void ModuleEmitter::printUnpackedTypePostfix(Type type, raw_ostream &os) {
1809  TypeSwitch<Type, void>(type)
1810  .Case<InOutType>([&](InOutType inoutType) {
1811  printUnpackedTypePostfix(inoutType.getElementType(), os);
1812  })
1813  .Case<UnpackedArrayType>([&](UnpackedArrayType arrayType) {
1814  auto loc = currentModuleOp ? currentModuleOp->getLoc()
1815  : state.designOp->getLoc();
1816  emitDim(arrayType.getSizeAttr(), os, loc, *this,
1817  /*downTo=*/false);
1818  printUnpackedTypePostfix(arrayType.getElementType(), os);
1819  })
1820  .Case<InterfaceType>([&](auto) {
1821  // Interface instantiations have parentheses like a module with no
1822  // ports.
1823  os << "()";
1824  });
1825 }
1826 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)

1831 /// Prints a parameter attribute expression in a Verilog compatible way to the
1832 /// specified stream. This returns the precedence of the generated string.
1833 SubExprInfo
1834 ModuleEmitter::printParamValue(Attribute value, raw_ostream &os,
1835  function_ref<InFlightDiagnostic()> emitError) {
1836  return printParamValue(value, os, VerilogPrecedence::LowestPrecedence,
1837  emitError);
1838 }
1839 
1840 /// Helper that prints a parameter constant value in a Verilog compatible way.
1841 /// This returns the precedence of the generated string.
1842 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
1843 SubExprInfo
1844 ModuleEmitter::printParamValue(Attribute value, raw_ostream &os,
1845  VerilogPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan,
1846  function_ref<InFlightDiagnostic()> emitError) {
1847  if (auto intAttr = value.dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>()) {
1848  IntegerType intTy = intAttr.getType().cast<IntegerType>();
1849  APInt value = intAttr.getValue();
1850 
1851  // We omit the width specifier if the value is <= 32-bits in size, which
1852  // makes this more compatible with unknown width extmodules.
1853  if (intTy.getWidth() > 32) {
1854  // Sign comes out before any width specifier.
1855  if (value.isNegative() && (intTy.isSigned() || intTy.isSignless())) {
1856  os << '-';
1857  value = -value;
1858  }
1859  if (intTy.isSigned())
1860  os << intTy.getWidth() << "'sd";
1861  else
1862  os << intTy.getWidth() << "'d";
1863  }
1864  value.print(os, intTy.isSigned());
1865  return {Symbol, intTy.isSigned() ? IsSigned : IsUnsigned};
1866  }
1867  if (auto strAttr = value.dyn_cast<StringAttr>()) {
1868  os << '"';
1869  os.write_escaped(strAttr.getValue());
1870  os << '"';
1871  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
1872  }
1873  if (auto fpAttr = value.dyn_cast<FloatAttr>()) {
1874  // TODO: relying on float printing to be precise is not a good idea.
1875  os << fpAttr.getValueAsDouble();
1876  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
1877  }
1878  if (auto verbatimParam = value.dyn_cast<ParamVerbatimAttr>()) {
1879  os << verbatimParam.getValue().getValue();
1880  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
1881  }
1882  if (auto parameterRef = value.dyn_cast<ParamDeclRefAttr>()) {
1883  // Get the name of this parameter (in case it got renamed).
1884  os << state.globalNames.getParameterVerilogName(currentModuleOp,
1885  parameterRef.getName());
1886 
1887  // TODO: Should we support signed parameters?
1888  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
1889  }
1890 
1891  // Handle nested expressions.
1892  auto expr = value.dyn_cast<ParamExprAttr>();
1893  if (!expr) {
1894  os << "<<UNKNOWN MLIRATTR: " << value << ">>";
1895  emitError() << " = " << value;
1896  return {LowestPrecedence, IsUnsigned};
1897  }
1898 
1899  StringRef operatorStr;
1900  StringRef openStr, closeStr;
1901  VerilogPrecedence subprecedence = LowestPrecedence;
1902  VerilogPrecedence prec; // precedence of the emitted expression.
1903  std::optional<SubExprSignResult> operandSign;
1904  bool isUnary = false;
1905  bool hasOpenClose = false;
1906 
1907  switch (expr.getOpcode()) {
1908  case PEO::Add:
1909  operatorStr = " + ";
1910  subprecedence = Addition;
1911  break;
1912  case PEO::Mul:
1913  operatorStr = " * ";
1914  subprecedence = Multiply;
1915  break;
1916  case PEO::And:
1917  operatorStr = " & ";
1918  subprecedence = And;
1919  break;
1920  case PEO::Or:
1921  operatorStr = " | ";
1922  subprecedence = Or;
1923  break;
1924  case PEO::Xor:
1925  operatorStr = " ^ ";
1926  subprecedence = Xor;
1927  break;
1928  case PEO::Shl:
1929  operatorStr = " << ";
1930  subprecedence = Shift;
1931  break;
1932  case PEO::ShrU:
1933  // >> in verilog is always a logical shift even if operands are signed.
1934  operatorStr = " >> ";
1935  subprecedence = Shift;
1936  break;
1937  case PEO::ShrS:
1938  // >>> in verilog is an arithmetic shift if both operands are signed.
1939  operatorStr = " >>> ";
1940  subprecedence = Shift;
1941  operandSign = IsSigned;
1942  break;
1943  case PEO::DivU:
1944  operatorStr = " / ";
1945  subprecedence = Multiply;
1946  operandSign = IsUnsigned;
1947  break;
1948  case PEO::DivS:
1949  operatorStr = " / ";
1950  subprecedence = Multiply;
1951  operandSign = IsSigned;
1952  break;
1953  case PEO::ModU:
1954  operatorStr = " % ";
1955  subprecedence = Multiply;
1956  operandSign = IsUnsigned;
1957  break;
1958  case PEO::ModS:
1959  operatorStr = " % ";
1960  subprecedence = Multiply;
1961  operandSign = IsSigned;
1962  break;
1963  case PEO::CLog2:
1964  openStr = "$clog2(";
1965  closeStr = ")";
1966  operandSign = IsUnsigned;
1967  hasOpenClose = true;
1968  prec = Symbol;
1969  break;
1970  case PEO::StrConcat:
1971  openStr = "{";
1972  closeStr = "}";
1973  hasOpenClose = true;
1974  operatorStr = ", ";
1975  // We don't have Concat precedence, but it's lowest anyway. (SV Table 11-2).
1976  subprecedence = LowestPrecedence;
1977  prec = Symbol;
1978  break;
1979  }
1980  if (!hasOpenClose)
1981  prec = subprecedence;
1982 
1983  // unary -> one element.
1984  assert(!isUnary || llvm::hasSingleElement(expr.getOperands()));
1985  // one element -> {unary || open/close}.
1986  assert(isUnary || hasOpenClose ||
1987  !llvm::hasSingleElement(expr.getOperands()));
1988 
1989  // Emit the specified operand with a $signed() or $unsigned() wrapper around
1990  // it if context requires a specific signedness to compute the right value.
1991  // This returns true if the operand is signed.
1992  // TODO: This could try harder to omit redundant casts like the mainline
1993  // expression emitter.
1994  auto emitOperand = [&](Attribute operand) -> bool {
1995  // If surrounding with signed/unsigned, inner expr doesn't need parens.
1996  auto subprec = operandSign.has_value() ? LowestPrecedence : subprecedence;
1997  if (operandSign.has_value())
1998  os << (*operandSign == IsSigned ? "$signed(" : "$unsigned(");
1999  auto signedness =
2000  printParamValue(operand, os, subprec, emitError).signedness;
2001  if (operandSign.has_value()) {
2002  os << ')';
2003  signedness = *operandSign;
2004  }
2005  return signedness == IsSigned;
2006  };
2007 
2008  // Check outer precedence, wrap in parentheses if needed.
2009  if (prec > parenthesizeIfLooserThan)
2010  os << '(';
2011 
2012  // Emit opening portion of the operation.
2013  if (hasOpenClose)
2014  os << openStr;
2015  else if (isUnary)
2016  os << operatorStr;
2017 
2018  bool allOperandsSigned = emitOperand(expr.getOperands()[0]);
2019  for (auto op : expr.getOperands().drop_front()) {
2020  // Handle the special case of (a + b + -42) as (a + b - 42).
2021  // TODO: Also handle (a + b + x*-1).
2022  if (expr.getOpcode() == PEO::Add) {
2023  if (auto integer = op.dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>()) {
2024  const APInt &value = integer.getValue();
2025  if (value.isNegative() && !value.isMinSignedValue()) {
2026  os << " - ";
2027  allOperandsSigned &=
2028  emitOperand(IntegerAttr::get(op.getType(), -value));
2029  continue;
2030  }
2031  }
2032  }
2033 
2034  os << operatorStr;
2035  allOperandsSigned &= emitOperand(op);
2036  }
2037  if (hasOpenClose)
2038  os << closeStr;
2039  if (prec > parenthesizeIfLooserThan) {
2040  os << ')';
2041  prec = Selection;
2042  }
2043  return {prec, allOperandsSigned ? IsSigned : IsUnsigned};
2044 }
2045 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)
2046 
2047 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
2048 // Expression Emission
2049 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
2050 
2051 namespace {
2052 /// This builds a recursively nested expression from an SSA use-def graph. This
2053 /// uses a post-order walk, but it needs to obey precedence and signedness
2054 /// constraints that depend on the behavior of the child nodes.
2055 /// To handle this, we must buffer all output so we can insert parentheses
2056 /// and other things if we find out that it was needed later.
2057 // NOLINTBEGIN(misc-no-recursion)
2058 class ExprEmitter : public EmitterBase,
2059  public TypeOpVisitor<ExprEmitter, SubExprInfo>,
2060  public CombinationalVisitor<ExprEmitter, SubExprInfo>,
2061  public Visitor<ExprEmitter, SubExprInfo> {
2062 public:
2063  /// Create an ExprEmitter for the specified module emitter, and keeping track
2064  /// of any emitted expressions in the specified set.
2065  ExprEmitter(ModuleEmitter &emitter,
2066  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &emittedExprs)
2067  : ExprEmitter(emitter, emittedExprs, localTokens) {}
2068 
2069  ExprEmitter(ModuleEmitter &emitter,
2070  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &emittedExprs,
2071  BufferingPP::BufferVec &tokens)
2072  : EmitterBase(emitter.state), emitter(emitter),
2073  emittedExprs(emittedExprs), buffer(tokens),
2074  ps(buffer, state.saver, state.options.emitVerilogLocations) {
2075  assert(state.pp.getListener() == &state.saver);
2076  }
2077 
2078  /// Emit the specified value as an expression. If this is an inline-emitted
2079  /// expression, we emit that expression, otherwise we emit a reference to the
2080  /// already computed name.
2081  ///
2082  void emitExpression(Value exp, VerilogPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan,
2083  bool isAssignmentLikeContext) {
2084  assert(localTokens.empty());
2085  // Wrap to this column.
2086  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
2087  emitSubExpr(exp, parenthesizeIfLooserThan,
2088  /*signRequirement*/ NoRequirement,
2089  /*isSelfDeterminedUnsignedValue*/ false,
2090  isAssignmentLikeContext);
2091  });
2092  // If we are not using an external token buffer provided through the
2093  // constructor, but we're using the default `ExprEmitter`-scoped buffer,
2094  // flush it.
2095  if (&buffer.tokens == &localTokens)
2096  buffer.flush(state.pp);
2097  }
2098 
2099 private:
2100  friend class TypeOpVisitor<ExprEmitter, SubExprInfo>;
2101  friend class CombinationalVisitor<ExprEmitter, SubExprInfo>;
2102  friend class Visitor<ExprEmitter, SubExprInfo>;
2103 
2104  enum SubExprSignRequirement { NoRequirement, RequireSigned, RequireUnsigned };
2105 
2106  /// Emit the specified value `exp` as a subexpression to the stream. The
2107  /// `parenthesizeIfLooserThan` parameter indicates when parentheses should be
2108  /// added aroun the subexpression. The `signReq` flag can cause emitSubExpr
2109  /// to emit a subexpression that is guaranteed to be signed or unsigned, and
2110  /// the `isSelfDeterminedUnsignedValue` flag indicates whether the value is
2111  /// known to be have "self determined" width, allowing us to omit extensions.
2112  SubExprInfo emitSubExpr(Value exp, VerilogPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan,
2113  SubExprSignRequirement signReq = NoRequirement,
2114  bool isSelfDeterminedUnsignedValue = false,
2115  bool isAssignmentLikeContext = false);
2116 
2117  /// Emit SystemVerilog attributes attached to the expression op as dialect
2118  /// attributes.
2119  void emitSVAttributes(Operation *op);
2120 
2121  SubExprInfo visitUnhandledExpr(Operation *op);
2122  SubExprInfo visitInvalidComb(Operation *op) {
2123  return dispatchTypeOpVisitor(op);
2124  }
2125  SubExprInfo visitUnhandledComb(Operation *op) {
2126  return visitUnhandledExpr(op);
2127  }
2128  SubExprInfo visitInvalidTypeOp(Operation *op) {
2129  return dispatchSVVisitor(op);
2130  }
2131  SubExprInfo visitUnhandledTypeOp(Operation *op) {
2132  return visitUnhandledExpr(op);
2133  }
2134  SubExprInfo visitUnhandledSV(Operation *op) { return visitUnhandledExpr(op); }
2135 
2136  using Visitor::visitSV;
2137 
2138  /// These are flags that control `emitBinary`.
2139  enum EmitBinaryFlags {
2140  EB_RequireSignedOperands = RequireSigned, /* 0x1*/
2141  EB_RequireUnsignedOperands = RequireUnsigned, /* 0x2*/
2142  EB_OperandSignRequirementMask = 0x3,
2143 
2144  /// This flag indicates that the RHS operand is an unsigned value that has
2145  /// "self determined" width. This means that we can omit explicit zero
2146  /// extensions from it, and don't impose a sign on it.
2147  EB_RHS_UnsignedWithSelfDeterminedWidth = 0x4,
2148 
2149  /// This flag indicates that the result should be wrapped in a $signed(x)
2150  /// expression to force the result to signed.
2151  EB_ForceResultSigned = 0x8,
2152  };
2153 
2154  /// Emit a binary expression. The "emitBinaryFlags" are a bitset from
2155  /// EmitBinaryFlags.
2156  SubExprInfo emitBinary(Operation *op, VerilogPrecedence prec,
2157  const char *syntax, unsigned emitBinaryFlags = 0);
2158 
2159  SubExprInfo emitUnary(Operation *op, const char *syntax,
2160  bool resultAlwaysUnsigned = false);
2161 
2162  /// Emit the specified value as a subexpression, wrapping in an ibox2.
2163  void emitSubExprIBox2(
2164  Value v, VerilogPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan = LowestPrecedence) {
2165  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2,
2166  [&]() { emitSubExpr(v, parenthesizeIfLooserThan); });
2167  }

2169  /// Emit a range of values separated by commas and a breakable space.
2170  /// Each value is emitted by invoking `eachFn`.
2171  template <typename Container, typename EachFn>
2172  void interleaveComma(const Container &c, EachFn eachFn) {
2173  llvm::interleave(c, eachFn, [&]() { ps << "," << PP::space; });
2174  }
2175 
2176  /// Emit a range of values separated by commas and a breakable space.
2177  /// Each value is emitted in an ibox2.
2178  void interleaveComma(ValueRange ops) {
2179  return interleaveComma(ops, [&](Value v) { emitSubExprIBox2(v); });
2180  }
2181 
2182  /// Emit an array-literal-like structure, separated by commas.
2183  /// Use callbacks to emit open tokens, closing tokens, and handle each value.
2184  /// If it fits, will be emitted on a single line with no space between
2185  /// list and surrounding open and close.
2186  /// Otherwise, each item is placed on its own line.
2187  /// This has property that if any element requires breaking, all elements
2188  /// are emitted on separate lines (with open/close attached to first/last).
2189  /// `{a + b, x + y, c}`
2190  /// OR
2191  /// ```
2192  /// {a + b,
2193  /// x + y,
2194  /// c}
2195  /// ```
2196  template <typename Container, typename OpenFunc, typename CloseFunc,
2197  typename EachFunc>
2198  void emitBracedList(const Container &c, OpenFunc openFn, EachFunc eachFn,
2199  CloseFunc closeFn) {
2200  openFn();
2201  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
2202  interleaveComma(c, eachFn);
2203  closeFn();
2204  });
2205  }
2206 
2207  /// Emit braced list of values surrounded by specified open/close.
2208  template <typename OpenFunc, typename CloseFunc>
2209  void emitBracedList(ValueRange ops, OpenFunc openFn, CloseFunc closeFn) {
2210  return emitBracedList(
2211  ops, openFn, [&](Value v) { emitSubExprIBox2(v); }, closeFn);
2212  }
2213 
2214  /// Emit braced list of values surrounded by `{` and `}`.
2215  void emitBracedList(ValueRange ops) {
2216  return emitBracedList(
2217  ops, [&]() { ps << "{"; }, [&]() { ps << "}"; });
2218  }

2228  ArrayAttr fieldValues, bool printAsPattern,

2230  /// Print an aggregate array or struct constant as the given type.
2231  void printConstantAggregate(Attribute attr, Type type, Operation *op);

2290  assert(op.getNumOperands() == 2 && "prelowering should handle variadics");
2291  return emitBinary(op, Addition, "+");
2292  }
2293  SubExprInfo visitComb(SubOp op) { return emitBinary(op, Addition, "-"); }
2294  SubExprInfo visitComb(MulOp op) {
2295  assert(op.getNumOperands() == 2 && "prelowering should handle variadics");
2296  return emitBinary(op, Multiply, "*");
2297  }
2298  SubExprInfo visitComb(DivUOp op) {
2299  return emitBinary(op, Multiply, "/", EB_RequireUnsignedOperands);
2300  }
2301  SubExprInfo visitComb(DivSOp op) {
2302  return emitBinary(op, Multiply, "/", EB_RequireSignedOperands);
2303  }
2304  SubExprInfo visitComb(ModUOp op) {
2305  return emitBinary(op, Multiply, "%", EB_RequireUnsignedOperands);
2306  }
2307  SubExprInfo visitComb(ModSOp op) {
2308  return emitBinary(op, Multiply, "%", EB_RequireSignedOperands);
2309  }
2310  SubExprInfo visitComb(ShlOp op) {
2311  return emitBinary(op, Shift, "<<", EB_RHS_UnsignedWithSelfDeterminedWidth);
2312  }
2313  SubExprInfo visitComb(ShrUOp op) {
2314  // >> in Verilog is always an unsigned right shift.
2315  return emitBinary(op, Shift, ">>", EB_RHS_UnsignedWithSelfDeterminedWidth);
2316  }
2317  SubExprInfo visitComb(ShrSOp op) {
2318  // >>> is only an arithmetic shift right when both operands are signed.
2319  // Otherwise it does a logical shift.
2320  return emitBinary(op, Shift, ">>>",
2321  EB_RequireSignedOperands | EB_ForceResultSigned |
2322  EB_RHS_UnsignedWithSelfDeterminedWidth);
2323  }
2324  SubExprInfo visitComb(AndOp op) {
2325  assert(op.getNumOperands() == 2 && "prelowering should handle variadics");
2326  return emitBinary(op, And, "&");
2327  }
2328  SubExprInfo visitComb(OrOp op) {
2329  assert(op.getNumOperands() == 2 && "prelowering should handle variadics");
2330  return emitBinary(op, Or, "|");
2331  }
2332  SubExprInfo visitComb(XorOp op) {
2333  if (op.isBinaryNot())
2334  return emitUnary(op, "~");
2335  assert(op.getNumOperands() == 2 && "prelowering should handle variadics");
2336  return emitBinary(op, Xor, "^");
2337  }
2338 
2339  // SystemVerilog spec 11.8.1: "Reduction operator results are unsigned,
2340  // regardless of the operands."
2341  SubExprInfo visitComb(ParityOp op) { return emitUnary(op, "^", true); }
2342

2348  InFlightDiagnostic emitAssignmentPatternContextError(Operation *op) {
2349  auto d = emitOpError(op, "must be printed as assignment pattern, but is "
2350  "not printed within an assignment-like context");

2352  "supposed to spill such expressions";

2364 private:
2365  /// This is set (before a visit method is called) if emitSubExpr would
2366  /// prefer to get an output of a specific sign. This is a hint to cause the
2367  /// visitor to change its emission strategy, but the visit method can ignore
2368  /// it without a correctness problem.
2369  SubExprSignRequirement signPreference = NoRequirement;
2370 
2371  /// Keep track of all operations emitted within this subexpression for
2372  /// location information tracking.
2373  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &emittedExprs;
2374 
2375  /// Tokens buffered for inserting casts/parens after emitting children.
2376  SmallVector<Token> localTokens;
2377 
2378  /// Stores tokens until told to flush. Uses provided buffer (tokens).
2379  BufferingPP buffer;
2380 
2381  /// Stream to emit expressions into, will add to buffer.
2382  TokenStreamWithCallback<OpLocMap, CallbackDataTy, BufferingPP> ps;
2383 
2384  /// Tracks whether the expression being emitted is currently within an
2385  /// assignment-like context. Certain constructs such as `'{...}` assignment
2386  /// patterns are restricted to only appear in assignment-like contexts.
2387  /// Others, like packed struct and array constants, can be printed as either
2388  /// `{...}` concatenation or `'{...}` assignment pattern, depending on whether
2389  /// they appear within an assignment-like context or not.
2390  bool isAssignmentLikeContext = false;
2391 };
