2393 
2394 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::emitBinary(Operation *op, VerilogPrecedence prec,
2395  const char *syntax,
2396  unsigned emitBinaryFlags) {
2397  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2398  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2399 
2400  // It's tempting to wrap expressions in groups as we emit them,
2401  // but that can cause bad wrapping as-is:
2402  // add(a, add(b, add(c, add(d, e))))
2403  // ->
2404  // group(a + (group(b + group(c + group(d + e)))))
2405  // Which will break after 'a +' first.
2406  // TODO: Build tree capturing precedence/fixity at same level, group those!
2407  // Maybe like: https://www.tweag.io/blog/2022-02-10-ormolu-and-operators/ .
2408  // For now, only group within punctuation, such as parens + braces.
2409  if (emitBinaryFlags & EB_ForceResultSigned)
2410  ps << "$signed(" << PP::ibox0;
2411  auto operandSignReq =
2412  SubExprSignRequirement(emitBinaryFlags & EB_OperandSignRequirementMask);
2413  auto lhsInfo = emitSubExpr(op->getOperand(0), prec, operandSignReq);
2414  // Bit of a kludge: if this is a comparison, don't break on either side.
2415  auto lhsSpace = prec == VerilogPrecedence::Comparison ? PP::nbsp : PP::space;
2416  // Use non-breaking space between op and RHS so breaking is consistent.
2417  ps << lhsSpace << syntax << PP::nbsp; // PP::space;
2418 
2419  // Right associative operators are already generally variadic, we need to
2420  // handle things like: (a<4> == b<4>) == (c<3> == d<3>). When processing the
2421  // top operation of the tree, the rhs needs parens. When processing
2422  // known-reassociative operators like +, ^, etc we don't need parens.
2423  // TODO: MLIR should have general "Associative" trait.
2424  auto rhsPrec = prec;
2425  if (!isa<AddOp, MulOp, AndOp, OrOp, XorOp>(op))
2426  rhsPrec = VerilogPrecedence(prec - 1);
2427 
2428  // If the RHS operand has self-determined width and always treated as
2429  // unsigned, inform emitSubExpr of this. This is true for the shift amount in
2430  // a shift operation.
2431  bool rhsIsUnsignedValueWithSelfDeterminedWidth = false;
2432  if (emitBinaryFlags & EB_RHS_UnsignedWithSelfDeterminedWidth) {
2433  rhsIsUnsignedValueWithSelfDeterminedWidth = true;
2434  operandSignReq = NoRequirement;
2435  }
2436 
2437  auto rhsInfo = emitSubExpr(op->getOperand(1), rhsPrec, operandSignReq,
2438  rhsIsUnsignedValueWithSelfDeterminedWidth);
2439 
2440  // SystemVerilog 11.8.1 says that the result of a binary expression is signed
2441  // only if both operands are signed.
2442  SubExprSignResult signedness = IsUnsigned;
2443  if (lhsInfo.signedness == IsSigned && rhsInfo.signedness == IsSigned)
2444  signedness = IsSigned;
2445 
2446  if (emitBinaryFlags & EB_ForceResultSigned) {
2447  ps << PP::end << ")";
2448  signedness = IsSigned;
2449  prec = Selection;
2450  }
2451 
2452  return {prec, signedness};
2453 }
2454 
2455 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::emitUnary(Operation *op, const char *syntax,
2456  bool resultAlwaysUnsigned) {
2457  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2458  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2459 
2460  ps << syntax;
2461  auto signedness = emitSubExpr(op->getOperand(0), Selection).signedness;
2462  // For reduction operators "&" and "|", make precedence lowest to avoid
2463  // emitting an expression like `a & &b`, which is syntactically valid but some
2464  // tools produce LINT warnings.
2465  return {isa<ICmpOp>(op) ? LowestPrecedence : Unary,
2466  resultAlwaysUnsigned ? IsUnsigned : signedness};
2467 }
2468 
2469 /// Emit SystemVerilog attributes attached to the expression op as dialect
2470 /// attributes.
2471 void ExprEmitter::emitSVAttributes(Operation *op) {
2472  // SystemVerilog 2017 Section 5.12.
2473  auto svAttrs = getSVAttributes(op);
2474  if (!svAttrs)
2475  return;
2476 
2477  // For now, no breaks for attributes.
2478  ps << PP::nbsp;
2479  emitSVAttributesImpl(ps, svAttrs, /*mayBreak=*/false);
2480 }
2481 
2482 /// If the specified extension is a zero extended version of another value,
2483 /// return the shorter value, otherwise return null.
2484 static Value isZeroExtension(Value value) {
2485  auto concat = value.getDefiningOp<ConcatOp>();
2486  if (!concat || concat.getNumOperands() != 2)
2487  return {};
2488 
2489  auto constant = concat.getOperand(0).getDefiningOp<ConstantOp>();
2490  if (constant && constant.getValue().isZero())
2491  return concat.getOperand(1);
2492  return {};
2493 }
2494 
2495 /// Emit the specified value `exp` as a subexpression to the stream. The
2496 /// `parenthesizeIfLooserThan` parameter indicates when parentheses should be
2497 /// added aroun the subexpression. The `signReq` flag can cause emitSubExpr
2498 /// to emit a subexpression that is guaranteed to be signed or unsigned, and
2499 /// the `isSelfDeterminedUnsignedValue` flag indicates whether the value is
2500 /// known to be have "self determined" width, allowing us to omit extensions.
2501 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::emitSubExpr(Value exp,
2502  VerilogPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan,
2503  SubExprSignRequirement signRequirement,
2504  bool isSelfDeterminedUnsignedValue,
2505  bool isAssignmentLikeContext) {
2506  // If this is a self-determined unsigned value, look through any inline zero
2507  // extensions. This occurs on the RHS of a shift operation for example.
2508  if (isSelfDeterminedUnsignedValue && exp.hasOneUse()) {
2509  if (auto smaller = isZeroExtension(exp))
2510  exp = smaller;
2511  }
2512 
2513  auto *op = exp.getDefiningOp();
2514  bool shouldEmitInlineExpr = op && isVerilogExpression(op);
2515 
2516  // If this is a non-expr or shouldn't be done inline, just refer to its name.
2517  if (!shouldEmitInlineExpr) {
2518  // All wires are declared as unsigned, so if the client needed it signed,
2519  // emit a conversion.
2520  if (signRequirement == RequireSigned) {
2521  ps << "$signed(" << PPExtString(getVerilogValueName(exp)) << ")";
2522  return {Symbol, IsSigned};
2523  }
2524 
2525  ps << PPExtString(getVerilogValueName(exp));
2526  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
2527  }
2528 
2529  unsigned subExprStartIndex = buffer.tokens.size();
2530  if (op)
2531  ps.addCallback({op, true});
2532  auto done = llvm::make_scope_exit([&]() {
2533  if (op)
2534  ps.addCallback({op, false});
2535  });
2536 
2537  // Inform the visit method about the preferred sign we want from the result.
2538  // It may choose to ignore this, but some emitters can change behavior based
2539  // on contextual desired sign.
2540  signPreference = signRequirement;
2541 
2542  bool bitCastAdded = false;
2543  if (state.options.explicitBitcast && isa<AddOp, MulOp, SubOp>(op))
2544  if (auto inType =
2545  (op->getResult(0).getType().dyn_cast_or_null<IntegerType>())) {
2546  ps.addAsString(inType.getWidth());
2547  ps << "'(" << PP::ibox0;
2548  bitCastAdded = true;
2549  }
2550  // Okay, this is an expression we should emit inline. Do this through our
2551  // visitor.
2552  llvm::SaveAndRestore restoreALC(this->isAssignmentLikeContext,
2553  isAssignmentLikeContext);
2554  auto expInfo = dispatchCombinationalVisitor(exp.getDefiningOp());
2555 
2556  // Check cases where we have to insert things before the expression now that
2557  // we know things about it.
2558  auto addPrefix = [&](StringToken &&t) {
2559  // insert {Prefix, ibox0}.
2560  buffer.tokens.insert(buffer.tokens.begin() + subExprStartIndex,
2561  BeginToken(0));
2562  buffer.tokens.insert(buffer.tokens.begin() + subExprStartIndex, t);
2563  };
2564  auto closeBoxAndParen = [&]() { ps << PP::end << ")"; };
2565  if (signRequirement == RequireSigned && expInfo.signedness == IsUnsigned) {
2566  addPrefix(StringToken("$signed("));
2567  closeBoxAndParen();
2568  expInfo.signedness = IsSigned;
2569  expInfo.precedence = Selection;
2570  } else if (signRequirement == RequireUnsigned &&
2571  expInfo.signedness == IsSigned) {
2572  addPrefix(StringToken("$unsigned("));
2573  closeBoxAndParen();
2574  expInfo.signedness = IsUnsigned;
2575  expInfo.precedence = Selection;
2576  } else if (expInfo.precedence > parenthesizeIfLooserThan) {
2577  // If this subexpression would bind looser than the expression it is bound
2578  // into, then we need to parenthesize it. Insert the parentheses
2579  // retroactively.
2580  addPrefix(StringToken("("));
2581  closeBoxAndParen();
2582  // Reset the precedence to the () level.
2583  expInfo.precedence = Selection;
2584  }
2585  if (bitCastAdded) {
2586  closeBoxAndParen();
2587  }
2588 
2589  // Remember that we emitted this.
2590  emittedExprs.insert(exp.getDefiningOp());
2591  return expInfo;
2592 }
2593 
2594 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitComb(ReplicateOp op) {
2595  auto openFn = [&]() {
2596  ps << "{";
2597  ps.addAsString(op.getMultiple());
2598  ps << "{";
2599  };
2600  auto closeFn = [&]() { ps << "}}"; };
2601 
2602  // If the subexpression is an inline concat, we can emit it as part of the
2603  // replicate.
2604  if (auto concatOp = op.getOperand().getDefiningOp<ConcatOp>()) {
2605  if (op.getOperand().hasOneUse()) {
2606  emitBracedList(concatOp.getOperands(), openFn, closeFn);
2607  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
2608  }
2609  }
2610  emitBracedList(op.getOperand(), openFn, closeFn);
2611  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
2612 }
2613 
2614 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitComb(ConcatOp op) {
2615  emitBracedList(op.getOperands());
2616  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
2617 }
2618 
2619 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitTypeOp(BitcastOp op) {
2620  // NOTE: Bitcasts are emitted out-of-line with their own wire declaration when
2621  // their dimensions don't match. SystemVerilog uses the wire declaration to
2622  // know what type this value is being casted to.
2623  Type toType = op.getType();
2624  if (!haveMatchingDims(toType, op.getInput().getType(), op.getLoc())) {
2625  ps << "/*cast(bit";
2626  ps.invokeWithStringOS(
2627  [&](auto &os) { emitter.emitTypeDims(toType, op.getLoc(), os); });
2628  ps << ")*/";
2629  }
2630  return emitSubExpr(op.getInput(), LowestPrecedence);
2631 }
2632 
2633 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitComb(ICmpOp op) {
2634  const char *symop[] = {"==", "!=", "<", "<=", ">", ">=", "<",
2635  "<=", ">", ">=", "===", "!==", "==?", "!=?"};
2636  SubExprSignRequirement signop[] = {
2637  // Equality
2638  NoRequirement, NoRequirement,
2639  // Signed Comparisons
2640  RequireSigned, RequireSigned, RequireSigned, RequireSigned,
2641  // Unsigned Comparisons
2642  RequireUnsigned, RequireUnsigned, RequireUnsigned, RequireUnsigned,
2643  // Weird Comparisons
2644  NoRequirement, NoRequirement, NoRequirement, NoRequirement};
2645 
2646  auto pred = static_cast<uint64_t>(op.getPredicate());
2647  assert(pred < sizeof(symop) / sizeof(symop[0]));
2648 
2649  // Lower "== -1" to Reduction And.
2650  if (op.isEqualAllOnes())
2651  return emitUnary(op, "&", true);
2652 
2653  // Lower "!= 0" to Reduction Or.
2654  if (op.isNotEqualZero())
2655  return emitUnary(op, "|", true);
2656 
2657  auto result = emitBinary(op, Comparison, symop[pred], signop[pred]);
2658 
2659  // SystemVerilog 11.8.1: "Comparison... operator results are unsigned,
2660  // regardless of the operands".
2661  result.signedness = IsUnsigned;
2662  return result;
2663 }
2664 
2665 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitComb(ExtractOp op) {
2666  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2667  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2668 
2669  unsigned loBit = op.getLowBit();
2670  unsigned hiBit = loBit + op.getType().cast<IntegerType>().getWidth() - 1;
2671 
2672  auto x = emitSubExpr(op.getInput(), LowestPrecedence);
2673  assert((x.precedence == Symbol ||
2674  (x.precedence == Selection && isOkToBitSelectFrom(op.getInput()))) &&
2675  "should be handled by isExpressionUnableToInline");
2676 
2677  // If we're extracting the whole input, just return it. This is valid but
2678  // non-canonical IR, and we don't want to generate invalid Verilog.
2679  if (loBit == 0 &&
2680  op.getInput().getType().getIntOrFloatBitWidth() == hiBit + 1)
2681  return x;
2682 
2683  ps << "[";
2684  ps.addAsString(hiBit);
2685  if (hiBit != loBit) { // Emit x[4] instead of x[4:4].
2686  ps << ":";
2687  ps.addAsString(loBit);
2688  }
2689  ps << "]";
2690  return {Unary, IsUnsigned};
2691 }

2693 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitSV(GetModportOp op) {
2694  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2695  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2696 
2697  auto decl = op.getReferencedDecl(state.symbolCache);
2698  ps << PPExtString(getVerilogValueName(op.getIface())) << "."
2699  << PPExtString(getSymOpName(decl));
2700  return {Selection, IsUnsigned};
2701 }

2703 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitSV(SystemFunctionOp op) {
2704  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2705  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2706 
2707  ps << "$" << PPExtString(op.getFnName()) << "(";
2708  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
2709  llvm::interleave(
2710  op.getOperands(), [&](Value v) { emitSubExpr(v, LowestPrecedence); },
2711  [&]() { ps << "," << PP::space; });
2712  ps << ")";
2713  });
2714  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
2715 }

2728 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitSV(XMROp op) {
2729  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2730  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2731 
2732  if (op.getIsRooted())
2733  ps << "$root.";
2734  for (auto s : op.getPath())
2735  ps << PPExtString(s.cast<StringAttr>().getValue()) << ".";
2736  ps << PPExtString(op.getTerminal());
2737  return {Selection, IsUnsigned};
2738 }

2740 // TODO: This shares a lot of code with the getNameRemotely mtehod. Combine
2741 // these to share logic.
2742 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitSV(XMRRefOp op) {
2743  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2744  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2745 
2746  // The XMR is pointing at a GlobalRef.
2747  auto globalRef = op.getReferencedPath(&state.symbolCache);
2748  auto namepath = globalRef.getNamepathAttr().getValue();
2749  auto *module = state.symbolCache.getDefinition(
2750  cast<InnerRefAttr>(namepath.front()).getModule());
2751  ps << PPExtString(getSymOpName(module));
2752  for (auto sym : namepath) {
2753  ps << ".";
2754  auto innerRef = cast<InnerRefAttr>(sym);
2755  auto ref = state.symbolCache.getInnerDefinition(innerRef.getModule(),
2756  innerRef.getName());
2757  if (ref.hasPort()) {
2758  ps << PPExtString(getPortVerilogName(ref.getOp(), ref.getPort()));
2759  continue;
2760  }
2761  ps << PPExtString(getSymOpName(ref.getOp()));
2762  }
2763  auto leaf = op.getVerbatimSuffixAttr();
2764  if (leaf && leaf.size())
2765  ps << PPExtString(leaf);
2766  return {Selection, IsUnsigned};
2767 }

2769 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitVerbatimExprOp(Operation *op, ArrayAttr symbols) {
2770  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2771  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2772 
2773  emitTextWithSubstitutions(
2774  ps, op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("format_string").getValue(), op,
2775  [&](Value operand) { emitSubExpr(operand, LowestPrecedence); }, symbols);
2776 
2777  return {Unary, IsUnsigned};
2778 }

2780 template <typename MacroTy>
2781 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::emitMacroCall(MacroTy op) {
2782  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2783  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2784 
2785  // Use the specified name or the symbol name as appropriate.
2786  auto macroOp = op.getReferencedMacro(&state.symbolCache);
2787  assert(macroOp && "Invalid IR");
2788  StringRef name =
2789  macroOp.getVerilogName() ? *macroOp.getVerilogName() : macroOp.getName();
2790  ps << "`" << PPExtString(name);
2791  if (!op.getInputs().empty()) {
2792  ps << "(";
2793  llvm::interleaveComma(op.getInputs(), ps, [&](Value val) {
2794  emitExpression(val, LowestPrecedence, /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/false);
2795  });
2796  ps << ")";
2797  }
2798  return {LowestPrecedence, IsUnsigned};
2799 }

2835 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::printConstantScalar(APInt &value, IntegerType type) {
2836  bool isNegated = false;
2837  // If this is a negative signed number and not MININT (e.g. -128), then print
2838  // it as a negated positive number.
2839  if (signPreference == RequireSigned && value.isNegative() &&
2840  !value.isMinSignedValue()) {
2841  ps << "-";
2842  isNegated = true;
2843  }
2844 
2845  ps.addAsString(type.getWidth());
2846  ps << "'";
2847 
2848  // Emit this as a signed constant if the caller would prefer that.
2849  if (signPreference == RequireSigned)
2850  ps << "sh";
2851  else
2852  ps << "h";
2853 
2854  // Print negated if required.
2855  SmallString<32> valueStr;
2856  if (isNegated) {
2857  (-value).toStringUnsigned(valueStr, 16);
2858  } else {
2859  value.toStringUnsigned(valueStr, 16);
2860  }
2861  ps << valueStr;
2862  return {Unary, signPreference == RequireSigned ? IsSigned : IsUnsigned};
2863 }
2864 
2865 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitTypeOp(ConstantOp op) {
2866  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2867  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2868 
2869  auto value = op.getValue();
2870  // We currently only allow zero width values to be handled as special cases in
2871  // the various operations that may come across them. If we reached this point
2872  // in the emitter, the value should be considered illegal to emit.
2873  if (value.getBitWidth() == 0) {
2874  emitOpError(op, "will not emit zero width constants in the general case");
2875  ps << "<<unsupported zero width constant: "
2876  << PPExtString(op->getName().getStringRef()) << ">>";
2877  return {Unary, IsUnsigned};
2878  }
2879 
2880  return printConstantScalar(value, op.getType().cast<IntegerType>());
2881 }
2882 
2883 void ExprEmitter::printConstantArray(ArrayAttr elementValues, Type elementType,
2884  bool printAsPattern, Operation *op) {
2885  if (printAsPattern && !isAssignmentLikeContext)
2886  emitAssignmentPatternContextError(op);
2887  StringRef openDelim = printAsPattern ? "'{" : "{";
2888 
2889  emitBracedList(
2890  elementValues, [&]() { ps << openDelim; },
2891  [&](Attribute elementValue) {
2892  printConstantAggregate(elementValue, elementType, op);
2893  },
2894  [&]() { ps << "}"; });
2895 }
2896 
2897 void ExprEmitter::printConstantStruct(
2898  ArrayRef<hw::detail::FieldInfo> fieldInfos, ArrayAttr fieldValues,
2899  bool printAsPattern, Operation *op) {
2900  if (printAsPattern && !isAssignmentLikeContext)
2901  emitAssignmentPatternContextError(op);
2902 
2903  // Only emit elements with non-zero bit width.
2904  // TODO: Ideally we should emit zero bit values as comments, e.g. `{/*a:
2905  // ZeroBit,*/ b: foo, /* c: ZeroBit*/ d: bar}`. However it's tedious to
2906  // nicely emit all edge cases hence currently we just elide zero bit
2907  // values.
2908  auto fieldRange = llvm::make_filter_range(
2909  llvm::zip(fieldInfos, fieldValues), [](const auto &fieldAndValue) {
2910  // Elide zero bit elements.
2911  return !isZeroBitType(std::get<0>(fieldAndValue).type);
2912  });
2913 
2914  if (printAsPattern) {
2915  emitBracedList(
2916  fieldRange, [&]() { ps << "'{"; },
2917  [&](const auto &fieldAndValue) {
2918  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
2919  const auto &[field, value] = fieldAndValue;
2920  ps << PPExtString(emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(field.name))
2921  << ":" << PP::space;
2922  printConstantAggregate(value, field.type, op);
2923  });
2924  },
2925  [&]() { ps << "}"; });
2926  } else {
2927  emitBracedList(
2928  fieldRange, [&]() { ps << "{"; },
2929  [&](const auto &fieldAndValue) {
2930  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
2931  const auto &[field, value] = fieldAndValue;
2932  printConstantAggregate(value, field.type, op);
2933  });
2934  },
2935  [&]() { ps << "}"; });
2936  }
2937 }
2938 
2939 void ExprEmitter::printConstantAggregate(Attribute attr, Type type,
2940  Operation *op) {
2941  // Packed arrays can be printed as concatenation or pattern.
2942  if (auto arrayType = hw::type_dyn_cast<ArrayType>(type))
2943  return printConstantArray(cast<ArrayAttr>(attr), arrayType.getElementType(),
2944  isAssignmentLikeContext, op);
2945 
2946  // Unpacked arrays must be printed as pattern.
2947  if (auto arrayType = hw::type_dyn_cast<UnpackedArrayType>(type))
2948  return printConstantArray(cast<ArrayAttr>(attr), arrayType.getElementType(),
2949  true, op);
2950 
2951  // Packed structs can be printed as concatenation or pattern.
2952  if (auto structType = hw::type_dyn_cast<StructType>(type))
2953  return printConstantStruct(structType.getElements(), cast<ArrayAttr>(attr),
2954  isAssignmentLikeContext, op);
2955 
2956  if (auto intType = hw::type_dyn_cast<IntegerType>(type)) {
2957  auto value = attr.cast<IntegerAttr>().getValue();
2958  printConstantScalar(value, intType);
2959  return;
2960  }
2961 
2962  emitOpError(op, "contains constant of type ")
2963  << type << " which cannot be emitted as Verilog";
2964 }
2965 
2966 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitTypeOp(AggregateConstantOp op) {
2967  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2968  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2969 
2970  // If the constant op as a whole is zero-width, it is an error.
2971  assert(!isZeroBitType(op.getType()) &&
2972  "zero-bit types not allowed at this point");
2973 
2974  printConstantAggregate(op.getFields(), op.getType(), op);
2975  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
2976 }
2977 
2978 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitTypeOp(ParamValueOp op) {
2979  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2980  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2981 
2982  return ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
2983  return emitter.printParamValue(op.getValue(), os, [&]() {
2984  return op->emitOpError("invalid parameter use");
2985  });
2986  });
2987 }

2989 // 11.5.1 "Vector bit-select and part-select addressing" allows a '+:' syntax
2990 // for slicing operations.
2991 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitTypeOp(ArraySliceOp op) {
2992  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
2993  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
2994 
2995  auto arrayPrec = emitSubExpr(op.getInput(), Selection);
2996 
2997  unsigned dstWidth = type_cast<ArrayType>(op.getType()).getNumElements();
2998  ps << "[";
2999  emitSubExpr(op.getLowIndex(), LowestPrecedence);
3000  ps << " +: ";
3001  ps.addAsString(dstWidth);
3002  ps << "]";
3003  return {Selection, arrayPrec.signedness};
3004 }

3025  ps.addAsString(op.getInputs().size());

3033  ps << "{";

3035  ps << "}";
3036  },

3038  }

3117 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitComb(MuxOp op) {
3118  // The ?: operator is right associative.
3119 
3120  // Layout:
3121  // cond ? a : b
3122  // (long
3123  // + cond) ? a : b
3124  // long
3125  // + cond
3126  // ? a : b
3127  // long
3128  // + cond
3129  // ? a
3130  // : b
3131  return ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() -> SubExprInfo {
3132  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
3133  emitSubExpr(op.getCond(), VerilogPrecedence(Conditional - 1));
3134  });
3135  ps << BreakToken(1, 2);
3136  ps << "?";
3137  emitSVAttributes(op);
3138  ps << " ";
3139  auto lhsInfo = ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
3140  return emitSubExpr(op.getTrueValue(), VerilogPrecedence(Conditional - 1));
3141  });
3142  ps << BreakToken(1, 2) << ": ";
3143 
3144  auto rhsInfo = ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
3145  return emitSubExpr(op.getFalseValue(), Conditional);
3146  });
3147 
3148  SubExprSignResult signedness = IsUnsigned;
3149  if (lhsInfo.signedness == IsSigned && rhsInfo.signedness == IsSigned)
3150  signedness = IsSigned;
3151 
3152  return {Conditional, signedness};
3153  });
3154 }

3156 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::printStructCreate(
3157  ArrayRef<hw::detail::FieldInfo> fieldInfos,
3158  llvm::function_ref<void(const hw::detail::FieldInfo &, unsigned)> fieldFn,
3159  bool printAsPattern, Operation *op) {
3160  if (printAsPattern && !isAssignmentLikeContext)
3161  emitAssignmentPatternContextError(op);
3162 
3163  // Elide zero bit elements.
3164  auto filteredFields = llvm::make_filter_range(
3165  llvm::enumerate(fieldInfos),
3166  [](const auto &field) { return !isZeroBitType(field.value().type); });
3167 
3168  if (printAsPattern) {
3169  emitBracedList(
3170  filteredFields, [&]() { ps << "'{"; },
3171  [&](const auto &field) {
3172  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
3173  ps << PPExtString(
3174  emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(field.value().name))
3175  << ":" << PP::space;
3176  fieldFn(field.value(), field.index());
3177  });
3178  },
3179  [&]() { ps << "}"; });
3180  } else {
3181  emitBracedList(
3182  filteredFields, [&]() { ps << "{"; },
3183  [&](const auto &field) {
3184  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2,
3185  [&]() { fieldFn(field.value(), field.index()); });
3186  },
3187  [&]() { ps << "}"; });
3188  }
3189 
3190  return {Selection, IsUnsigned};
3191 }

3198  // should be set to true.
3199  bool printAsPattern = isAssignmentLikeContext;
3200  StructType structType = op.getType();
3201  return printStructCreate(
3202  structType.getElements(),
3203  [&](const auto &field, auto index) {
3204  emitSubExpr(op.getOperand(index), Selection, NoRequirement,
3205  /*isSelfDeterminedUnsignedValue=*/false,
3206  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/isAssignmentLikeContext);
3207  },
3208  printAsPattern, op);
3209 }

3258 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitTypeOp(UnionCreateOp op) {
3259  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
3260  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
3261 
3262  // Check if this union type has been padded.
3263  auto unionType = cast<UnionType>(getCanonicalType(op.getType()));
3264  auto unionWidth = hw::getBitWidth(unionType);
3265  auto &element = unionType.getElements()[op.getFieldIndex()];
3266  auto elementWidth = hw::getBitWidth(element.type);
3267 
3268  // If the element is 0 width, just fill the union with 0s.
3269  if (!elementWidth) {
3270  ps.addAsString(unionWidth);
3271  ps << "'h0";
3272  return {Unary, IsUnsigned};
3273  }
3274 
3275  // If the element has no padding, emit it directly.
3276  if (elementWidth == unionWidth) {
3277  emitSubExpr(op.getInput(), LowestPrecedence);
3278  return {Unary, IsUnsigned};
3279  }
3280 
3281  // Emit the value as a bitconcat, supplying 0 for the padding bits.
3282  ps << "{";
3283  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
3284  if (auto prePadding = element.offset) {
3285  ps.addAsString(prePadding);
3286  ps << "'h0," << PP::space;
3287  }
3288  emitSubExpr(op.getInput(), Selection);
3289  if (auto postPadding = unionWidth - elementWidth - element.offset) {
3290  ps << "," << PP::space;
3291  ps.addAsString(postPadding);
3292  ps << "'h0";
3293  }
3294  ps << "}";
3295  });
3296 
3297  return {Unary, IsUnsigned};
3298 }
3299 
3300 SubExprInfo ExprEmitter::visitTypeOp(UnionExtractOp op) {
3301  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
3302  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
3303  emitSubExpr(op.getInput(), Selection);
3304 
3305  // Check if this union type has been padded.
3306  auto unionType = cast<UnionType>(getCanonicalType(op.getInput().getType()));
3307  auto unionWidth = hw::getBitWidth(unionType);
3308  auto &element = unionType.getElements()[op.getFieldIndex()];
3309  auto elementWidth = hw::getBitWidth(element.type);
3310  bool needsPadding = elementWidth < unionWidth || element.offset > 0;
3311  auto verilogFieldName = emitter.getVerilogStructFieldName(element.name);
3312 
3313  // If the element needs padding then we need to get the actual element out
3314  // of an anonymous structure.
3315  if (needsPadding)
3316  ps << "." << PPExtString(verilogFieldName);
3317 
3318  // Get the correct member from the union.
3319  ps << "." << PPExtString(verilogFieldName);
3320  return {Selection, IsUnsigned};
3321 }

3325  ps << "<<unsupported expr: " << PPExtString(op->getName().getStringRef())
3326  << ">>";
3327  return {Symbol, IsUnsigned};
3328 }

3337 namespace {
3338 /// Precedence level of various property and sequence expressions. Lower numbers
3339 /// bind tighter.
3340 ///
3341 /// See IEEE 1800-2017 section 16.12 "Declaring properties", specifically table
3342 /// 16-3 on "Sequence and property operator precedence and associativity".
3343 enum class PropertyPrecedence {
3344  Symbol, // Atomic symbol like `foo` and regular boolean expressions
3345  Repeat, // Sequence `[*]`, `[=]`, `[->]`
3346  Concat, // Sequence `##`
3347  Throughout, // Sequence `throughout`
3348  Within, // Sequence `within`
3349  Intersect, // Sequence `intersect`
3350  Unary, // Property `not`, `nexttime`-like
3351  And, // Sequence and property `and`
3352  Or, // Sequence and property `or`
3353  Iff, // Property `iff`
3354  Until, // Property `until`-like, `implies`
3355  Implication, // Property `|->`, `|=>`, `#-#`, `#=#`
3356  Qualifier, // Property `always`-like, `eventually`-like, `if`, `case`,
3357  // `accept`-like, `reject`-like
3358  Clocking, // `@(...)`, `disable iff` (not specified in the standard)
3359  Lowest, // Sentinel which is always the lowest precedence.
3360 };
3361 
3362 /// Additional information on emitted property and sequence expressions.
3363 struct EmittedProperty {
3364  /// The precedence of this expression.
3365  PropertyPrecedence precedence;
3366 };
3367 
3368 /// A helper to emit recursively nested property and sequence expressions for
3369 /// SystemVerilog assertions.
3370 class PropertyEmitter : public EmitterBase,
3371  public ltl::Visitor<PropertyEmitter, EmittedProperty> {
3372 public:
3373  /// Create a PropertyEmitter for the specified module emitter, and keeping
3374  /// track of any emitted expressions in the specified set.
3375  PropertyEmitter(ModuleEmitter &emitter,
3376  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &emittedOps)
3377  : PropertyEmitter(emitter, emittedOps, localTokens) {}
3378  PropertyEmitter(ModuleEmitter &emitter,
3379  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &emittedOps,
3380  BufferingPP::BufferVec &tokens)
3381  : EmitterBase(emitter.state), emitter(emitter), emittedOps(emittedOps),
3382  buffer(tokens),
3383  ps(buffer, state.saver, state.options.emitVerilogLocations) {
3384  assert(state.pp.getListener() == &state.saver);
3385  }
3386 
3387  /// Emit the specified value as an SVA property or sequence. This is the entry
3388  /// point to print an entire tree of property or sequence expressions in one
3389  /// go.
3390  void emitProperty(
3391  Value property,
3392  PropertyPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan = PropertyPrecedence::Lowest);
3393 
3394 private:
3395  using ltl::Visitor<PropertyEmitter, EmittedProperty>::visitLTL;
3396  friend class ltl::Visitor<PropertyEmitter, EmittedProperty>;
3397 
3398  /// Emit the specified value as an SVA property or sequence.
3399  EmittedProperty
3400  emitNestedProperty(Value property,
3401  PropertyPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan);
3402 
3403  EmittedProperty visitUnhandledLTL(Operation *op);
3404  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::AndOp op);
3405  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::OrOp op);
3406  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::DelayOp op);
3407  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::ConcatOp op);
3408  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::NotOp op);
3409  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::ImplicationOp op);
3410  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::EventuallyOp op);
3411  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::ClockOp op);
3412  EmittedProperty visitLTL(ltl::DisableOp op);
3413 
3414  void emitLTLConcat(ValueRange inputs);
3415 
3416 public:
3417  ModuleEmitter &emitter;
3418 
3419 private:
3420  /// Keep track of all operations emitted within this subexpression for
3421  /// location information tracking.
3422  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &emittedOps;
3423 
3424  /// Tokens buffered for inserting casts/parens after emitting children.
3425  SmallVector<Token> localTokens;
3426 
3427  /// Stores tokens until told to flush. Uses provided buffer (tokens).
3428  BufferingPP buffer;
3429 
3430  /// Stream to emit expressions into, will add to buffer.
3431  TokenStreamWithCallback<OpLocMap, CallbackDataTy, BufferingPP> ps;
3432 };
3433 } // end anonymous namespace
3434 
3435 void PropertyEmitter::emitProperty(
3436  Value property, PropertyPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan) {
3437  assert(localTokens.empty());
3438  // Wrap to this column.
3439  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0,
3440  [&] { emitNestedProperty(property, parenthesizeIfLooserThan); });
3441  // If we are not using an external token buffer provided through the
3442  // constructor, but we're using the default `PropertyEmitter`-scoped buffer,
3443  // flush it.
3444  if (&buffer.tokens == &localTokens)
3445  buffer.flush(state.pp);
3446 }
3447 
3448 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::emitNestedProperty(
3449  Value property, PropertyPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan) {
3450  // Emit the property as a plain expression if it doesn't have a property or
3451  // sequence type, in which case it is just a boolean expression.
3452  //
3453  // We use the `LowestPrecedence` for the boolean expression such that it never
3454  // gets parenthesized. According to IEEE 1800-2017, "the operators described
3455  // in Table 11-2 have higher precedence than the sequence and property
3456  // operators". Therefore any boolean expression behaves just like a
3457  // `PropertyPrecedence::Symbol` and needs no parantheses, which is equivalent
3458  // to `VerilogPrecedence::LowestPrecedence`.
3459  if (!isa<ltl::SequenceType, ltl::PropertyType>(property.getType())) {
3460  ExprEmitter(emitter, emittedOps, buffer.tokens)
3461  .emitExpression(property, LowestPrecedence,
3462  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/false);
3463  return {PropertyPrecedence::Symbol};
3464  }
3465 
3466  unsigned startIndex = buffer.tokens.size();
3467  auto info = dispatchLTLVisitor(property.getDefiningOp());
3468 
3469  // If this subexpression would bind looser than the expression it is bound
3470  // into, then we need to parenthesize it. Insert the parentheses
3471  // retroactively.
3472  if (info.precedence > parenthesizeIfLooserThan) {
3473  // Insert {"(", ibox0} before the subexpression.
3474  buffer.tokens.insert(buffer.tokens.begin() + startIndex, BeginToken(0));
3475  buffer.tokens.insert(buffer.tokens.begin() + startIndex, StringToken("("));
3476  // Insert {end, ")" } after the subexpression.
3477  ps << PP::end << ")";
3478  // Reset the precedence level.
3479  info.precedence = PropertyPrecedence::Symbol;
3480  }
3481 
3482  // Remember that we emitted this.
3483  emittedOps.insert(property.getDefiningOp());
3484  return info;
3485 }
3486 
3487 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitUnhandledLTL(Operation *op) {
3488  emitOpError(op, "emission as Verilog property or sequence not supported");
3489  ps << "<<unsupported: " << PPExtString(op->getName().getStringRef()) << ">>";
3490  return {PropertyPrecedence::Symbol};
3491 }

3502  llvm::interleave(
3503  op.getInputs(),
3504  [&](auto input) { emitNestedProperty(input, PropertyPrecedence::Or); },

3509 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitLTL(ltl::DelayOp op) {
3510  ps << "##";
3511  if (auto length = op.getLength()) {
3512  if (*length == 0) {
3513  ps.addAsString(op.getDelay());
3514  } else {
3515  ps << "[";
3516  ps.addAsString(op.getDelay());
3517  ps << ":";
3518  ps.addAsString(op.getDelay() + *length);
3519  ps << "]";
3520  }
3521  } else {
3522  if (op.getDelay() == 0) {
3523  ps << "[*]";
3524  } else if (op.getDelay() == 1) {
3525  ps << "[+]";
3526  } else {
3527  ps << "[";
3528  ps.addAsString(op.getDelay());
3529  ps << ":$]";
3530  }
3531  }
3532  ps << PP::space;
3533  emitNestedProperty(op.getInput(), PropertyPrecedence::Concat);
3534  return {PropertyPrecedence::Concat};
3535 }
3536 
3537 void PropertyEmitter::emitLTLConcat(ValueRange inputs) {
3538  bool addSeparator = false;
3539  for (auto input : inputs) {
3540  if (addSeparator) {
3541  ps << PP::space;
3542  if (!input.getDefiningOp<ltl::DelayOp>())
3543  ps << "##0" << PP::space;
3544  }
3545  addSeparator = true;
3546  emitNestedProperty(input, PropertyPrecedence::Concat);
3547  }
3548 }
3549 
3550 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitLTL(ltl::ConcatOp op) {
3551  emitLTLConcat(op.getInputs());
3552  return {PropertyPrecedence::Concat};
3553 }
3554 
3555 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitLTL(ltl::NotOp op) {
3556  ps << "not" << PP::space;
3557  emitNestedProperty(op.getInput(), PropertyPrecedence::Unary);
3558  return {PropertyPrecedence::Unary};
3559 }
3560 
3561 /// For a value `concat(..., delay(const(true), 1, 0))`, return `...`. This is
3562 /// useful for emitting `(seq ##1 true) |-> prop` as `seq |=> prop`.
3563 static ValueRange getNonOverlappingConcatSubrange(Value value) {
3564  auto concatOp = value.getDefiningOp<ltl::ConcatOp>();
3565  if (!concatOp || concatOp.getInputs().size() < 2)
3566  return {};
3567  auto delayOp = concatOp.getInputs().back().getDefiningOp<ltl::DelayOp>();
3568  if (!delayOp || delayOp.getDelay() != 1 || delayOp.getLength() != 0)
3569  return {};
3570  auto constOp = delayOp.getInput().getDefiningOp<ConstantOp>();
3571  if (!constOp || !constOp.getValue().isOne())
3572  return {};
3573  return concatOp.getInputs().drop_back();
3574 }
3575 
3576 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitLTL(ltl::ImplicationOp op) {
3577  // Emit `(seq ##1 true) |-> prop` as `seq |=> prop`.
3578  if (auto range = getNonOverlappingConcatSubrange(op.getAntecedent());
3579  !range.empty()) {
3580  emitLTLConcat(range);
3581  ps << PP::space << "|=>" << PP::nbsp;
3582  } else {
3583  emitNestedProperty(op.getAntecedent(), PropertyPrecedence::Implication);
3584  ps << PP::space << "|->" << PP::nbsp;
3585  }
3586  emitNestedProperty(op.getConsequent(), PropertyPrecedence::Implication);
3587  return {PropertyPrecedence::Implication};
3588 }
3589 
3590 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitLTL(ltl::EventuallyOp op) {
3591  ps << "s_eventually" << PP::space;
3592  emitNestedProperty(op.getInput(), PropertyPrecedence::Qualifier);
3593  return {PropertyPrecedence::Qualifier};
3594 }
3595 
3596 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitLTL(ltl::ClockOp op) {
3597  ps << "@(";
3598  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&] {
3599  ps << PPExtString(stringifyClockEdge(op.getEdge())) << PP::space;
3600  emitNestedProperty(op.getClock(), PropertyPrecedence::Lowest);
3601  ps << ")";
3602  });
3603  ps << PP::space;
3604  emitNestedProperty(op.getInput(), PropertyPrecedence::Clocking);
3605  return {PropertyPrecedence::Clocking};
3606 }
3607 
3608 EmittedProperty PropertyEmitter::visitLTL(ltl::DisableOp op) {
3609  ps << "disable iff" << PP::nbsp << "(";
3610  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&] {
3611  emitNestedProperty(op.getCondition(), PropertyPrecedence::Lowest);
3612  ps << ")";
3613  });
3614  ps << PP::space;
3615  emitNestedProperty(op.getInput(), PropertyPrecedence::Clocking);
3616  return {PropertyPrecedence::Clocking};
3617 }

3621 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
3622 // NameCollector
3623 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
3624 
3625 namespace {
3626 class NameCollector {
3627 public:
3628  NameCollector(ModuleEmitter &moduleEmitter) : moduleEmitter(moduleEmitter) {}
3629 
3630  // Scan operations in the specified block, collecting information about
3631  // those that need to be emitted as declarations.
3632  void collectNames(Block &block);
3633 
3634  size_t getMaxDeclNameWidth() const { return maxDeclNameWidth; }
3635  size_t getMaxTypeWidth() const { return maxTypeWidth; }
3636 
3637 private:
3638  size_t maxDeclNameWidth = 0, maxTypeWidth = 0;
3639  ModuleEmitter &moduleEmitter;
3640 
3641  /// Types that are longer than `maxTypeWidthBound` are not added to the
3642  /// `maxTypeWidth` to prevent one single huge type from messing up the
3643  /// alignment of all other declarations.
3644  static constexpr size_t maxTypeWidthBound = 32;
3645 };
3646 } // namespace
3647 
3648 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(misc-no-recursion)
3649 void NameCollector::collectNames(Block &block) {
3650  // Loop over all of the results of all of the ops. Anything that defines a
3651  // value needs to be noticed.
3652  for (auto &op : block) {
3653  // Instances have an instance name to recognize but we don't need to look
3654  // at the result values since wires used by instances should be traversed
3655  // anyway.
3656  if (isa<InstanceOp, InstanceChoiceOp, InterfaceInstanceOp>(op))
3657  continue;
3658  if (isa<ltl::LTLDialect, debug::DebugDialect>(op.getDialect()))
3659  continue;
3660 
3661  if (!isVerilogExpression(&op)) {
3662  for (auto result : op.getResults()) {
3663  StringRef declName =
3664  getVerilogDeclWord(&op, moduleEmitter.state.options);
3665  maxDeclNameWidth = std::max(declName.size(), maxDeclNameWidth);
3666  SmallString<16> typeString;
3667 
3668  // Convert the port's type to a string and measure it.
3669  {
3670  llvm::raw_svector_ostream stringStream(typeString);
3671  moduleEmitter.printPackedType(stripUnpackedTypes(result.getType()),
3672  stringStream, op.getLoc());
3673  }
3674  if (typeString.size() <= maxTypeWidthBound)
3675  maxTypeWidth = std::max(typeString.size(), maxTypeWidth);
3676  }
3677  }
3678 
3679  // Recursively process any regions under the op iff this is a procedural
3680  // #ifdef region: we need to emit automatic logic values at the top of the
3681  // enclosing region.
3682  if (isa<IfDefProceduralOp, OrderedOutputOp>(op)) {
3683  for (auto &region : op.getRegions()) {
3684  if (!region.empty())
3685  collectNames(region.front());
3686  }
3687  continue;
3688  }
3689  }
3690 }

3851 /// Emit the specified value as an expression. If this is an inline-emitted
3852 /// expression, we emit that expression, otherwise we emit a reference to the
3853 /// already computed name.
3854 ///
3855 void StmtEmitter::emitExpression(Value exp,
3856  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &emittedExprs,
3857  VerilogPrecedence parenthesizeIfLooserThan,
3858  bool isAssignmentLikeContext) {
3859  ExprEmitter(emitter, emittedExprs)
3860  .emitExpression(exp, parenthesizeIfLooserThan, isAssignmentLikeContext);

3863 /// Emit SystemVerilog attributes attached to the statement op as dialect
3864 /// attributes.
3865 void StmtEmitter::emitSVAttributes(Operation *op) {
3866  // SystemVerilog 2017 Section 5.12.
3867  auto svAttrs = getSVAttributes(op);
3868  if (!svAttrs)
3869  return;
3870 
3871  startStatement(); // For attributes.
3872  emitSVAttributesImpl(ps, svAttrs, /*mayBreak=*/true);
3873  setPendingNewline();
3874 }
3875 
3876 void StmtEmitter::emitAssignLike(llvm::function_ref<void()> emitLHS,
3877  llvm::function_ref<void()> emitRHS,
3878  PPExtString syntax, PPExtString postSyntax,
3879  std::optional<PPExtString> wordBeforeLHS) {
3880  // If wraps, indent.
3881  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
3882  if (wordBeforeLHS) {
3883  ps << *wordBeforeLHS << PP::space;
3884  }
3885  emitLHS();
3886  // Allow breaking before 'syntax' (e.g., '=') if long assignment.
3887  ps << PP::space << syntax << PP::space;
3888  // RHS is boxed to right of the syntax.
3889  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
3890  emitRHS();
3891  ps << postSyntax;
3892  });
3893  });
3894 }
3895 
3896 template <typename Op>
3897 LogicalResult
3898 StmtEmitter::emitAssignLike(Op op, PPExtString syntax,
3899  std::optional<PPExtString> wordBeforeLHS) {
3900  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
3901  ops.insert(op);
3902 
3903  startStatement();
3904  ps.addCallback({op, true});
3905  emitAssignLike([&]() { emitExpression(op.getDest(), ops); },
3906  [&]() {
3907  emitExpression(op.getSrc(), ops, LowestPrecedence,
3908  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/true);
3909  },
3910  syntax, PPExtString(";"), wordBeforeLHS);
3911 
3912  ps.addCallback({op, false});
3913  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
3914  return success();
3915 }
3916 
3917 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(AssignOp op) {
3918  // prepare assigns wires to instance outputs, but these are logically handled
3919  // in the port binding list when outputing an instance.
3920  if (dyn_cast_or_null<HWInstanceLike>(op.getSrc().getDefiningOp()))
3921  return success();
3922 
3923  if (emitter.assignsInlined.count(op))
3924  return success();
3925 
3926  // Emit SV attributes. See Spec 12.3.
3927  emitSVAttributes(op);
3928 
3929  return emitAssignLike(op, PPExtString("="), PPExtString("assign"));
3930 }
3931 
3932 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(BPAssignOp op) {
3933  // If the assign is emitted into logic declaration, we must not emit again.
3934  if (emitter.assignsInlined.count(op))
3935  return success();
3936 
3937  // Emit SV attributes. See Spec 12.3.
3938  emitSVAttributes(op);
3939 
3940  return emitAssignLike(op, PPExtString("="));
3941 }
3942 
3943 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(PAssignOp op) {
3944  // Emit SV attributes. See Spec 12.3.
3945  emitSVAttributes(op);
3946 
3947  return emitAssignLike(op, PPExtString("<="));
3948 }
3949 
3950 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(ForceOp op) {
3951  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
3952  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
3953 
3954  return emitAssignLike(op, PPExtString("="), PPExtString("force"));
3955 }
3956 
3957 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(ReleaseOp op) {
3958  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
3959  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
3960 
3961  startStatement();
3962  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
3963  ops.insert(op);
3964  ps.addCallback({op, true});
3965  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
3966  ps << "release" << PP::space;
3967  emitExpression(op.getDest(), ops);
3968  ps << ";";
3969  });
3970  ps.addCallback({op, false});
3971  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
3972  return success();
3973 }
3974 
3975 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(AliasOp op) {
3976  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
3977  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
3978 
3979  startStatement();
3980  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
3981  ops.insert(op);
3982  ps.addCallback({op, true});
3983  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
3984  ps << "alias" << PP::space;
3985  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() { // If any breaks, all break.
3986  llvm::interleave(
3987  op.getOperands(), [&](Value v) { emitExpression(v, ops); },
3988  [&]() { ps << PP::nbsp << "=" << PP::space; });
3989  ps << ";";
3990  });
3991  });
3992  ps.addCallback({op, false});
3993  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
3994  return success();
3995 }
3996 
3997 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(InterfaceInstanceOp op) {
3998  auto doNotPrint = op->hasAttr("doNotPrint");
3999  if (doNotPrint && !state.options.emitBindComments)
4000  return success();
4001 
4002  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4003  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4004 
4005  startStatement();
4006  StringRef prefix = "";
4007  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4008  if (doNotPrint) {
4009  prefix = "// ";
4010  ps << "// This interface is elsewhere emitted as a bind statement."
4011  << PP::newline;
4012  }
4013 
4014  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4015  ops.insert(op);
4016 
4017  auto *interfaceOp = op.getReferencedInterface(&state.symbolCache);
4018  assert(interfaceOp && "InterfaceInstanceOp has invalid symbol that does not "
4019  "point to an interface");
4020 
4021  auto verilogName = getSymOpName(interfaceOp);
4022  if (!prefix.empty())
4023  ps << PPExtString(prefix);
4024  ps << PPExtString(verilogName)
4025  << PP::nbsp /* don't break, may be comment line */
4026  << PPExtString(op.getName()) << "();";
4027 
4028  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4029  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4030 
4031  return success();
4032 }
4033 
4034 /// For OutputOp we put "assign" statements at the end of the Verilog module to
4035 /// assign the module outputs to intermediate wires.
4036 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitStmt(OutputOp op) {
4037  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4038  auto parent = op->getParentOfType<PortList>();
4039 
4040  size_t operandIndex = 0;
4041  ModulePortInfo ports(parent.getPortList());
4042  for (PortInfo port : ports.getOutputs()) {
4043  auto operand = op.getOperand(operandIndex);
4044  // Outputs that are set by the output port of an instance are handled
4045  // directly when the instance is emitted.
4046  // Keep synced with countStatements() and visitStmt(InstanceOp).
4047  if (operand.hasOneUse() && operand.getDefiningOp() &&
4048  isa<InstanceOp, InstanceChoiceOp>(operand.getDefiningOp())) {
4049  ++operandIndex;
4050  continue;
4051  }
4052 
4053  ops.clear();
4054  ops.insert(op);
4055 
4056  startStatement();
4057  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4058  bool isZeroBit = isZeroBitType(port.type);
4059  ps.scopedBox(isZeroBit ? PP::neverbox : PP::ibox2, [&]() {
4060  if (isZeroBit)
4061  ps << "// Zero width: ";
4062 
4063  ps << "assign" << PP::space;
4064  ps << PPExtString(port.getVerilogName());
4065  ps << PP::space << "=" << PP::space;
4066  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
4067  // If this is a zero-width constant then don't emit it (illegal). Else,
4068  // emit the expression - even for zero width - for traceability.
4069  if (isZeroBit &&
4070  isa_and_nonnull<hw::ConstantOp>(operand.getDefiningOp()))
4071  ps << "/*Zero width*/";
4072  else
4073  emitExpression(operand, ops, LowestPrecedence,
4074  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/true);
4075  ps << ";";
4076  });
4077  });
4078  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4079  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4080 
4081  ++operandIndex;
4082  }
4083  return success();
4084 }
4085 
4086 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitStmt(TypeScopeOp op) {
4087  startStatement();
4088  auto typescopeDef = ("_TYPESCOPE_" + op.getSymName()).str();
4089  ps << "`ifndef " << typescopeDef << PP::newline;
4090  ps << "`define " << typescopeDef;
4091  setPendingNewline();
4092  emitStatementBlock(*op.getBodyBlock());
4093  startStatement();
4094  ps << "`endif // " << typescopeDef;
4095  setPendingNewline();
4096  return success();
4097 }
4098 
4099 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitStmt(TypedeclOp op) {
4100  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4101  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4102 
4103  startStatement();
4104  auto zeroBitType = isZeroBitType(op.getType());
4105  if (zeroBitType)
4106  ps << PP::neverbox << "// ";
4107 
4108  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4109  ops.insert(op);
4110  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
4111  ps << "typedef" << PP::space;
4112  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
4113  emitter.printPackedType(stripUnpackedTypes(op.getType()), os, op.getLoc(),
4114  op.getAliasType(), false);
4115  });
4116  ps << PP::space << PPExtString(op.getPreferredName());
4117  ps.invokeWithStringOS(
4118  [&](auto &os) { emitter.printUnpackedTypePostfix(op.getType(), os); });
4119  ps << ";";
4120  });
4121  if (zeroBitType)
4122  ps << PP::end;
4123  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4124  return success();
4125 }
4126 
4127 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(FWriteOp op) {
4128  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4129  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4130 
4131  startStatement();
4132  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4133  ops.insert(op);
4134 
4135  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4136  ps << "$fwrite(";
4137  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
4138  emitExpression(op.getFd(), ops);
4139 
4140  ps << "," << PP::space;
4141  ps.writeQuotedEscaped(op.getFormatString());
4142 
4143  // TODO: if any of these breaks, it'd be "nice" to break
4144  // after the comma, instead of:
4145  // $fwrite(5, "...", a + b,
4146  // longexpr_goes
4147  // + here, c);
4148  // (without forcing breaking between all elements, like braced list)
4149  for (auto operand : op.getSubstitutions()) {
4150  ps << "," << PP::space;
4151  emitExpression(operand, ops);
4152  }
4153  ps << ");";
4154  });
4155  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4156  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4157  return success();
4158 }
4159 
4160 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(VerbatimOp op) {
4161  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4162  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4163 
4164  startStatement();
4165  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4166  ops.insert(op);
4167  ps << PP::neverbox;
4168 
4169  // Drop an extraneous \n off the end of the string if present.
4170  StringRef string = op.getFormatString();
4171  if (string.ends_with("\n"))
4172  string = string.drop_back();
4173 
4174  // Emit each \n separated piece of the string with each piece properly
4175  // indented. The convention is to not emit the \n so
4176  // emitLocationInfoAndNewLine can do that for the last line.
4177  bool isFirst = true;
4178 
4179  // Emit each line of the string at a time.
4180  while (!string.empty()) {
4181  auto lhsRhs = string.split('\n');
4182  if (isFirst)
4183  isFirst = false;
4184  else {
4185  ps << PP::end << PP::newline << PP::neverbox;
4186  }
4187 
4188  // Emit each chunk of the line.
4189  emitTextWithSubstitutions(
4190  ps, lhsRhs.first, op,
4191  [&](Value operand) { emitExpression(operand, ops); }, op.getSymbols());
4192  string = lhsRhs.second;
4193  }
4194 
4195  ps << PP::end;
4196 
4197  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4198  return success();
4199 }

4203 StmtEmitter::emitSimulationControlTask(Operation *op, PPExtString taskName,

4214  ps << "(";
4215  ps.addAsString(*verbosity);
4216  ps << ")";
4217  }
4218  ps << ";";
4219  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4220  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4221  return success();
4222 }

4237 /// Emit one of the severity message tasks `$fatal`, `$error`, `$warning`, or
4238 /// `$info`.
4239 LogicalResult
4240 StmtEmitter::emitSeverityMessageTask(Operation *op, PPExtString taskName,
4241  std::optional<unsigned> verbosity,
4242  StringAttr message, ValueRange operands) {
4243  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4244  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4245 
4246  startStatement();
4247  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4248  ops.insert(op);
4249  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4250  ps << taskName;
4251 
4252  // In case we have a message to print, or the operation has an optional
4253  // verbosity and that verbosity is present, print the parenthesized parameter
4254  // list.
4255  if ((verbosity && *verbosity != 1) || message) {
4256  ps << "(";
4257  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
4258  // If the operation takes a verbosity, print it if it is set, or print the
4259  // default "1".
4260  if (verbosity)
4261  ps.addAsString(*verbosity);
4262 
4263  // Print the message and interpolation operands if present.
4264  if (message) {
4265  if (verbosity)
4266  ps << "," << PP::space;
4267  ps.writeQuotedEscaped(message.getValue());
4268  // TODO: good comma/wrapping behavior as elsewhere.
4269  for (auto operand : operands) {
4270  ps << "," << PP::space;
4271  emitExpression(operand, ops);
4272  }
4273  }
4274 
4275  ps << ")";
4276  });
4277  }
4278 
4279  ps << ";";
4280  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4281  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4282  return success();
4283 }

4349 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(GenerateCaseOp op) {
4350  emitSVAttributes(op);
4351  // TODO: location info?
4352  startStatement();
4353  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4354  ps << "case (";
4355  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
4356  emitter.printParamValue(
4357  op.getCond(), os, VerilogPrecedence::Selection,
4358  [&]() { return op->emitOpError("invalid case parameter"); });
4359  });
4360  ps << ")";
4361  setPendingNewline();
4362 
4363  // Ensure that all of the per-case arrays are the same length.
4364  ArrayAttr patterns = op.getCasePatterns();
4365  ArrayAttr caseNames = op.getCaseNames();
4366  MutableArrayRef<Region> regions = op.getCaseRegions();
4367  assert(patterns.size() == regions.size());
4368  assert(patterns.size() == caseNames.size());
4369 
4370  // TODO: We'll probably need to store the legalized names somewhere for
4371  // `verbose` formatting. Set up the infra for storing names recursively. Just
4372  // store this locally for now.
4373  llvm::StringMap<size_t> nextGenIds;
4374  ps.scopedBox(PP::bbox2, [&]() {
4375  // Emit each case.
4376  for (size_t i = 0, e = patterns.size(); i < e; ++i) {
4377  auto &region = regions[i];
4378  assert(region.hasOneBlock());
4379  Attribute patternAttr = patterns[i];
4380 
4381  startStatement();
4382  if (!patternAttr.isa<mlir::TypedAttr>())
4383  ps << "default";
4384  else
4385  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
4386  emitter.printParamValue(
4387  patternAttr, os, VerilogPrecedence::LowestPrecedence,
4388  [&]() { return op->emitOpError("invalid case value"); });
4389  });
4390 
4391  StringRef legalName =
4392  legalizeName(caseNames[i].cast<StringAttr>().getValue(), nextGenIds,
4393  options.caseInsensitiveKeywords);
4394  ps << ": begin: " << PPExtString(legalName);
4395  setPendingNewline();
4396  emitStatementBlock(region.getBlocks().front());
4397  startStatement();
4398  ps << "end: " << PPExtString(legalName);
4399  setPendingNewline();
4400  }
4401  });
4402 
4403  startStatement();
4404  ps << "endcase";
4405  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4406  setPendingNewline();
4407  return success();
4408 }
4409 
4410 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(ForOp op) {
4411  emitSVAttributes(op);
4412  llvm::SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4413  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4414  startStatement();
4415  auto inductionVarName = op->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>("hw.verilogName");
4416  ps << "for (";
4417  // Emit statements on same line if possible, or put each on own line.
4418  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
4419  // Emit initialization assignment.
4420  emitAssignLike(
4421  [&]() {
4422  ps << "logic" << PP::nbsp;
4423  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
4424  emitter.emitTypeDims(op.getInductionVar().getType(), op.getLoc(),
4425  os);
4426  });
4427  ps << PP::nbsp << PPExtString(inductionVarName);
4428  },
4429  [&]() { emitExpression(op.getLowerBound(), ops); }, PPExtString("="));
4430  // Break between statements.
4431  ps << PP::space;
4432 
4433  // Emit bounds-check statement.
4434  emitAssignLike([&]() { ps << PPExtString(inductionVarName); },
4435  [&]() { emitExpression(op.getUpperBound(), ops); },
4436  PPExtString("<"));
4437  // Break between statements.
4438  ps << PP::space;
4439 
4440  // Emit update statement and trailing syntax.
4441  emitAssignLike([&]() { ps << PPExtString(inductionVarName); },
4442  [&]() { emitExpression(op.getStep(), ops); },
4443  PPExtString("+="), PPExtString(") begin"));
4444  });
4445  // Don't break for because of newline.
4446  ps << PP::neverbreak;
4447  setPendingNewline();
4448  emitStatementBlock(op.getBody().getBlocks().front());
4449  startStatement();
4450  ps << "end";
4451  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4452  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4453  return success();
4454 }

4459  ps << PPExtString(label) << ":" << PP::space;

4462 /// Emit the optional ` else $error(...)` portion of an immediate or concurrent
4463 /// verification operation.
4464 void StmtEmitter::emitAssertionMessage(StringAttr message, ValueRange args,
4465  SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &ops,
4466  bool isConcurrent = false) {
4467  if (!message)
4468  return;
4469  ps << PP::space << "else" << PP::nbsp << "$error(";
4470  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
4471  ps.writeQuotedEscaped(message.getValue());
4472  // TODO: box, break/wrap behavior!
4473  for (auto arg : args) {
4474  ps << "," << PP::space;
4475  emitExpression(arg, ops);
4476  }
4477  ps << ")";
4478  });
4479 }

4481 template <typename Op>
4482 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::emitImmediateAssertion(Op op, PPExtString opName) {
4483  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4484  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4485 
4486  startStatement();
4487  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4488  ops.insert(op);
4489  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4490  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
4491  emitAssertionLabel(op);
4492  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
4493  ps << opName;
4494  switch (op.getDefer()) {
4495  case DeferAssert::Immediate:
4496  break;
4497  case DeferAssert::Observed:
4498  ps << " #0 ";
4499  break;
4500  case DeferAssert::Final:
4501  ps << " final ";
4502  break;
4503  }
4504  ps << "(";
4505  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
4506  emitExpression(op.getExpression(), ops);
4507  ps << ")";
4508  });
4509  emitAssertionMessage(op.getMessageAttr(), op.getSubstitutions(), ops);
4510  ps << ";";
4511  });
4512  });
4513  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4514  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4515  return success();
4516 }

4530 template <typename Op>
4531 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::emitConcurrentAssertion(Op op, PPExtString opName) {
4532  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4533  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4534 
4535  startStatement();
4536  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4537  ops.insert(op);
4538  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4539  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
4540  emitAssertionLabel(op);
4541  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
4542  ps << opName << PP::nbsp << "property (";
4543  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
4544  ps << "@(" << PPExtString(stringifyEventControl(op.getEvent()))
4545  << PP::nbsp;
4546  emitExpression(op.getClock(), ops);
4547  ps << ")" << PP::space;
4548  emitExpression(op.getProperty(), ops);
4549  ps << ")";
4550  });
4551  emitAssertionMessage(op.getMessageAttr(), op.getSubstitutions(), ops,
4552  true);
4553  ps << ";";
4554  });
4555  });
4556  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4557  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4558  return success();
4559 }

4573 /// Emit an assert-like operation from the `verif` dialect. This covers
4574 /// `verif.assert`, `verif.assume`, and `verif.cover`.
4575 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::emitVerifAssertLike(Operation *op, Value property,
4576  PPExtString opName) {
4577  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4578  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4579 
4580  // If we are inside a procedural region we have the option of emitting either
4581  // an `assert` or `assert property`. If we are in a non-procedural region,
4582  // e.g., the body of a module, we have to use the concurrent form `assert
4583  // property` (which also supports plain booleans).
4584  //
4585  // See IEEE 1800-2017 section 16.14.5 "Using concurrent assertion statements
4586  // outside procedural code" and 16.14.6 "Embedding concurrent assertions in
4587  // procedural code".
4588  bool isTemporal = !property.getType().isSignlessInteger(1);
4589  bool isProcedural = op->getParentOp()->hasTrait<ProceduralRegion>();
4590  bool emitAsImmediate = !isTemporal && isProcedural;
4591 
4592  startStatement();
4593  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4594  ops.insert(op);
4595  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4596  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
4597  emitAssertionLabel(op);
4598  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
4599  if (emitAsImmediate)
4600  ps << opName << "(";
4601  else
4602  ps << opName << PP::nbsp << "property" << PP::nbsp << "(";
4603  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox2, [&]() {
4604  PropertyEmitter(emitter, ops).emitProperty(property);
4605  ps << ");";
4606  });
4607  });
4608  });
4609  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4610  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4611  return success();
4612 }
4613 
4614 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitVerif(verif::AssertOp op) {
4615  return emitVerifAssertLike(op, op.getProperty(), PPExtString("assert"));
4616 }
4617 
4618 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitVerif(verif::AssumeOp op) {
4619  return emitVerifAssertLike(op, op.getProperty(), PPExtString("assume"));
4620 }
4621 
4622 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitVerif(verif::CoverOp op) {
4623  return emitVerifAssertLike(op, op.getProperty(), PPExtString("cover"));
4624 }

4626 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::emitIfDef(Operation *op, MacroIdentAttr cond) {
4627  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4628  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
4629 
4630  auto ident = PPExtString(cond.getName());
4631 
4632  startStatement();
4633  bool hasEmptyThen = op->getRegion(0).front().empty();
4634  if (hasEmptyThen)
4635  ps << "`ifndef " << ident;
4636  else
4637  ps << "`ifdef " << ident;
4638 
4639  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4640  ops.insert(op);
4641  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4642 
4643  if (!hasEmptyThen)
4644  emitStatementBlock(op->getRegion(0).front());
4645 
4646  if (!op->getRegion(1).empty()) {
4647  if (!hasEmptyThen) {
4648  startStatement();
4649  ps << "`else // " << ident;
4650  setPendingNewline();
4651  }
4652  emitStatementBlock(op->getRegion(1).front());
4653  }
4654  startStatement();
4655  ps << "`endif // ";
4656  if (hasEmptyThen)
4657  ps << "not def ";
4658  ps << ident;
4659  setPendingNewline();
4660  return success();
4661 }

4663 /// Emit the body of a control flow statement that is surrounded by begin/end
4664 /// markers if non-singular. If the control flow construct is multi-line and
4665 /// if multiLineComment is non-null, the string is included in a comment after
4666 /// the 'end' to make it easier to associate.
4667 void StmtEmitter::emitBlockAsStatement(
4668  Block *block, const SmallPtrSetImpl<Operation *> &locationOps,
4669  StringRef multiLineComment) {
4670 
4671  // Determine if we need begin/end by scanning the block.
4672  auto count = countStatements(*block);
4673  auto needsBeginEnd = count != BlockStatementCount::One;
4674  if (needsBeginEnd)
4675  ps << " begin";
4676  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(locationOps);
4677 
4678  if (count != BlockStatementCount::Zero)
4679  emitStatementBlock(*block);
4680 
4681  if (needsBeginEnd) {
4682  startStatement();
4683  ps << "end";
4684  // Emit comment if there's an 'end', regardless of line count.
4685  if (!multiLineComment.empty())
4686  ps << " // " << multiLineComment;
4687  setPendingNewline();
4688  }
4689 }
4690 
4691 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(OrderedOutputOp ooop) {
4692  // Emit the body.
4693  for (auto &op : ooop.getBody().front())
4694  emitStatement(&op);
4695  return success();
4696 }
4697 
4698 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(IfOp op) {
4699  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4700 
4701  auto ifcondBox = PP::ibox2;
4702 
4703  emitSVAttributes(op);
4704  startStatement();
4705  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4706  ps << "if (" << ifcondBox;
4707 
4708  // In the loop, emit an if statement assuming the keyword introducing
4709  // it (either "if (" or "else if (") was printed already.
4710  IfOp ifOp = op;
4711  for (;;) {
4712  ops.clear();
4713  ops.insert(ifOp);
4714 
4715  // Emit the condition and the then block.
4716  emitExpression(ifOp.getCond(), ops);
4717  ps << PP::end << ")";
4718  emitBlockAsStatement(ifOp.getThenBlock(), ops);
4719 
4720  if (!ifOp.hasElse())
4721  break;
4722 
4723  startStatement();
4724  Block *elseBlock = ifOp.getElseBlock();
4725  auto nestedElseIfOp = findNestedElseIf(elseBlock);
4726  if (!nestedElseIfOp) {
4727  // The else block does not contain an if-else that can be flattened.
4728  ops.clear();
4729  ops.insert(ifOp);
4730  ps << "else";
4731  emitBlockAsStatement(elseBlock, ops);
4732  break;
4733  }
4734 
4735  // Introduce the 'else if', and iteratively continue unfolding any if-else
4736  // statements inside of it.
4737  ifOp = nestedElseIfOp;
4738  ps << "else if (" << ifcondBox;
4739  }
4740  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4741 
4742  return success();
4743 }
4744 
4745 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(AlwaysOp op) {
4746  emitSVAttributes(op);
4747  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4748  ops.insert(op);
4749  startStatement();
4750 
4751  auto printEvent = [&](AlwaysOp::Condition cond) {
4752  ps << PPExtString(stringifyEventControl(cond.event)) << PP::nbsp;
4753  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() { emitExpression(cond.value, ops); });
4754  };
4755  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4756 
4757  switch (op.getNumConditions()) {
4758  case 0:
4759  ps << "always @*";
4760  break;
4761  case 1:
4762  ps << "always @(";
4763  printEvent(op.getCondition(0));
4764  ps << ")";
4765  break;
4766  default:
4767  ps << "always @(";
4768  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
4769  printEvent(op.getCondition(0));
4770  for (size_t i = 1, e = op.getNumConditions(); i != e; ++i) {
4771  ps << PP::space << "or" << PP::space;
4772  printEvent(op.getCondition(i));
4773  }
4774  ps << ")";
4775  });
4776  break;
4777  }
4778 
4779  // Build the comment string, leave out the signal expressions (since they
4780  // can be large).
4781  std::string comment;
4782  if (op.getNumConditions() == 0) {
4783  comment = "always @*";
4784  } else {
4785  comment = "always @(";
4786  llvm::interleave(
4787  op.getEvents(),
4788  [&](Attribute eventAttr) {
4789  auto event = sv::EventControl(eventAttr.cast<IntegerAttr>().getInt());
4790  comment += stringifyEventControl(event);
4791  },
4792  [&]() { comment += ", "; });
4793  comment += ')';
4794  }
4795 
4796  emitBlockAsStatement(op.getBodyBlock(), ops, comment);
4797  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4798  return success();
4799 }
4800 
4801 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(AlwaysCombOp op) {
4802  emitSVAttributes(op);
4803  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4804  ops.insert(op);
4805  startStatement();
4806 
4807  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4808  StringRef opString = "always_comb";
4809  if (state.options.noAlwaysComb)
4810  opString = "always @(*)";
4811 
4812  ps << PPExtString(opString);
4813  emitBlockAsStatement(op.getBodyBlock(), ops, opString);
4814  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4815  return success();
4816 }
4817 
4818 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(AlwaysFFOp op) {
4819  emitSVAttributes(op);
4820 
4821  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4822  ops.insert(op);
4823  startStatement();
4824 
4825  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4826  ps << "always_ff @(";
4827  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
4828  ps << PPExtString(stringifyEventControl(op.getClockEdge())) << PP::nbsp;
4829  emitExpression(op.getClock(), ops);
4830  if (op.getResetStyle() == ResetType::AsyncReset) {
4831  ps << PP::nbsp << "or" << PP::space
4832  << PPExtString(stringifyEventControl(*op.getResetEdge())) << PP::nbsp;
4833  emitExpression(op.getReset(), ops);
4834  }
4835  ps << ")";
4836  });
4837 
4838  // Build the comment string, leave out the signal expressions (since they
4839  // can be large).
4840  std::string comment;
4841  comment += "always_ff @(";
4842  comment += stringifyEventControl(op.getClockEdge());
4843  if (op.getResetStyle() == ResetType::AsyncReset) {
4844  comment += " or ";
4845  comment += stringifyEventControl(*op.getResetEdge());
4846  }
4847  comment += ')';
4848 
4849  if (op.getResetStyle() == ResetType::NoReset)
4850  emitBlockAsStatement(op.getBodyBlock(), ops, comment);
4851  else {
4852  ps << " begin";
4853  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4854  ps.scopedBox(PP::bbox2, [&]() {
4855  startStatement();
4856  ps << "if (";
4857  // TODO: group, like normal 'if'.
4858  // Negative edge async resets need to invert the reset condition. This
4859  // is noted in the op description.
4860  if (op.getResetStyle() == ResetType::AsyncReset &&
4861  *op.getResetEdge() == sv::EventControl::AtNegEdge)
4862  ps << "!";
4863  emitExpression(op.getReset(), ops);
4864  ps << ")";
4865  emitBlockAsStatement(op.getResetBlock(), ops);
4866  startStatement();
4867  ps << "else";
4868  emitBlockAsStatement(op.getBodyBlock(), ops);
4869  });
4870 
4871  startStatement();
4872  ps << "end";
4873  ps << " // " << comment;
4874  setPendingNewline();
4875  }
4876  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4877  return success();
4878 }

4880 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(InitialOp op) {
4881  emitSVAttributes(op);
4882  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4883  ops.insert(op);
4884  startStatement();
4885  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4886  ps << "initial";
4887  emitBlockAsStatement(op.getBodyBlock(), ops, "initial");
4888  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4889  return success();
4890 }
4891 
4892 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(CaseOp op) {
4893  emitSVAttributes(op);
4894  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops, emptyOps;
4895  ops.insert(op);
4896  startStatement();
4897  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4898  if (op.getValidationQualifier() !=
4899  ValidationQualifierTypeEnum::ValidationQualifierPlain)
4900  ps << PPExtString(circt::sv::stringifyValidationQualifierTypeEnum(
4901  op.getValidationQualifier()))
4902  << PP::nbsp;
4903  const char *opname = nullptr;
4904  switch (op.getCaseStyle()) {
4905  case CaseStmtType::CaseStmt:
4906  opname = "case";
4907  break;
4908  case CaseStmtType::CaseXStmt:
4909  opname = "casex";
4910  break;
4911  case CaseStmtType::CaseZStmt:
4912  opname = "casez";
4913  break;
4914  }
4915  ps << opname << " (";
4916  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
4917  emitExpression(op.getCond(), ops);
4918  ps << ")";
4919  });
4920  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4921 
4922  ps.scopedBox(PP::bbox2, [&]() {
4923  for (auto &caseInfo : op.getCases()) {
4924  startStatement();
4925  auto &pattern = caseInfo.pattern;
4926 
4927  llvm::TypeSwitch<CasePattern *>(pattern.get())
4928  .Case<CaseBitPattern>([&](auto bitPattern) {
4929  // TODO: We could emit in hex if/when the size is a multiple of
4930  // 4 and there are no x's crossing nibble boundaries.
4931  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
4932  os << bitPattern->getWidth() << "'b";
4933  for (size_t bit = 0, e = bitPattern->getWidth(); bit != e; ++bit)
4934  os << getLetter(bitPattern->getBit(e - bit - 1));
4935  });
4936  })
4937  .Case<CaseEnumPattern>([&](auto enumPattern) {
4938  ps << PPExtString(emitter.fieldNameResolver.getEnumFieldName(
4939  enumPattern->attr().template cast<hw::EnumFieldAttr>()));
4940  })
4941  .Case<CaseDefaultPattern>([&](auto) { ps << "default"; })
4942  .Default([&](auto) { assert(false && "unhandled case pattern"); });
4943 
4944  ps << ":";
4945  emitBlockAsStatement(caseInfo.block, emptyOps);
4946  }
4947  });
4948 
4949  startStatement();
4950  ps << "endcase";
4951  ps.addCallback({op, false});
4952  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
4953  return success();
4954 }
4955 
4956 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitStmt(InstanceOp op) {
4957  bool doNotPrint = op->hasAttr("doNotPrint");
4958  if (doNotPrint && !state.options.emitBindComments)
4959  return success();
4960 
4961  // Emit SV attributes if the op is not emitted as a bind statement.
4962  if (!doNotPrint)
4963  emitSVAttributes(op);
4964  startStatement();
4965  ps.addCallback({op, true});
4966  if (doNotPrint) {
4967  ps << PP::ibox2
4968  << "/* This instance is elsewhere emitted as a bind statement."
4969  << PP::newline;
4970  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
4971  op->emitWarning() << "is emitted as a bind statement but has SV "
4972  "attributes. The attributes will not be emitted.";
4973  }
4974 
4975  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
4976  ops.insert(op);
4977 
4978  // Use the specified name or the symbol name as appropriate.
4979  auto *moduleOp =
4980  state.symbolCache.getDefinition(op.getReferencedModuleNameAttr());
4981  assert(moduleOp && "Invalid IR");
4982  ps << PPExtString(getVerilogModuleName(moduleOp));
4983 
4984  // If this is a parameterized module, then emit the parameters.
4985  if (!op.getParameters().empty()) {
4986  // All the parameters may be defaulted -- don't print out an empty list if
4987  // so.
4988  bool printed = false;
4989  for (auto params :
4990  llvm::zip(op.getParameters(),
4991  moduleOp->getAttrOfType<ArrayAttr>("parameters"))) {
4992  auto param = std::get<0>(params).cast<ParamDeclAttr>();
4993  auto modParam = std::get<1>(params).cast<ParamDeclAttr>();
4994  // Ignore values that line up with their default.
4995  if (param.getValue() == modParam.getValue())
4996  continue;
4997 
4998  // Handle # if this is the first parameter we're printing.
4999  if (!printed) {
5000  ps << " #(" << PP::bbox2 << PP::newline;
5001  printed = true;
5002  } else {
5003  ps << "," << PP::newline;
5004  }
5005  ps << ".";
5006  ps << PPExtString(
5007  state.globalNames.getParameterVerilogName(moduleOp, param.getName()));
5008  ps << "(";
5009  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
5010  emitter.printParamValue(param.getValue(), os, [&]() {
5011  return op->emitOpError("invalid instance parameter '")
5012  << param.getName().getValue() << "' value";
5013  });
5014  });
5015  ps << ")";
5016  }
5017  if (printed) {
5018  ps << PP::end << PP::newline << ")";
5019  }
5020  }
5021 
5022  ps << PP::nbsp << PPExtString(getSymOpName(op));
5023 
5024  ModulePortInfo modPortInfo(cast<PortList>(moduleOp).getPortList());
5025  SmallVector<Value> instPortValues(modPortInfo.size());
5026  op.getValues(instPortValues, modPortInfo);
5027  emitInstancePortList(op, modPortInfo, instPortValues);
5028 
5029  ps.addCallback({op, false});
5030  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
5031  if (doNotPrint) {
5032  ps << PP::end;
5033  startStatement();
5034  ps << "*/";
5035  setPendingNewline();
5036  }
5037  return success();
5038 }
