5040 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitStmt(InstanceChoiceOp op) {
5041  startStatement();
5042  Operation *choiceMacroDeclOp = state.symbolCache.getDefinition(
5043  op->getAttrOfType<FlatSymbolRefAttr>("hw.choiceTarget"));
5044 
5045  ps << "`" << PPExtString(getSymOpName(choiceMacroDeclOp)) << PP::nbsp
5046  << PPExtString(getSymOpName(op));
5047 
5048  Operation *defaultModuleOp =
5049  state.symbolCache.getDefinition(op.getDefaultModuleNameAttr());
5050  ModulePortInfo modPortInfo(cast<PortList>(defaultModuleOp).getPortList());
5051  SmallVector<Value> instPortValues(modPortInfo.size());
5052  op.getValues(instPortValues, modPortInfo);
5053  emitInstancePortList(op, modPortInfo, instPortValues);
5054 
5055  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
5056  ops.insert(op);
5057  ps.addCallback({op, false});
5058  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
5059 
5060  return success();
5061 }
5062 
5063 void StmtEmitter::emitInstancePortList(Operation *op,
5064  ModulePortInfo &modPortInfo,
5065  ArrayRef<Value> instPortValues) {
5066  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
5067  ops.insert(op);
5068 
5069  auto containingModule = cast<HWModuleOp>(emitter.currentModuleOp);
5070  ModulePortInfo containingPortList(containingModule.getPortList());
5071 
5072  ps << " (";
5073 
5074  // Get the max port name length so we can align the '('.
5075  size_t maxNameLength = 0;
5076  for (auto &elt : modPortInfo) {
5077  maxNameLength = std::max(maxNameLength, elt.getVerilogName().size());
5078  }
5079 
5080  auto getWireForValue = [&](Value result) {
5081  return result.getUsers().begin()->getOperand(0);
5082  };
5083 
5084  // Emit the argument and result ports.
5085  bool isFirst = true; // True until we print a port.
5086  bool isZeroWidth = false;
5087 
5088  for (size_t portNum = 0, portEnd = modPortInfo.size(); portNum < portEnd;
5089  ++portNum) {
5090  auto &modPort = modPortInfo.at(portNum);
5091  isZeroWidth = isZeroBitType(modPort.type);
5092  Value portVal = instPortValues[portNum];
5093 
5094  // Decide if we should print a comma. We can't do this if we're the first
5095  // port or if all the subsequent ports are zero width.
5096  if (!isFirst) {
5097  bool shouldPrintComma = true;
5098  if (isZeroWidth) {
5099  shouldPrintComma = false;
5100  for (size_t i = portNum + 1, e = modPortInfo.size(); i != e; ++i)
5101  if (!isZeroBitType(modPortInfo.at(i).type)) {
5102  shouldPrintComma = true;
5103  break;
5104  }
5105  }
5106 
5107  if (shouldPrintComma)
5108  ps << ",";
5109  }
5110  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
5111 
5112  // Emit the port's name.
5113  startStatement();
5114  if (!isZeroWidth) {
5115  // If this is a real port we're printing, then it isn't the first one. Any
5116  // subsequent ones will need a comma.
5117  isFirst = false;
5118  ps << " ";
5119  } else {
5120  // We comment out zero width ports, so their presence and initializer
5121  // expressions are still emitted textually.
5122  ps << "//";
5123  }
5124 
5125  ps.scopedBox(isZeroWidth ? PP::neverbox : PP::ibox2, [&]() {
5126  auto modPortName = modPort.getVerilogName();
5127  ps << "." << PPExtString(modPortName);
5128  ps.spaces(maxNameLength - modPortName.size() + 1);
5129  ps << "(";
5130  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
5131  // Emit the value as an expression.
5132  ops.clear();
5133 
5134  // Output ports that are not connected to single use output ports were
5135  // lowered to wire.
5136  OutputOp output;
5137  if (!modPort.isOutput()) {
5138  if (isZeroWidth &&
5139  isa_and_nonnull<ConstantOp>(portVal.getDefiningOp()))
5140  ps << "/* Zero width */";
5141  else
5142  emitExpression(portVal, ops, LowestPrecedence);
5143  } else if (portVal.use_empty()) {
5144  ps << "/* unused */";
5145  } else if (portVal.hasOneUse() &&
5146  (output = dyn_cast_or_null<OutputOp>(
5147  portVal.getUses().begin()->getOwner()))) {
5148  // If this is directly using the output port of the containing module,
5149  // just specify that directly so we avoid a temporary wire.
5150  // Keep this synchronized with countStatements() and
5151  // visitStmt(OutputOp).
5152  size_t outputPortNo = portVal.getUses().begin()->getOperandNumber();
5153  ps << PPExtString(
5154  containingPortList.atOutput(outputPortNo).getVerilogName());
5155  } else {
5156  portVal = getWireForValue(portVal);
5157  emitExpression(portVal, ops);
5158  }
5159  ps << ")";
5160  });
5161  });
5162  }
5163  if (!isFirst || isZeroWidth) {
5164  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
5165  ops.clear();
5166  startStatement();
5167  }
5168  ps << ");";
5169 }
5170 
5171 // This may be called in the top-level, not just in an hw.module. Thus we can't
5172 // use the name map to find expression names for arguments to the instance, nor
5173 // do we need to emit subexpressions. Prepare pass, which has run for all
5174 // modules prior to this, has ensured that all arguments are bound to wires,
5175 // regs, or ports, with legalized names, so we can lookup up the names through
5176 // the IR.
5177 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::visitSV(BindOp op) {
5178  emitter.emitBind(op);
5179  assert(state.pendingNewline);
5180  return success();
5181 }

5190  ps << "interface " << PPExtString(getSymOpName(op)) << ";";
5191  setPendingNewline();
5192  // FIXME: Don't emit the body of this as general statements, they aren't!
5193  emitStatementBlock(*op.getBodyBlock());
5194  startStatement();
5195  ps << "endinterface" << PP::newline;

5279 
5280 void StmtEmitter::emitStatement(Operation *op) {
5281  // Expressions may either be ignored or emitted as an expression statements.
5282  if (isVerilogExpression(op))
5283  return;
5284 
5285  // Ignore LTL expressions as they are emitted as part of verification
5286  // statements. Ignore debug ops as they are emitted as part of debug info.
5287  if (isa<ltl::LTLDialect, debug::DebugDialect>(op->getDialect()))
5288  return;
5289 
5290  // Handle HW statements, SV statements.
5291  if (succeeded(dispatchStmtVisitor(op)) || succeeded(dispatchSVVisitor(op)) ||
5292  succeeded(dispatchVerifVisitor(op)))
5293  return;
5294 
5295  emitOpError(op, "emission to Verilog not supported");
5296  emitPendingNewlineIfNeeded();
5297  ps << "unknown MLIR operation " << PPExtString(op->getName().getStringRef());
5298  setPendingNewline();
5299 }
5300 
5301 /// Given an operation corresponding to a VerilogExpression, determine whether
5302 /// it is safe to emit inline into a 'localparam' or 'automatic logic' varaible
5303 /// initializer in a procedural region.
5304 ///
5305 /// We can't emit exprs inline when they refer to something else that can't be
5306 /// emitted inline, when they're in a general #ifdef region,
5307 static bool
5308 isExpressionEmittedInlineIntoProceduralDeclaration(Operation *op,
5309  StmtEmitter &stmtEmitter) {
5310  if (!isVerilogExpression(op))
5311  return false;
5312 
5313  // If the expression exists in an #ifdef region, then bail. Emitting it
5314  // inline would cause it to be executed unconditionally, because the
5315  // declarations are outside the #ifdef.
5316  if (isa<IfDefProceduralOp>(op->getParentOp()))
5317  return false;
5318 
5319  // This expression tree can be emitted into the initializer if all leaf
5320  // references are safe to refer to from here. They are only safe if they are
5321  // defined in an enclosing scope (guaranteed to already be live by now) or if
5322  // they are defined in this block and already emitted to an inline automatic
5323  // logic variable.
5324  SmallVector<Value, 8> exprsToScan(op->getOperands());
5325 
5326  // This loop is guaranteed to terminate because we're only scanning up
5327  // single-use expressions and other things that 'isExpressionEmittedInline'
5328  // returns success for. Cycles won't get in here.
5329  while (!exprsToScan.empty()) {
5330  Operation *expr = exprsToScan.pop_back_val().getDefiningOp();
5331  if (!expr)
5332  continue; // Ports are always safe to reference.
5333 
5334  // If this is an inout op, check that its inout op has no blocking
5335  // assignment. A register or logic might be mutated by a blocking assignment
5336  // so it is not always safe to inline.
5337  if (auto readInout = dyn_cast<sv::ReadInOutOp>(expr)) {
5338  auto *defOp = readInout.getOperand().getDefiningOp();
5339 
5340  // If it is a read from an inout port, it's unsafe to inline in general.
5341  if (!defOp)
5342  return false;
5343 
5344  // If the operand is a wire, it's OK to inline the read.
5345  if (isa<sv::WireOp>(defOp))
5346  continue;
5347 
5348  // Reject struct_field_inout/array_index_inout for now because it's
5349  // necessary to consider aliasing inout operations.
5350  if (!isa<RegOp, LogicOp>(defOp))
5351  return false;
5352 
5353  // It's safe to inline if all users are read op, passign or assign.
5354  // If the op is a logic op whose single assignment is inlined into
5355  // declaration, we can inline the read.
5356  if (isa<LogicOp>(defOp) &&
5357  stmtEmitter.emitter.expressionsEmittedIntoDecl.count(defOp))
5358  continue;
5359 
5360  // Check that it's safe for all users to be inlined.
5361  if (llvm::all_of(defOp->getResult(0).getUsers(), [&](Operation *op) {
5362  return isa<ReadInOutOp, PAssignOp, AssignOp>(op);
5363  }))
5364  continue;
5365  return false;
5366  }
5367 
5368  // If this is an internal node in the expression tree, process its operands.
5369  if (isExpressionEmittedInline(expr, stmtEmitter.state.options)) {
5370  exprsToScan.append(expr->getOperands().begin(),
5371  expr->getOperands().end());
5372  continue;
5373  }
5374 
5375  // Otherwise, this isn't an inlinable expression. If it is defined outside
5376  // this block, then it is live-in.
5377  if (expr->getBlock() != op->getBlock())
5378  continue;
5379 
5380  // Otherwise, if it is defined in this block then it is only ok to reference
5381  // if it has already been emitted into an automatic logic.
5382  if (!stmtEmitter.emitter.expressionsEmittedIntoDecl.count(expr))
5383  return false;
5384  }
5385 
5386  return true;
5387 }
5388 
5389 template <class AssignTy>
5390 static AssignTy getSingleAssignAndCheckUsers(Operation *op) {
5391  AssignTy singleAssign;
5392  if (llvm::all_of(op->getUsers(), [&](Operation *user) {
5393  if (hasSVAttributes(user))
5394  return false;
5395 
5396  if (auto assign = dyn_cast<AssignTy>(user)) {
5397  if (singleAssign)
5398  return false;
5399  singleAssign = assign;
5400  return true;
5401  }
5402 
5403  return isa<ReadInOutOp>(user);
5404  }))
5405  return singleAssign;
5406  return {};
5407 }
5408 
5409 /// Return true if `op1` dominates users of `op2`.
5410 static bool checkDominanceOfUsers(Operation *op1, Operation *op2) {
5411  return llvm::all_of(op2->getUsers(), [&](Operation *user) {
5412  /// TODO: Use MLIR DominanceInfo.
5413 
5414  // If the op1 and op2 are in different blocks, conservatively return false.
5415  if (op1->getBlock() != user->getBlock())
5416  return false;
5417 
5418  if (op1 == user)
5419  return true;
5420 
5421  return op1->isBeforeInBlock(user);
5422  });
5423 }
5424 
5425 LogicalResult StmtEmitter::emitDeclaration(Operation *op) {
5426  emitSVAttributes(op);
5427  auto value = op->getResult(0);
5428  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> opsForLocation;
5429  opsForLocation.insert(op);
5430  startStatement();
5431  ps.addCallback({op, true});
5432 
5433  // Emit the leading word, like 'wire', 'reg' or 'logic'.
5434  auto type = value.getType();
5435  auto word = getVerilogDeclWord(op, state.options);
5436  auto isZeroBit = isZeroBitType(type);
5437  ps.scopedBox(isZeroBit ? PP::neverbox : PP::ibox2, [&]() {
5438  unsigned targetColumn = 0;
5439  unsigned column = 0;
5440 
5441  // Emit the declaration keyword.
5442  if (maxDeclNameWidth > 0)
5443  targetColumn += maxDeclNameWidth + 1;
5444 
5445  if (isZeroBit) {
5446  ps << "// Zero width: " << PPExtString(word) << PP::space;
5447  } else if (!word.empty()) {
5448  ps << PPExtString(word);
5449  column += word.size();
5450  unsigned numSpaces = targetColumn > column ? targetColumn - column : 1;
5451  ps.spaces(numSpaces);
5452  column += numSpaces;
5453  }
5454 
5455  SmallString<8> typeString;
5456  // Convert the port's type to a string and measure it.
5457  {
5458  llvm::raw_svector_ostream stringStream(typeString);
5459  emitter.printPackedType(stripUnpackedTypes(type), stringStream,
5460  op->getLoc());
5461  }
5462  // Emit the type.
5463  if (maxTypeWidth > 0)
5464  targetColumn += maxTypeWidth + 1;
5465  unsigned numSpaces = 0;
5466  if (!typeString.empty()) {
5467  ps << typeString;
5468  column += typeString.size();
5469  ++numSpaces;
5470  }
5471  if (targetColumn > column)
5472  numSpaces = targetColumn - column;
5473  ps.spaces(numSpaces);
5474  column += numSpaces;
5475 
5476  // Emit the name.
5477  ps << PPExtString(getSymOpName(op));
5478 
5479  // Print out any array subscripts or other post-name stuff.
5480  ps.invokeWithStringOS(
5481  [&](auto &os) { emitter.printUnpackedTypePostfix(type, os); });
5482 
5483  // Print debug info.
5484  if (state.options.printDebugInfo) {
5485  if (auto innerSymOp = dyn_cast<hw::InnerSymbolOpInterface>(op)) {
5486  auto innerSym = innerSymOp.getInnerSymAttr();
5487  if (innerSym && !innerSym.empty()) {
5488  ps << " /* ";
5489  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) { os << innerSym; });
5490  ps << " */";
5491  }
5492  }
5493  }
5494 
5495  if (auto localparam = dyn_cast<LocalParamOp>(op)) {
5496  ps << PP::space << "=" << PP::space;
5497  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
5498  emitter.printParamValue(localparam.getValue(), os, [&]() {
5499  return op->emitOpError("invalid localparam value");
5500  });
5501  });
5502  }
5503 
5504  if (auto regOp = dyn_cast<RegOp>(op)) {
5505  if (auto initValue = regOp.getInit()) {
5506  ps << PP::space << "=" << PP::space;
5507  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
5508  emitExpression(initValue, opsForLocation, LowestPrecedence,
5509  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/true);
5510  });
5511  }
5512  }
5513 
5514  // Try inlining an assignment into declarations.
5515  if (isa<sv::WireOp, LogicOp>(op) &&
5516  !op->getParentOp()->hasTrait<ProceduralRegion>()) {
5517  // Get a single assignments if any.
5518  if (auto singleAssign = getSingleAssignAndCheckUsers<AssignOp>(op)) {
5519  auto *source = singleAssign.getSrc().getDefiningOp();
5520  // Check that the source value is OK to inline in the current emission
5521  // point. A port or constant is fine, otherwise check that the assign is
5522  // next to the operation.
5523  if (!source || isa<ConstantOp>(source) ||
5524  op->getNextNode() == singleAssign) {
5525  ps << PP::space << "=" << PP::space;
5526  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
5527  emitExpression(singleAssign.getSrc(), opsForLocation,
5528  LowestPrecedence,
5529  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/true);
5530  });
5531  emitter.assignsInlined.insert(singleAssign);
5532  }
5533  }
5534  }
5535 
5536  // Try inlining a blocking assignment to logic op declaration.
5537  if (isa<LogicOp>(op) && op->getParentOp()->hasTrait<ProceduralRegion>()) {
5538  // Get a single assignment which might be possible to inline.
5539  if (auto singleAssign = getSingleAssignAndCheckUsers<BPAssignOp>(op)) {
5540  // It is necessary for the assignment to dominate users of the op.
5541  if (checkDominanceOfUsers(singleAssign, op)) {
5542  auto *source = singleAssign.getSrc().getDefiningOp();
5543  // A port or constant can be inlined at everywhere. Otherwise, check
5544  // the validity by
5545  // `isExpressionEmittedInlineIntoProceduralDeclaration`.
5546  if (!source || isa<ConstantOp>(source) ||
5547  isExpressionEmittedInlineIntoProceduralDeclaration(source,
5548  *this)) {
5549  ps << PP::space << "=" << PP::space;
5550  ps.scopedBox(PP::ibox0, [&]() {
5551  emitExpression(singleAssign.getSrc(), opsForLocation,
5552  LowestPrecedence,
5553  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/true);
5554  });
5555  // Remember that the assignment and logic op are emitted into decl.
5556  emitter.assignsInlined.insert(singleAssign);
5557  emitter.expressionsEmittedIntoDecl.insert(op);
5558  }
5559  }
5560  }
5561  }
5562  ps << ";";
5563  });
5564  ps.addCallback({op, false});
5565  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(opsForLocation);
5566  return success();
5567 }
5568 
5569 void StmtEmitter::collectNamesAndCalculateDeclarationWidths(Block &block) {
5570  // In the first pass, we fill in the symbol table, calculate the max width
5571  // of the declaration words and the max type width.
5572  NameCollector collector(emitter);
5573  collector.collectNames(block);
5574 
5575  // Record maxDeclNameWidth and maxTypeWidth in the current scope.
5576  maxDeclNameWidth = collector.getMaxDeclNameWidth();
5577  maxTypeWidth = collector.getMaxTypeWidth();
5578 }
5579 
5580 void StmtEmitter::emitStatementBlock(Block &body) {
5581  ps.scopedBox(PP::bbox2, [&]() {
5582  // Ensure decl alignment values are preserved after the block is emitted.
5583  // These values were computed for and from all declarations in the current
5584  // block (before/after this nested block), so be sure they're restored
5585  // and not overwritten by the declaration alignment within the block.
5586  llvm::SaveAndRestore<size_t> x(maxDeclNameWidth);
5587  llvm::SaveAndRestore<size_t> x2(maxTypeWidth);
5588 
5589  // Build up the symbol table for all of the values that need names in the
5590  // module. #ifdef's in procedural regions are special because local
5591  // variables are all emitted at the top of their enclosing blocks.
5592  if (!isa<IfDefProceduralOp>(body.getParentOp()))
5593  collectNamesAndCalculateDeclarationWidths(body);
5594 
5595  // Emit the body.
5596  for (auto &op : body) {
5597  emitStatement(&op);
5598  }
5599  });
5600 }
5601 // NOLINTEND(misc-no-recursion)
5602 
5603 void ModuleEmitter::emitStatement(Operation *op) {
5604  StmtEmitter(*this, state.options).emitStatement(op);
5605 }
5606 
5607 /// Emit SystemVerilog attributes attached to the expression op as dialect
5608 /// attributes.
5609 void ModuleEmitter::emitSVAttributes(Operation *op) {
5610  // SystemVerilog 2017 Section 5.12.
5611  auto svAttrs = getSVAttributes(op);
5612  if (!svAttrs)
5613  return;
5614 
5615  startStatement(); // For attributes.
5616  emitSVAttributesImpl(ps, svAttrs, /*mayBreak=*/true);
5617  setPendingNewline();
5618 }

5621 // Module Driver
5622 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//

5624 void ModuleEmitter::emitHWExternModule(HWModuleExternOp module) {
5625  auto verilogName = module.getVerilogModuleNameAttr();
5626  startStatement();
5627  ps.addCallback({module, true});
5628  ps << "// external module " << PPExtString(verilogName.getValue())
5629  << PP::newline;
5630  ps.addCallback({module, false});
5631  setPendingNewline();
5632 }
5633 
5634 void ModuleEmitter::emitHWGeneratedModule(HWModuleGeneratedOp module) {
5635  auto verilogName = module.getVerilogModuleNameAttr();
5636  startStatement();
5637  ps << "// external generated module " << PPExtString(verilogName.getValue())
5638  << PP::newline;
5639  setPendingNewline();
5640 }
5641 
5642 // This may be called in the top-level, not just in an hw.module. Thus we can't
5643 // use the name map to find expression names for arguments to the instance, nor
5644 // do we need to emit subexpressions. Prepare pass, which has run for all
5645 // modules prior to this, has ensured that all arguments are bound to wires,
5646 // regs, or ports, with legalized names, so we can lookup up the names through
5647 // the IR.
5648 void ModuleEmitter::emitBind(BindOp op) {
5649  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
5650  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
5651  InstanceOp inst = op.getReferencedInstance(&state.symbolCache);
5652 
5653  HWModuleOp parentMod = inst->getParentOfType<hw::HWModuleOp>();
5654  ModulePortInfo parentPortList(parentMod.getPortList());
5655  auto parentVerilogName = getVerilogModuleNameAttr(parentMod);
5656 
5657  Operation *childMod =
5658  state.symbolCache.getDefinition(inst.getReferencedModuleNameAttr());
5659  auto childVerilogName = getVerilogModuleNameAttr(childMod);
5660 
5661  startStatement();
5662  ps.addCallback({op, true});
5663  ps << "bind " << PPExtString(parentVerilogName.getValue()) << PP::nbsp
5664  << PPExtString(childVerilogName.getValue()) << PP::nbsp
5665  << PPExtString(getSymOpName(inst)) << " (";
5666  bool isFirst = true; // True until we print a port.
5667  ps.scopedBox(PP::bbox2, [&]() {
5668  auto parentPortInfo = parentMod.getPortList();
5669  ModulePortInfo childPortInfo(cast<PortList>(childMod).getPortList());
5670 
5671  // Get the max port name length so we can align the '('.
5672  size_t maxNameLength = 0;
5673  for (auto &elt : childPortInfo) {
5674  auto portName = elt.getVerilogName();
5675  elt.name = Builder(inst.getContext()).getStringAttr(portName);
5676  maxNameLength = std::max(maxNameLength, elt.getName().size());
5677  }
5678 
5679  SmallVector<Value> instPortValues(childPortInfo.size());
5680  inst.getValues(instPortValues, childPortInfo);
5681  // Emit the argument and result ports.
5682  for (auto [idx, elt] : llvm::enumerate(childPortInfo)) {
5683  // Figure out which value we are emitting.
5684  Value portVal = instPortValues[idx];
5685  bool isZeroWidth = isZeroBitType(elt.type);
5686 
5687  // Decide if we should print a comma. We can't do this if we're the
5688  // first port or if all the subsequent ports are zero width.
5689  if (!isFirst) {
5690  bool shouldPrintComma = true;
5691  if (isZeroWidth) {
5692  shouldPrintComma = false;
5693  for (size_t i = idx + 1, e = childPortInfo.size(); i != e; ++i)
5694  if (!isZeroBitType(childPortInfo.at(i).type)) {
5695  shouldPrintComma = true;
5696  break;
5697  }
5698  }
5699 
5700  if (shouldPrintComma)
5701  ps << ",";
5702  }
5703  ps << PP::newline;
5704 
5705  // Emit the port's name.
5706  if (!isZeroWidth) {
5707  // If this is a real port we're printing, then it isn't the first
5708  // one. Any subsequent ones will need a comma.
5709  isFirst = false;
5710  } else {
5711  // We comment out zero width ports, so their presence and
5712  // initializer expressions are still emitted textually.
5713  ps << PP::neverbox << "//";
5714  }
5715 
5716  ps << "." << PPExtString(elt.getName());
5717  ps.nbsp(maxNameLength - elt.getName().size());
5718  ps << " (";
5719  llvm::SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 4> ops;
5720  if (elt.isOutput()) {
5721  assert((portVal.hasOneUse() || portVal.use_empty()) &&
5722  "output port must have either single or no use");
5723  if (portVal.use_empty()) {
5724  ps << "/* unused */";
5725  } else if (auto output = dyn_cast_or_null<OutputOp>(
5726  portVal.getUses().begin()->getOwner())) {
5727  // If this is directly using the output port of the containing
5728  // module, just specify that directly.
5729  size_t outputPortNo = portVal.getUses().begin()->getOperandNumber();
5730  ps << PPExtString(
5731  parentPortList.atOutput(outputPortNo).getVerilogName());
5732  } else {
5733  portVal = portVal.getUsers().begin()->getOperand(0);
5734  ExprEmitter(*this, ops)
5735  .emitExpression(portVal, LowestPrecedence,
5736  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/false);
5737  }
5738  } else {
5739  ExprEmitter(*this, ops)
5740  .emitExpression(portVal, LowestPrecedence,
5741  /*isAssignmentLikeContext=*/false);
5742  }
5743 
5744  ps << ")";
5745 
5746  if (isZeroWidth)
5747  ps << PP::end; // Close never-break group.
5748  }
5749  });
5750  if (!isFirst)
5751  ps << PP::newline;
5752  ps << ");";
5753  ps.addCallback({op, false});
5754  setPendingNewline();
5755 }
5756 
5757 void ModuleEmitter::emitBindInterface(BindInterfaceOp op) {
5758  if (hasSVAttributes(op))
5759  emitError(op, "SV attributes emission is unimplemented for the op");
5760 
5761  auto instance = op.getReferencedInstance(&state.symbolCache);
5762  auto instantiator = instance->getParentOfType<HWModuleOp>().getName();
5763  auto *interface = op->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>().lookupSymbol(
5764  instance.getInterfaceType().getInterface());
5765  startStatement();
5766  ps.addCallback({op, true});
5767  ps << "bind " << PPExtString(instantiator) << PP::nbsp
5768  << PPExtString(cast<InterfaceOp>(*interface).getSymName()) << PP::nbsp
5769  << PPExtString(getSymOpName(instance)) << " (.*);" << PP::newline;
5770  ps.addCallback({op, false});
5771  setPendingNewline();
5772 }
5773 
5774 void ModuleEmitter::emitParameters(Operation *module, ArrayAttr params) {
5775  if (params.empty())
5776  return;
5777 
5778  auto printParamType = [&](Type type, Attribute defaultValue,
5779  SmallString<8> &result) {
5780  result.clear();
5781  llvm::raw_svector_ostream sstream(result);
5782 
5783  // If there is a default value like "32" then just print without type at
5784  // all.
5785  if (defaultValue) {
5786  if (auto intAttr = defaultValue.dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>())
5787  if (intAttr.getValue().getBitWidth() == 32)
5788  return;
5789  if (auto fpAttr = defaultValue.dyn_cast<FloatAttr>())
5790  if (fpAttr.getType().isF64())
5791  return;
5792  }
5793  if (type.isa<NoneType>())
5794  return;
5795 
5796  // Classic Verilog parser don't allow a type in the parameter declaration.
5797  // For compatibility with them, we omit the type when it is implicit based
5798  // on its initializer value, and print the type commented out when it is
5799  // a 32-bit "integer" parameter.
5800  if (auto intType = type_dyn_cast<IntegerType>(type))
5801  if (intType.getWidth() == 32) {
5802  sstream << "/*integer*/";
5803  return;
5804  }
5805 
5806  printPackedType(type, sstream, module->getLoc(),
5807  /*optionalAliasType=*/Type(),
5808  /*implicitIntType=*/true,
5809  // Print single-bit values as explicit `[0:0]` type.
5810  /*singleBitDefaultType=*/false);
5811  };
5812 
5813  // Determine the max width of the parameter types so things are lined up.
5814  size_t maxTypeWidth = 0;
5815  SmallString<8> scratch;
5816  for (auto param : params) {
5817  auto paramAttr = param.cast<ParamDeclAttr>();
5818  // Measure the type length by printing it to a temporary string.
5819  printParamType(paramAttr.getType(), paramAttr.getValue(), scratch);
5820  maxTypeWidth = std::max(scratch.size(), maxTypeWidth);
5821  }
5822 
5823  if (maxTypeWidth > 0) // add a space if any type exists.
5824  maxTypeWidth += 1;
5825 
5826  ps.scopedBox(PP::bbox2, [&]() {
5827  ps << PP::newline << "#(";
5828  ps.scopedBox(PP::cbox0, [&]() {
5829  llvm::interleave(
5830  params,
5831  [&](Attribute param) {
5832  auto paramAttr = param.cast<ParamDeclAttr>();
5833  auto defaultValue = paramAttr.getValue(); // may be null if absent.
5834  ps << "parameter ";
5835  printParamType(paramAttr.getType(), defaultValue, scratch);
5836  if (!scratch.empty())
5837  ps << scratch;
5838  if (scratch.size() < maxTypeWidth)
5839  ps.nbsp(maxTypeWidth - scratch.size());
5840 
5841  ps << PPExtString(state.globalNames.getParameterVerilogName(
5842  module, paramAttr.getName()));
5843 
5844  if (defaultValue) {
5845  ps << " = ";
5846  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) {
5847  printParamValue(defaultValue, os, [&]() {
5848  return module->emitError("parameter '")
5849  << paramAttr.getName().getValue()
5850  << "' has invalid value";
5851  });
5852  });
5853  }
5854  },
5855  [&]() { ps << "," << PP::newline; });
5856  ps << ") ";
5857  });
5858  });
5859 }
5860 
5861 void ModuleEmitter::emitPortList(Operation *module,
5862  const ModulePortInfo &portInfo) {
5863  ps << "(";
5864  if (portInfo.size())
5865  emitLocationInfo(module->getLoc());
5866 
5867  // Determine the width of the widest type we have to print so everything
5868  // lines up nicely.
5869  bool hasOutputs = false, hasZeroWidth = false;
5870  size_t maxTypeWidth = 0, lastNonZeroPort = -1;
5871  SmallVector<SmallString<8>, 16> portTypeStrings;
5872 
5873  for (size_t i = 0, e = portInfo.size(); i < e; ++i) {
5874  auto port = portInfo.at(i);
5875  hasOutputs |= port.isOutput();
5876  hasZeroWidth |= isZeroBitType(port.type);
5877  if (!isZeroBitType(port.type))
5878  lastNonZeroPort = i;
5879 
5880  // Convert the port's type to a string and measure it.
5881  portTypeStrings.push_back({});
5882  {
5883  llvm::raw_svector_ostream stringStream(portTypeStrings.back());
5884  printPackedType(stripUnpackedTypes(port.type), stringStream,
5885  module->getLoc());
5886  }
5887 
5888  maxTypeWidth = std::max(portTypeStrings.back().size(), maxTypeWidth);
5889  }
5890 
5891  if (maxTypeWidth > 0) // add a space if any type exists
5892  maxTypeWidth += 1;
5893 
5894  // Emit the port list.
5895  ps.scopedBox(PP::bbox2, [&]() {
5896  for (size_t portIdx = 0, e = portInfo.size(); portIdx != e;) {
5897  auto lastPort = e - 1;
5898 
5899  ps << PP::newline;
5900  auto portType = portInfo.at(portIdx).type;
5901 
5902  // If this is a zero width type, emit the port as a comment and create a
5903  // neverbox to ensure we don't insert a line break.
5904  bool isZeroWidth = false;
5905  if (hasZeroWidth) {
5906  isZeroWidth = isZeroBitType(portType);
5907  if (isZeroWidth)
5908  ps << PP::neverbox;
5909  ps << (isZeroWidth ? "// " : " ");
5910  }
5911 
5912  // Emit the port direction.
5913  auto thisPortDirection = portInfo.at(portIdx).dir;
5914  switch (thisPortDirection) {
5915  case ModulePort::Direction::Output:
5916  ps << "output ";
5917  break;
5918  case ModulePort::Direction::Input:
5919  ps << (hasOutputs ? "input " : "input ");
5920  break;
5921  case ModulePort::Direction::InOut:
5922  ps << (hasOutputs ? "inout " : "inout ");
5923  break;
5924  }
5925  bool emitWireInPorts = state.options.emitWireInPorts;
5926  if (emitWireInPorts)
5927  ps << "wire ";
5928 
5929  // Emit the type.
5930  if (!portTypeStrings[portIdx].empty())
5931  ps << portTypeStrings[portIdx];
5932  if (portTypeStrings[portIdx].size() < maxTypeWidth)
5933  ps.nbsp(maxTypeWidth - portTypeStrings[portIdx].size());
5934 
5935  size_t startOfNamePos =
5936  (hasOutputs ? 7 : 6) + (emitWireInPorts ? 5 : 0) + maxTypeWidth;
5937 
5938  // Emit the name.
5939  ps << PPExtString(portInfo.at(portIdx).getVerilogName());
5940 
5941  // Emit array dimensions.
5942  ps.invokeWithStringOS(
5943  [&](auto &os) { printUnpackedTypePostfix(portType, os); });
5944 
5945  // Emit the symbol.
5946  auto innerSym = portInfo.at(portIdx).getSym();
5947  if (state.options.printDebugInfo && innerSym && !innerSym.empty()) {
5948  ps << " /* ";
5949  ps.invokeWithStringOS([&](auto &os) { os << innerSym; });
5950  ps << " */";
5951  }
5952 
5953  // Emit the comma if this is not the last real port.
5954  if (portIdx != lastNonZeroPort && portIdx != lastPort)
5955  ps << ",";
5956 
5957  // Emit the location.
5958  if (auto loc = portInfo.at(portIdx).loc)
5959  emitLocationInfo(loc);
5960 
5961  if (isZeroWidth)
5962  ps << PP::end; // Close never-break group.
5963 
5964  ++portIdx;
5965 
5966  // If we have any more ports with the same types and the same
5967  // direction, emit them in a list one per line. Optionally skip this
5968  // behavior when requested by user.
5969  if (!state.options.disallowPortDeclSharing) {
5970  while (portIdx != e && portInfo.at(portIdx).dir == thisPortDirection &&
5971  stripUnpackedTypes(portType) ==
5972  stripUnpackedTypes(portInfo.at(portIdx).type)) {
5973  auto port = portInfo.at(portIdx);
5974  // Append this to the running port decl.
5975  ps << PP::newline;
5976 
5977  bool isZeroWidth = false;
5978  if (hasZeroWidth) {
5979  isZeroWidth = isZeroBitType(portType);
5980  if (isZeroWidth)
5981  ps << PP::neverbox;
5982  ps << (isZeroWidth ? "// " : " ");
5983  }
5984 
5985  ps.nbsp(startOfNamePos);
5986 
5987  // Emit the name.
5988  StringRef name = port.getVerilogName();
5989  ps << PPExtString(name);
5990 
5991  // Emit array dimensions.
5992  ps.invokeWithStringOS(
5993  [&](auto &os) { printUnpackedTypePostfix(port.type, os); });
5994 
5995  // Emit the symbol.
5996  auto sym = port.getSym();
5997  if (state.options.printDebugInfo && sym && !sym.empty())
5998  ps << " /* inner_sym: " << PPExtString(sym.getSymName().getValue())
5999  << " */";
6000 
6001  // Emit the comma if this is not the last real port.
6002  if (portIdx != lastNonZeroPort && portIdx != lastPort)
6003  ps << ",";
6004 
6005  // Emit the location.
6006  if (auto loc = port.loc)
6007  emitLocationInfo(loc);
6008 
6009  if (isZeroWidth)
6010  ps << PP::end; // Close never-break group.
6011 
6012  ++portIdx;
6013  }
6014  }
6015  }
6016  });
6017 
6018  if (!portInfo.size()) {
6019  ps << ");";
6020  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> moduleOpSet;
6021  moduleOpSet.insert(module);
6022  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(moduleOpSet);
6023  } else {
6024  ps << PP::newline;
6025  ps << ");" << PP::newline;
6026  setPendingNewline();
6027  }
6028 }
6029 
6030 void ModuleEmitter::emitHWModule(HWModuleOp module) {
6031  currentModuleOp = module;
6032 
6033  emitComment(module.getCommentAttr());
6034  emitSVAttributes(module);
6035  startStatement();
6036  ps.addCallback({module, true});
6037  ps << "module " << PPExtString(getVerilogModuleName(module));
6038 
6039  // If we have any parameters, print them on their own line.
6040  emitParameters(module, module.getParameters());
6041 
6042  emitPortList(module, ModulePortInfo(module.getPortList()));
6043 
6044  assert(state.pendingNewline);
6045 
6046  // Emit the body of the module.
6047  StmtEmitter(*this, state.options).emitStatementBlock(*module.getBodyBlock());
6048  startStatement();
6049  ps << "endmodule";
6050  ps.addCallback({module, false});
6051  ps << PP::newline;
6052  setPendingNewline();
6053 
6054  currentModuleOp = nullptr;
6055 }
6056 
6057 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6058 // Emitter for files & file lists.
6059 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6060 
6061 class FileEmitter : public EmitterBase {
6062 public:
6063  explicit FileEmitter(VerilogEmitterState &state) : EmitterBase(state) {}
6064 
6065  void emit(emit::FileOp op) {
6066  emit(op.getBody());
6067  ps.eof();
6068  }
6069  void emit(emit::FragmentOp op) { emit(op.getBody()); }
6070  void emit(emit::FileListOp op);
6071 
6072 private:
6073  void emit(Block *block);
6074 
6075  void emitOp(emit::RefOp op);
6076  void emitOp(emit::VerbatimOp op);
6077 };
6078 
6079 void FileEmitter::emit(Block *block) {
6080  for (Operation &op : *block) {
6081  TypeSwitch<Operation *>(&op)
6082  .Case<emit::VerbatimOp, emit::RefOp>([&](auto op) { emitOp(op); })
6083  .Case<VerbatimOp, IfDefOp, MacroDefOp>(
6084  [&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitStatement(op); })
6085  .Case<BindOp>([&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitBind(op); })
6086  .Case<BindInterfaceOp>(
6087  [&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitBindInterface(op); })
6088  .Case<TypeScopeOp>([&](auto typedecls) {
6089  ModuleEmitter(state).emitStatement(typedecls);
6090  })
6091  .Default(
6092  [&](auto op) { emitOpError(op, "cannot be emitted to a file"); });
6093  }
6094 }
6095 
6096 void FileEmitter::emit(emit::FileListOp op) {
6097  // Find the associated file ops and write the paths on individual lines.
6098  for (auto sym : op.getFiles()) {
6099  auto fileName = cast<FlatSymbolRefAttr>(sym).getAttr();
6100 
6101  auto it = state.fileMapping.find(fileName);
6102  if (it == state.fileMapping.end()) {
6103  emitOpError(op, " references an invalid file: ") << sym;
6104  continue;
6105  }
6106 
6107  auto file = cast<emit::FileOp>(it->second);
6108  ps << PP::neverbox << PPExtString(file.getFileName()) << PP::end
6109  << PP::newline;
6110  }
6111  ps.eof();
6112 }
6113 
6114 void FileEmitter::emitOp(emit::RefOp op) {
6115  StringAttr target = op.getTargetAttr().getAttr();
6116  auto *targetOp = state.symbolCache.getDefinition(target);
6117  assert(targetOp->hasTrait<emit::Emittable>() && "target must be emittable");
6118 
6119  TypeSwitch<Operation *>(targetOp)
6120  .Case<hw::HWModuleOp>(
6121  [&](auto module) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitHWModule(module); })
6122  .Case<TypeScopeOp>([&](auto typedecls) {
6123  ModuleEmitter(state).emitStatement(typedecls);
6124  })
6125  .Default(
6126  [&](auto op) { emitOpError(op, "cannot be emitted to a file"); });
6127 }
6128 
6129 void FileEmitter::emitOp(emit::VerbatimOp op) {
6130  startStatement();
6131 
6132  SmallPtrSet<Operation *, 8> ops;
6133  ops.insert(op);
6134 
6135  // Emit each line of the string at a time, emitting the
6136  // location comment after the last emitted line.
6137  StringRef text = op.getText();
6138 
6139  ps << PP::neverbox;
6140  do {
6141  const auto &[lhs, rhs] = text.split('\n');
6142  if (!lhs.empty())
6143  ps << PPExtString(lhs);
6144  if (!rhs.empty())
6145  ps << PP::end << PP::newline << PP::neverbox;
6146  text = rhs;
6147  } while (!text.empty());
6148  ps << PP::end;
6149 
6150  emitLocationInfoAndNewLine(ops);
6151 }
6152 
6153 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6154 // Top level "file" emitter logic
6155 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6156 
6157 /// Organize the operations in the root MLIR module into output files to be
6158 /// generated. If `separateModules` is true, a handful of top-level
6159 /// declarations will be split into separate output files even in the absence
6160 /// of an explicit output file attribute.
6161 void SharedEmitterState::gatherFiles(bool separateModules) {
6162 
6163  /// Collect all the inner names from the specified module and add them to the
6164  /// IRCache. Declarations (named things) only exist at the top level of the
6165  /// module. Also keep track of any modules that contain bind operations.
6166  /// These are non-hierarchical references which we need to be careful about
6167  /// during emission.
6168  auto collectInstanceSymbolsAndBinds = [&](Operation *moduleOp) {
6169  moduleOp->walk([&](Operation *op) {
6170  // Populate the symbolCache with all operations that can define a symbol.
6171  if (auto name = op->getAttrOfType<InnerSymAttr>(
6172  hw::InnerSymbolTable::getInnerSymbolAttrName()))
6173  symbolCache.addDefinition(moduleOp->getAttrOfType<StringAttr>(
6174  SymbolTable::getSymbolAttrName()),
6175  name.getSymName(), op);
6176  if (isa<BindOp>(op))
6177  modulesContainingBinds.insert(moduleOp);
6178  });
6179  };
6180 
6181  /// Collect any port marked as being referenced via symbol.
6182  auto collectPorts = [&](auto moduleOp) {
6183  auto portInfo = moduleOp.getPortList();
6184  for (auto [i, p] : llvm::enumerate(portInfo)) {
6185  if (!p.attrs || p.attrs.empty())
6186  continue;
6187  for (NamedAttribute portAttr : p.attrs) {
6188  if (auto sym = portAttr.getValue().dyn_cast<InnerSymAttr>()) {
6189  symbolCache.addDefinition(moduleOp.getNameAttr(), sym.getSymName(),
6190  moduleOp, i);
6191  }
6192  }
6193  }
6194  };
6195 
6196  // Create a mapping identifying the files each symbol is emitted to.
6197  DenseMap<StringAttr, SmallVector<emit::FileOp>> symbolsToFiles;
6198  for (auto file : designOp.getOps<emit::FileOp>())
6199  for (auto refs : file.getOps<emit::RefOp>())
6200  symbolsToFiles[refs.getTargetAttr().getAttr()].push_back(file);
6201 
6202  SmallString<32> outputPath;
6203  for (auto &op : *designOp.getBody()) {
6204  auto info = OpFileInfo{&op, replicatedOps.size()};
6205 
6206  bool isFileOp = isa<emit::FileOp, emit::FileListOp>(&op);
6207 
6208  bool hasFileName = false;
6209  bool emitReplicatedOps = !isFileOp;
6210  bool addToFilelist = !isFileOp;
6211 
6212  outputPath.clear();
6213 
6214  // Check if the operation has an explicit `output_file` attribute set. If
6215  // it does, extract the information from the attribute.
6216  auto attr = op.getAttrOfType<hw::OutputFileAttr>("output_file");
6217  if (attr) {
6218  LLVM_DEBUG(llvm::dbgs() << "Found output_file attribute " << attr
6219  << " on " << op << "\n";);
6220  if (!attr.isDirectory())
6221  hasFileName = true;
6222  appendPossiblyAbsolutePath(outputPath, attr.getFilename().getValue());
6223  emitReplicatedOps = attr.getIncludeReplicatedOps().getValue();
6224  addToFilelist = !attr.getExcludeFromFilelist().getValue();
6225  }
6226 
6227  auto separateFile = [&](Operation *op, Twine defaultFileName = "") {
6228  // If we're emitting to a separate file and the output_file attribute
6229  // didn't specify a filename, take the default one if present or emit an
6230  // error if not.
6231  if (!hasFileName) {
6232  if (!defaultFileName.isTriviallyEmpty()) {
6233  llvm::sys::path::append(outputPath, defaultFileName);
6234  } else {
6235  op->emitError("file name unspecified");
6236  encounteredError = true;
6237  llvm::sys::path::append(outputPath, "error.out");
6238  }
6239  }
6240 
6241  auto destFile = StringAttr::get(op->getContext(), outputPath);
6242  auto &file = files[destFile];
6243  file.ops.push_back(info);
6244  file.emitReplicatedOps = emitReplicatedOps;
6245  file.addToFilelist = addToFilelist;
6246  file.isVerilog = outputPath.ends_with(".sv");
6247  };
6248 
6249  // Separate the operation into dedicated output file, or emit into the
6250  // root file, or replicate in all output files.
6251  TypeSwitch<Operation *>(&op)
6252  .Case<emit::FileOp, emit::FileListOp>([&](auto file) {
6253  // Emit file ops to their respective files.
6254  fileMapping.try_emplace(file.getSymNameAttr(), file);
6255  separateFile(file, file.getFileName());
6256  })
6257  .Case<emit::FragmentOp>([&](auto fragment) {
6258  fragmentMapping.try_emplace(fragment.getSymNameAttr(), fragment);
6259  })
6260  .Case<HWModuleOp>([&](auto mod) {
6261  // Build the IR cache.
6262  auto sym = mod.getNameAttr();
6263  symbolCache.addDefinition(sym, mod);
6264  collectPorts(mod);
6265  collectInstanceSymbolsAndBinds(mod);
6266 
6267  if (auto it = symbolsToFiles.find(sym); it != symbolsToFiles.end()) {
6268  if (it->second.size() != 1 || attr) {
6269  // This is a temporary check, present as long as both
6270  // output_file and file operations are used.
6271  op.emitError("modules can be emitted to a single file");
6272  encounteredError = true;
6273  } else {
6274  // The op is not separated into a file as it will be
6275  // pulled into the unique file operation it references.
6276  }
6277  } else {
6278  // Emit into a separate file named after the module.
6279  if (attr || separateModules)
6280  separateFile(mod, getVerilogModuleName(mod) + ".sv");
6281  else
6282  rootFile.ops.push_back(info);
6283  }
6284  })
6285  .Case<InterfaceOp>([&](InterfaceOp intf) {
6286  // Build the IR cache.
6287  symbolCache.addDefinition(intf.getNameAttr(), intf);
6288  // Populate the symbolCache with all operations that can define a
6289  // symbol.
6290  for (auto &op : *intf.getBodyBlock())
6291  if (auto symOp = dyn_cast<mlir::SymbolOpInterface>(op))
6292  if (auto name = symOp.getNameAttr())
6293  symbolCache.addDefinition(name, symOp);
6294 
6295  // Emit into a separate file named after the interface.
6296  if (attr || separateModules)
6297  separateFile(intf, intf.getSymName() + ".sv");
6298  else
6299  rootFile.ops.push_back(info);
6300  })
6301  .Case<HWModuleExternOp>([&](HWModuleExternOp op) {
6302  // Build the IR cache.
6303  symbolCache.addDefinition(op.getNameAttr(), op);
6304  collectPorts(op);
6305  if (separateModules)
6306  separateFile(op, "extern_modules.sv");
6307  else
6308  rootFile.ops.push_back(info);
6309  })
6310  .Case<VerbatimOp, IfDefOp, MacroDefOp>([&](Operation *op) {
6311  // Emit into a separate file using the specified file name or
6312  // replicate the operation in each outputfile.
6313  if (!attr) {
6314  replicatedOps.push_back(op);
6315  } else
6316  separateFile(op, "");
6317  })
6318  .Case<HWGeneratorSchemaOp>([&](HWGeneratorSchemaOp schemaOp) {
6319  symbolCache.addDefinition(schemaOp.getNameAttr(), schemaOp);
6320  })
6321  .Case<HierPathOp>([&](HierPathOp hierPathOp) {
6322  symbolCache.addDefinition(hierPathOp.getSymNameAttr(), hierPathOp);
6323  })
6324  .Case<TypeScopeOp>([&](TypeScopeOp op) {
6325  symbolCache.addDefinition(op.getNameAttr(), op);
6326  // TODO: How do we want to handle typedefs in a split output?
6327  if (!attr) {
6328  replicatedOps.push_back(op);
6329  } else
6330  separateFile(op, "");
6331  })
6332  .Case<BindOp>([&](auto op) {
6333  if (!attr) {
6334  separateFile(op, "bindfile.sv");
6335  } else {
6336  separateFile(op);
6337  }
6338  })
6339  .Case<MacroDeclOp>([&](auto op) {
6340  symbolCache.addDefinition(op.getSymNameAttr(), op);
6341  })
6342  .Case<om::ClassLike>([&](auto op) {
6343  symbolCache.addDefinition(op.getSymNameAttr(), op);
6344  })
6345  .Case<om::ConstantOp>([&](auto op) {
6346  // Constant ops might reference symbols, skip them.
6347  })
6348  .Default([&](auto *) {
6349  op.emitError("unknown operation (SharedEmitterState::gatherFiles)");
6350  encounteredError = true;
6351  });
6352  }
6353 
6354  // We've built the whole symbol cache. Freeze it so things can start
6355  // querying it (potentially concurrently).
6356  symbolCache.freeze();
6357 }
6358 
6359 /// Given a FileInfo, collect all the replicated and designated operations
6360 /// that go into it and append them to "thingsToEmit".
6361 void SharedEmitterState::collectOpsForFile(const FileInfo &file,
6362  EmissionList &thingsToEmit,
6363  bool emitHeader) {
6364  // Include the version string comment when the file is verilog.
6365  if (file.isVerilog && !options.omitVersionComment)
6366  thingsToEmit.emplace_back(circt::getCirctVersionComment());
6367 
6368  // If we're emitting replicated ops, keep track of where we are in the list.
6369  size_t lastReplicatedOp = 0;
6370 
6371  bool emitHeaderInclude =
6372  emitHeader && file.emitReplicatedOps && !file.isHeader;
6373 
6374  if (emitHeaderInclude)
6375  thingsToEmit.emplace_back(circtHeaderInclude);
6376 
6377  size_t numReplicatedOps =
6378  file.emitReplicatedOps && !emitHeaderInclude ? replicatedOps.size() : 0;
6379 
6380  // Emit each operation in the file preceded by the replicated ops not yet
6381  // printed.
6382  DenseSet<emit::FragmentOp> includedFragments;
6383  for (const auto &opInfo : file.ops) {
6384  Operation *op = opInfo.op;
6385 
6386  // Emit the replicated per-file operations before the main operation's
6387  // position (if enabled).
6388  for (; lastReplicatedOp < std::min(opInfo.position, numReplicatedOps);
6389  ++lastReplicatedOp)
6390  thingsToEmit.emplace_back(replicatedOps[lastReplicatedOp]);
6391 
6392  // Pull in the fragments that the op references. In one file, each
6393  // fragment is emitted only once.
6394  if (auto fragments =
6395  op->getAttrOfType<ArrayAttr>(emit::getFragmentsAttrName())) {
6396  for (auto sym : fragments.getAsRange<FlatSymbolRefAttr>()) {
6397  auto it = fragmentMapping.find(sym.getAttr());
6398  if (it == fragmentMapping.end()) {
6399  encounteredError = true;
6400  op->emitError("cannot find referenced fragment ") << sym;
6401  continue;
6402  }
6403  emit::FragmentOp fragment = it->second;
6404  if (includedFragments.insert(fragment).second) {
6405  thingsToEmit.emplace_back(it->second);
6406  }
6407  }
6408  }
6409 
6410  // Emit the operation itself.
6411  thingsToEmit.emplace_back(op);
6412  }
6413 
6414  // Emit the replicated per-file operations after the last operation (if
6415  // enabled).
6416  for (; lastReplicatedOp < numReplicatedOps; lastReplicatedOp++)
6417  thingsToEmit.emplace_back(replicatedOps[lastReplicatedOp]);
6418 }
6419 
6420 static void emitOperation(VerilogEmitterState &state, Operation *op) {
6421  TypeSwitch<Operation *>(op)
6422  .Case<HWModuleOp>([&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitHWModule(op); })
6423  .Case<HWModuleExternOp>(
6424  [&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitHWExternModule(op); })
6425  .Case<HWModuleGeneratedOp>(
6426  [&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitHWGeneratedModule(op); })
6427  .Case<HWGeneratorSchemaOp>([&](auto op) { /* Empty */ })
6428  .Case<BindOp>([&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitBind(op); })
6429  .Case<InterfaceOp, VerbatimOp, IfDefOp>(
6430  [&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitStatement(op); })
6431  .Case<TypeScopeOp>([&](auto typedecls) {
6432  ModuleEmitter(state).emitStatement(typedecls);
6433  })
6434  .Case<emit::FileOp, emit::FileListOp, emit::FragmentOp>(
6435  [&](auto op) { FileEmitter(state).emit(op); })
6436  .Case<MacroDefOp>(
6437  [&](auto op) { ModuleEmitter(state).emitStatement(op); })
6438  .Default([&](auto *op) {
6439  state.encounteredError = true;
6440  op->emitError("unknown operation (ExportVerilog::emitOperation)");
6441  });
6442 }
6443 
6444 /// Actually emit the collected list of operations and strings to the
6445 /// specified file.
6446 void SharedEmitterState::emitOps(EmissionList &thingsToEmit,
6447  llvm::formatted_raw_ostream &os,
6448  StringAttr fileName, bool parallelize) {
6449  MLIRContext *context = designOp->getContext();
6450 
6451  // Disable parallelization overhead if MLIR threading is disabled.
6452  if (parallelize)
6453  parallelize &= context->isMultithreadingEnabled();
6454 
6455  // If we aren't parallelizing output, directly output each operation to the
6456  // specified stream.
6457  if (!parallelize) {
6458  // All the modules share the same map to store the verilog output location
6459  // on the stream.
6460  OpLocMap verilogLocMap(os);
6461  VerilogEmitterState state(designOp, *this, options, symbolCache,
6462  globalNames, fileMapping, os, fileName,
6463  verilogLocMap);
6464  size_t lineOffset = 0;
6465  for (auto &entry : thingsToEmit) {
6466  entry.verilogLocs.setStream(os);
6467  if (auto *op = entry.getOperation()) {
6468  emitOperation(state, op);
6469  // Since the modules are exported sequentially, update all the ops with
6470  // the verilog location. This also clears the map, so that the map only
6471  // contains the current iteration's ops.
6472  state.addVerilogLocToOps(lineOffset, fileName);
6473  } else {
6474  os << entry.getStringData();
6475  ++lineOffset;
6476  }
6477  }
6478 
6479  if (state.encounteredError)
6480  encounteredError = true;
6481  return;
6482  }
6483 
6484  // If we are parallelizing emission, we emit each independent operation to a
6485  // string buffer in parallel, then concat at the end.
6486  parallelForEach(context, thingsToEmit, [&](StringOrOpToEmit &stringOrOp) {
6487  auto *op = stringOrOp.getOperation();
6488  if (!op)
6489  return; // Ignore things that are already strings.
6490 
6491  // BindOp emission reaches into the hw.module of the instance, and that
6492  // body may be being transformed by its own emission. Defer their
6493  // emission to the serial phase. They are speedy to emit anyway.
6494  if (isa<BindOp>(op) || modulesContainingBinds.count(op))
6495  return;
6496 
6497  SmallString<256> buffer;
6498  llvm::raw_svector_ostream tmpStream(buffer);
6499  llvm::formatted_raw_ostream rs(tmpStream);
6500  // Each `thingToEmit` (op) uses a unique map to store verilog locations.
6501  stringOrOp.verilogLocs.setStream(rs);
6502  VerilogEmitterState state(designOp, *this, options, symbolCache,
6503  globalNames, fileMapping, rs, fileName,
6504  stringOrOp.verilogLocs);
6505  emitOperation(state, op);
6506  stringOrOp.setString(buffer);
6507  });
6508 
6509  // Finally emit each entry now that we know it is a string.
6510  for (auto &entry : thingsToEmit) {
6511  // Almost everything is lowered to a string, just concat the strings onto
6512  // the output stream.
6513  auto *op = entry.getOperation();
6514  if (!op) {
6515  auto lineOffset = os.getLine() + 1;
6516  os << entry.getStringData();
6517  // Ensure the line numbers are offset properly in the map. Each `entry`
6518  // was exported in parallel onto independent string streams, hence the
6519  // line numbers need to be updated with the offset in the current stream.
6520  entry.verilogLocs.updateIRWithLoc(lineOffset, fileName, context);
6521  continue;
6522  }
6523  entry.verilogLocs.setStream(os);
6524 
6525  // If this wasn't emitted to a string (e.g. it is a bind) do so now.
6526  VerilogEmitterState state(designOp, *this, options, symbolCache,
6527  globalNames, fileMapping, os, fileName,
6528  entry.verilogLocs);
6529  emitOperation(state, op);
6530  state.addVerilogLocToOps(0, fileName);
6531  }
6532 }
6533 
6534 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6535 // Unified Emitter
6536 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6537 
6538 static LogicalResult exportVerilogImpl(ModuleOp module, llvm::raw_ostream &os) {
6539  LoweringOptions options(module);
6540  GlobalNameTable globalNames = legalizeGlobalNames(module, options);
6541 
6542  SharedEmitterState emitter(module, options, std::move(globalNames));
6543  emitter.gatherFiles(false);
6544 
6545  if (emitter.options.emitReplicatedOpsToHeader)
6546  module.emitWarning()
6547  << "`emitReplicatedOpsToHeader` option is enabled but an header is "
6548  "created only at SplitExportVerilog";
6549 
6550  SharedEmitterState::EmissionList list;
6551 
6552  // Collect the contents of the main file. This is a container for anything
6553  // not explicitly split out into a separate file.
6554  emitter.collectOpsForFile(emitter.rootFile, list);
6555 
6556  // Emit the separate files.
6557  for (const auto &it : emitter.files) {
6558  list.emplace_back("\n// ----- 8< ----- FILE \"" + it.first.str() +
6559  "\" ----- 8< -----\n\n");
6560  emitter.collectOpsForFile(it.second, list);
6561  }
6562 
6563  // Emit the filelists.
6564  for (auto &it : emitter.fileLists) {
6565  std::string contents("\n// ----- 8< ----- FILE \"" + it.first().str() +
6566  "\" ----- 8< -----\n\n");
6567  for (auto &name : it.second)
6568  contents += name.str() + "\n";
6569  list.emplace_back(contents);
6570  }
6571 
6572  llvm::formatted_raw_ostream rs(os);
6573  // Finally, emit all the ops we collected.
6574  // output file name is not known, it can be specified as command line
6575  // argument.
6576  emitter.emitOps(list, rs, StringAttr::get(module.getContext(), ""),
6577  /*parallelize=*/true);
6578  return failure(emitter.encounteredError);
6579 }
6580 
6581 LogicalResult circt::exportVerilog(ModuleOp module, llvm::raw_ostream &os) {
6582  LoweringOptions options(module);
6583  if (failed(lowerHWInstanceChoices(module)))
6584  return failure();
6585  SmallVector<HWModuleOp> modulesToPrepare;
6586  module.walk([&](HWModuleOp op) { modulesToPrepare.push_back(op); });
6587  if (failed(failableParallelForEach(
6588  module->getContext(), modulesToPrepare,
6589  [&](auto op) { return prepareHWModule(op, options); })))
6590  return failure();
6591  return exportVerilogImpl(module, os);
6592 }
6593 
6594 namespace {
6595 
6596 struct ExportVerilogPass : public ExportVerilogBase<ExportVerilogPass> {
6597  ExportVerilogPass(raw_ostream &os) : os(os) {}
6598  void runOnOperation() override {
6599  // Prepare the ops in the module for emission.
6600  mlir::OpPassManager preparePM("builtin.module");
6601  preparePM.addPass(createLegalizeAnonEnumsPass());
6602  preparePM.addPass(createHWLowerInstanceChoicesPass());
6603  auto &modulePM = preparePM.nest<hw::HWModuleOp>();
6604  modulePM.addPass(createPrepareForEmissionPass());
6605  if (failed(runPipeline(preparePM, getOperation())))
6606  return signalPassFailure();
6607 
6608  if (failed(exportVerilogImpl(getOperation(), os)))
6609  return signalPassFailure();
6610  }
6611 
6612 private:
6613  raw_ostream &os;
6614 };

6641 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6642 // Split Emitter
6643 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6644 
6645 static std::unique_ptr<llvm::ToolOutputFile>
6646 createOutputFile(StringRef fileName, StringRef dirname,
6647  SharedEmitterState &emitter) {
6648  // Determine the output path from the output directory and filename.
6649  SmallString<128> outputFilename(dirname);
6650  appendPossiblyAbsolutePath(outputFilename, fileName);
6651  auto outputDir = llvm::sys::path::parent_path(outputFilename);
6652 
6653  // Create the output directory if needed.
6654  std::error_code error = llvm::sys::fs::create_directories(outputDir);
6655  if (error) {
6656  emitter.designOp.emitError("cannot create output directory \"")
6657  << outputDir << "\": " << error.message();
6658  emitter.encounteredError = true;
6659  return {};
6660  }
6661 
6662  // Open the output file.
6663  std::string errorMessage;
6664  auto output = mlir::openOutputFile(outputFilename, &errorMessage);
6665  if (!output) {
6666  emitter.designOp.emitError(errorMessage);
6667  emitter.encounteredError = true;
6668  }
6669  return output;
6670 }
6671 
6672 static void createSplitOutputFile(StringAttr fileName, FileInfo &file,
6673  StringRef dirname,
6674  SharedEmitterState &emitter) {
6675  auto output = createOutputFile(fileName, dirname, emitter);
6676  if (!output)
6677  return;
6678 
6679  SharedEmitterState::EmissionList list;
6680  emitter.collectOpsForFile(file, list,
6681  emitter.options.emitReplicatedOpsToHeader);
6682 
6683  llvm::formatted_raw_ostream rs(output->os());
6684  // Emit the file, copying the global options into the individual module
6685  // state. Don't parallelize emission of the ops within this file - we
6686  // already parallelize per-file emission and we pay a string copy overhead
6687  // for parallelization.
6688  emitter.emitOps(list, rs,
6689  StringAttr::get(fileName.getContext(), output->getFilename()),
6690  /*parallelize=*/false);
6691  output->keep();
6692 }
6693 
6694 static LogicalResult exportSplitVerilogImpl(ModuleOp module,
6695  StringRef dirname) {
6696  // Prepare the ops in the module for emission and legalize the names that will
6697  // end up in the output.
6698  LoweringOptions options(module);
6699  GlobalNameTable globalNames = legalizeGlobalNames(module, options);
6700 
6701  SharedEmitterState emitter(module, options, std::move(globalNames));
6702  emitter.gatherFiles(true);
6703 
6704  if (emitter.options.emitReplicatedOpsToHeader) {
6705  // Add a header to the file list.
6706  bool insertSuccess =
6707  emitter.files
6708  .insert({StringAttr::get(module.getContext(), circtHeader),
6709  FileInfo{/*ops*/ {},
6710  /*emitReplicatedOps*/ true,
6711  /*addToFilelist*/ true,
6712  /*isHeader*/ true}})
6713  .second;
6714  if (!insertSuccess) {
6715  module.emitError() << "tried to emit a heder to " << circtHeader
6716  << ", but the file is used as an output too.";
6717  return failure();
6718  }
6719  }
6720 
6721  // Emit each file in parallel if context enables it.
6722  parallelForEach(module->getContext(), emitter.files.begin(),
6723  emitter.files.end(), [&](auto &it) {
6724  createSplitOutputFile(it.first, it.second, dirname,
6725  emitter);
6726  });
6727 
6728  // Write the file list.
6729  SmallString<128> filelistPath(dirname);
6730  llvm::sys::path::append(filelistPath, "filelist.f");
6731 
6732  std::string errorMessage;
6733  auto output = mlir::openOutputFile(filelistPath, &errorMessage);
6734  if (!output) {
6735  module->emitError(errorMessage);
6736  return failure();
6737  }
6738 
6739  for (const auto &it : emitter.files) {
6740  if (it.second.addToFilelist)
6741  output->os() << it.first.str() << "\n";
6742  }
6743  output->keep();
6744 
6745  // Emit the filelists.
6746  for (auto &it : emitter.fileLists) {
6747  auto output = createOutputFile(it.first(), dirname, emitter);
6748  if (!output)
6749  continue;
6750  for (auto &name : it.second)
6751  output->os() << name.str() << "\n";
6752  output->keep();
6753  }
6754 
6755  return failure(emitter.encounteredError);
6756 }
6757 
6758 LogicalResult circt::exportSplitVerilog(ModuleOp module, StringRef dirname) {
6759  LoweringOptions options(module);
6760  if (failed(lowerHWInstanceChoices(module)))
6761  return failure();
6762  SmallVector<HWModuleOp> modulesToPrepare;
6763  module.walk([&](HWModuleOp op) { modulesToPrepare.push_back(op); });
6764  if (failed(failableParallelForEach(
6765  module->getContext(), modulesToPrepare,
6766  [&](auto op) { return prepareHWModule(op, options); })))
6767  return failure();
6768 
6769  return exportSplitVerilogImpl(module, dirname);
6770 }
6771 
6772 namespace {
6773 
6774 struct ExportSplitVerilogPass
6775  : public ExportSplitVerilogBase<ExportSplitVerilogPass> {
6776  ExportSplitVerilogPass(StringRef directory) {
6777  directoryName = directory.str();
6778  }
6779  void runOnOperation() override {
6780  // Prepare the ops in the module for emission.
6781  mlir::OpPassManager preparePM("builtin.module");
6782  preparePM.addPass(createHWLowerInstanceChoicesPass());
6783 
6784  auto &modulePM = preparePM.nest<hw::HWModuleOp>();
6785  modulePM.addPass(createPrepareForEmissionPass());
6786  if (failed(runPipeline(preparePM, getOperation())))
6787  return signalPassFailure();
6788 
6789  if (failed(exportSplitVerilogImpl(getOperation(), directoryName)))
6790  return signalPassFailure();
6791  }
6792 };
6793 } // end anonymous namespace
6794

6796 circt::createExportSplitVerilogPass(StringRef directory) {

6798 }
